loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “GRAN RENOVACION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nilda; ella tiene 56 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. productos D. belleza, ella venD. lápices labiales, perfumes, cremas entre otros productos D. belleza, ella venD. en forma independiente llevando a diferentes lugares como instituciones y público en general, la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio D. venta D. productos D. belleza. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos D. belleza al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the communal bank "GRAN RENOVACION" [Great Renovation]. This bank is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

The partner is Nilda. She is 56 years old, is married, and has two children. She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling beauty products. She sells lipstick, perfume, and creams among other beauty products. She sells in an independent way, taking her products to different places such as institutions and the public in general. She wants to improve and enlarge the beauty products sales business. She is asking for this loan to buy wholesale beauty products.

She is happy because of the loan, and she promises to follow through with the payments of her dues.

loans.use: to buy wholesale beauty products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to improve her sales of catalogue products.

loans.name: Rosense

texts.en:
Rosense is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Rosense has a retail shop that sells biscuits, breads & canned goods. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy snacks, canned goods, & beverages.

Rosense is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Rosense hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, canned goods, & beverages.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha Lorena tiene 45 años. Ella se dedica a la actividad económica de venta de tortillas, frijoles cocidos y café. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, inicio como una alternativa de trabajo, la ubicación de su negocio es en su humilde vivienda por lo que inicio por cuenta propia ya que anteriormente no trabajaba y necesitaba cubrir los gastos de su casa. Es por eso que el propósito de ella es comprar vasos, café, frijoles, maíz, entre otros para invertir un poco en cada producto. Sus deseos son establecer un negocio en el mercado, en donde transitan más clientes.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena is 45 years old.  She sells tortillas, cooked beans and coffee.  She’s been in this business for over three years.  She started out at it  as an alternative job.  Her business is located in her humble abode since she started it on her own because previously she did not work and needed to cover household expenses. 

The purpose of the loan is to buy drinking glasses, coffee, beans and corn, among others to invest a bit in each product.  Her wish is to establish a business in the market where more customers abound.

loans.use: to buy drinking glasses, coffee, beans and corn.

loans.name: Sifa

texts.en:
Sifa lives in Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is in school. Sifa lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and food for the family.   

Sifa has a business of selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for five years, and she works seven days out of every week. 

Sifa sells her products at the market by means of retail.  

Sifa has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. The main business challenges for Sifa include seasonality and thieves.

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing clothes and also to buy her own plot of land so that she can build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Levi

texts.en:
Levi is a single parent who has two children. He is 30 years old and he is engaged in hog raising. This has been his business since his wife left. He is still hoping that someday his wife will come back for the sake of their children. 

Now, he is working so hard to meet the financial needs of his two daughters in school. Levi performs his responsibility as both mother and father to his children.

He is requesting a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy feed and vitamins for the pigs he raises. In doing this, he will be able to maintain the good health of his pigs. He wants to earn a higher income because he is saving for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Emma has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, beverages and breads. She has had this business for five years. Emma requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Emma has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Emma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en: Gayane rents out wedding dresses. Gayane would like to increase the number and the variety of dresses for the coming high season, as it is very popular in Armenia to have weddings in autumn. With the help of this loan, Gayane will increase her business income and develop her business further. Gayane dreams of opening a new trading booth in the future.

loans.use: to pay for wedding dresses to rent out.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is 38-years-old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 3 children. 

Alberto has a food shop, or carenderia, that makes & sells viands (food items or tasty dishes) like pinakbit, adobo & sampayna. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

Alberto is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Alberto hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

loans.name: Joselyn

texts.en:
Joselyn is 42 years old and married. She has eight children.

Joselyn works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells brooms and bags in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

Joselyn has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the brooms and bags business for 10 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Joselyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 25 years old and is single. He sells secondhand clothes. Paul has been in this business for three years and is open from 8:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m. every day except on Saturday, and he currently employs one person to help him. 

Paul has requested a loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more secondhand clothes to sell. With any profits, he would like to save money and reinvest in this business. Paul also hopes to buy a cow.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Dwighta

texts.en:
This is Dwighta, who is 55 and a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is single and manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Dwighta operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5-pesos worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, she also retails mineral water for added income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippines pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Dwighta hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Lisi

texts.es: Lisi, de 27 años, es una mujer joven, soñadora y muy amable. Vive con pareja con quien tiene dos hijos de 8 y 4 años en su casa propia. Ella y su pareja trabajan mucho para así poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. El trabajo de Lisi consiste en la venta de zapatos, sandalias, zapatillas y más, trabaja en forma ambulante en el mercado de su ciudad; asimismo posee un puesto de venta donde su esposa se hacer cargo. Se siente muy a gusto haciendo lo que hace ya que le es retribuido en los buenos ingresos que tiene, pero necesita de alguna ayuda adicional ya que se quiere preparar para la campaña navideña próxima. Le esta yendo bien ya que vende mucho pero a falta de inversión es que no aumenta su capital, tiene planes como ampliar su local.  Este será el primer crédito  con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio, además se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería, entre las cosas que comprará será sandalias, zapatillas, zapatos y algunos otros productos hasta donde alcance su presupuesto.
texts.en:
27-year-old Lisi is a very kind young woman with dreams.  She lives with her partner and they have two children aged 8 and 4.  They live in their own home.  Lisi and her partner work hard so that they can provide their children with a better quality of life.

Lisi's business is selling shoes, sandals, sneakers, etc.  She works as an itinerant vendor in the town market.  She also has a sales location that her partner runs.  She feels very happy doing what she does because she is rewarded with the good income that she makes.  However, she needs some additional help as she would like to get ready for the upcoming Christmas season.  Her business is doing well as she sells a lot but, owing to a lack of investment, she cannot increase her capital.  She has plans to expand her sales premises.

This will be Lisi's first loan from MFP.  She is very happy to know that she will have financial support as this will make her feel sure of making progress in her business.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time.  Lisi will use the sum she has requested to buy a larger quantity of merchandise.  She will buy sandals, sneakers, shoes and some other products so far as her budget reaches.

loans.use: to buy more shoes, sandals and sneakers

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La señora Hilda es socia del banco comunal Bellavista del distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 50 años de edad, está casad y tiene tres hijos, solo 2 de ellos están a su cargo.
Son ocho años que viene trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de desayunos, todas las mañanas saca sus mesas y sombrillas para dar más comodidad  a sus comensales, que son en su mayoría colegiales.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: una refrigeradora, una extractora, una olla mediana, servilletas, ½ saco de azúcar, panes, mayonesa, 2 docenas de vasos grandes de vidrio.
Los hijos que tiene a su cargo, son los que le ayudan a sacar sus mesas y demás enseres que necesita para trabajar, hasta las diez de la mañana y el resto del tiempo lo ocupa realizando sus quehaceres propios de su hogar, su esposo  trabaja en construcción civil y es el encargado de pagar todo los gastos de la familia.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos por prestarle la ayuda necesaria en el debido momento y con el cual sigue trabajando para poder ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the “Bellavista” communal bank in Callería District, Ucayali Department.  She’s 50 years old, married and has three children but only two of them are still in her care. 

She’s been working with Manuela Ramos loans for 8 years.  She sells breakfasts.  Every morning she sets up her umbrellas and tables to provide more comfort for her diners who are school children for the most part.

She will use her new, 3000 new sol, loan to buy: a refrigerator, a juice extractor, a medium sized pot, napkins, ½ sack of sugar, bread, mayonnaise, 2 dozen large glass drinking glasses.

The children still in her care help her set up the tables and other utensils she needs to work.  She works until 10am and the rest of the time she does her household chores.  Her husband works in civil construction and he takes care of paying all family expenses.

Thanks to Manuela Ramos for providing her with the needed support at the right moment with which she continues working to help her children.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and a juice extractor.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es: Maruja, de 30 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y entusiasta, además de alegre y extrovertida, es conviviente con Mario que es empleado de una entidad privada. Vive en compañía de sus tres hijos de 14, 11 y 3 años de edad, instalado en su casa propia. El negocio que realiza Maruja es la confección de prendas de vestir como lencerías para damas y ropa intima para niños, oficio que aprendió en un centro de educación ocupacional e iniciando con la compra de una maquina de coser con su propio capital, y lo instaló en su casa, realizando  trabajos pequeños de vecinos y familiares. Con el tiempo haría en gran número las prendas, siendos estas ya exhibidas en una vitrina que esta en su casa, y manifiesta que son su orgullo. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que se dedica al oficio que le gusta, el poder crear sus propios diseños, además del ingreso económico que le genera para solventar  sus gastos. Por lo contario, lo que no le gusta es que su maquina se malogra muy continuamente deseando comprar otra, además de eso tiene planes de abrir una boutique en alguna parte de la ciudad. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado, se siente bien con su grupo de su banco comunal pues los considera buenas personas. Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles, comprará una maquina de coser nueva,  valorizada en 700 nuevos soles, y con el saldo comprará materiales de confección como telas, hilos, elásticos.
texts.en:
Maruja is 30 years old and is a hardworking, enthusiastic, friendly, and extraverted woman.  She has a home of her own and cohabitates with Mario who works for a private company, and with her three children, ages 14, 11, and 3.

Maruja makes clothing, such as lingerie for women and children’s undergarments.  She learned to do this at a learning center and began by buying a sewing machine with her own money, setting up a workshop in her home, and doing small jobs for her family and neighbors.  As time passed she made a large number of articles and shows her pride in her work by displaying items in a display case in her home.

What she enjoys about this business, besides the income that allows her to cover her expenses, is being able to create her own designs.  What she doesn’t like is that her sewing machine breaks down often and she wants to buy another one.  She also plans to open a boutique somewhere in town.

This will be her second loan through MFP and she hopes for your cooperation so that she can solidify her plans.  She also feels good with her communal bank because she considers its members to be good people.  She will use the money from this loan of 1,200 PEN to buy a new 700 PEN sewing machine and supplies such as fabrics, threads, and elastic.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and supplies.

loans.name: Jessa Veronica

texts.en:
Jessa Veronica is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 
Jessa Veronica has a shop that sells electronic loads for several networks such as GLOBE and SMART. She has run this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of electronic loads for resale.
Jessa Veronica has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of electronic loads for resale.

loans.name: Maria Linda

texts.en:
Maria Linda is 51 years old and married with 1 child. She works hard to provide for her family. Maria Linda has operated a sari sari (variety) store in the Philippines for 3 years. She also earns additional income from billiards. Maria Linda has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as soap and groceries to sell in her store.

Maria Linda has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as soap and groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anushik

texts.en:
Anushik lives in Mrgavet village with her husband and children. She maintains a glasshouse, where she grows flowers.

Anushik is applying for a loan to purchase fuel and to be able to continue growing flowers during the winter months. In this way, the loan will help Anushik to stabilize her business and to expand it in the future.

loans.use: to pay for fuel and to grow flowers during the winter

loans.name: Zhyldyz

texts.ru: Жылдыз, 30 лет, замужем, 2 детей. Жылдыз на протяжении 9 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Жылдыз, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы и 20 овец. Также она арендует 1,44 Га земли, и есть 0,48 Га собственного земельного надела, где выращивает фасоль, картофель и другие овощи для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. На ежедневной основе продает молоко. Бизнес Жылдыз в месяц приносит около 8,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья дойных коров. Жылдыз планирует приобрести одну дойную корову, что позволит в будущем увеличить объемы реализации экологически чистого молока. Доходы от кредита Жылдыз планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Zhyldyz is 30 years old, married and has two children. For the last nine years, Zhyldyz has been practicing livestock breeding and crop farming. Thanks to Zhyldyz's hard work, she currently has 3 cows and 20 sheep on her farm. She also rents a 1.44 hectare plot of land and owns a 0.48 hectare plot of land on which she grows beans for personal consumption and sale. She mainly sells milk every day. Zhyldyz's business brings in about 8,500 som (KGS) each month. For the further development of her business, she turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 150,000 som (KGS) to increase her number of dairy cows. Zhyldyz plans to buy one dairy cow which will allow her to increase her volume of organic milk sales in the future. Zhyldyz plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further accrual of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase one dairy cow in order to increase her volume of organic milk sales.

loans.name: Ion

texts.en: Driving up the hill towards the village of Brinza, the most noticeable thing is a large gas station. Like most everywhere in the world, gas stations in Moldova are neat and modern looking, so it makes a good landmark and a convenient stop for motorists. All the activity is great for business at Ion’s auto repair station, located in a small building adjacent to the gas station’s entrance. Here he and his one employee offer wheel balancing and tire repair, as well as regular maintenance services. He has been a mechanic for seven years and easily assesses the needs of the vehicles that stop by. He needs a loan to purchase some newer equipment that will allow him to both work more efficiently and also to offer more services, including wheel alignments.

loans.use: Equipment purchases

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She would like to buy a water tank

loans.name: Inés Guadalupe

texts.en:
Inés is a hardworking and responsible woman, with a 12 years old son and a pretty, 8 years old daughter. Two years ago, she separated from her husband, and since she no longer has his support, she decided to start her own business to provide for her children. Ever since, she has been selling clothing and cosmetics. These activities have also permitted her to make time available to be with her children. Life hasn't been easy for Inés, as she now carries the responsibility for her family alone, but her love for her children motivate her to get ahead.

To increase her sales, Inés requests a loan of $375, which she will use to buy merchandise that is on sale, which she will use to sell at a special price to her customers. This will allow her to grow her customer base. She plans to repay the money in 6 to 12 months.

You can be an important enabler of Inés' accomplishments. She needs your help to grow her business and improve the quality of living for her children. So stop pondering, and help her out!

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Inés es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, tiene un hijo de 12 años y una preciosa hija de 8 años de edad. Hace dos años se separó de su esposo y al no contar con el apoyo de su pareja, inició su propio negocio para poder darles lo necesario a sus hijos, desde entonces se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos, esta actividad también le ha permitido tener el tiempo para atender a sus hijos. No ha sido fácil para Inés tener toda la responsabilidad de su hogar ella sola, pero el amor hacia sus hijos la motivan a seguir adelante.

Para incrementar sus ventas Inés solicita un préstamo de $ 375 dólares, que utilizará en la compra de mercancía en promoción que podrá vender a precios especiales e incrementar sus clientes, ella planea devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses.

Tú puedes ser parte importante en los logros de Inés, ella necesita de tu ayuda para hacer crecer su negocio y darles una mejor vida a sus hijos, no lo pienses más y decídete a apoyarla.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Umri

texts.en:
Umri started her business over 8 years ago. She is married and has three children. All of them help Umri in her activity.

From the beginning Umri baked her products herself. She baked pirogue, cakes, pastries, fancy cakes and so on. Her two daughters baked confectionery with their mother. Her son helped to bring her product to the market. Umri concluded an agreement with several food shops to sell her goods there. Gradually, she was able to save enough money to have her own stall in the confectionery section in Panjshanbe market. Today, Umri's stall has become one of the best known places in the market. She has a lot of clients who come back to her over and over. She sells her products in a short time and so has a fast turnover of her working capital.

Umri became a client of Micro Invest in May 2007. Her first loan was about USD 300, which she spent to purchase 2 sacks of flour. She hopes to spend this second loan from KIVA investors to rent another refrigerated case to display her baked goods.

loans.use: Renting another refrigerated display case for her baked goods

loans.name: Koreti

texts.en: Koreti is married with 3 children. She is 47 years of age, and coming from a poor family background, she decided to join SPBD. She heard more about the programme through the women in the village and she thought this is where she could be able to get financial support. She used her first loan with SPBD to buy for cramoxone chemical, some fertilizers, and other equipment needed for the farm. Koreti and her husband are working very hard on their farm and they continue to grow more taros to keep increasing their farm's yield.

loans.use: To assist her taro plantation.

loans.name: Tofig

texts.en: Tofig I. is an Internally Displaced Person from the Fuzuli region of Azerbaijan.  He has been living in Beylagan since 1993. He is 40 years old, is married and has 3 children.  Tofig is a taxi driver.  He has applied to Normicro for a loan in the amount of $900 in order to repair his car and continue his business.

loans.use: To repair his car for his taxi service

loans.name: Leyla

texts.en: Leyla is a mother of 2 children who lives in the Salyan region in the Khaladj village.  She was born in 1969.  Leyla has 10 years of experience in the farming business.  Now, she needs a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Shodali

texts.ru:
Shodali H. is 25 years old, has a secondary school education, is married and has 2 children. Shodali has been farming for two years just like his father Holmurod H. (another Kiva loan applicant). He has land where he plants wheat. Shodali will use his loan to fertilize his land and to purchase seeds for planting. After harvest, local residents will be able to purchase wheat at a lower price than they would pay at the market. They will use the wheat for making flour and bread.

Shodali will pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хакназаров Шодали, возраст – 25 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 2-х детей. Шодали также как и его отец Хакназаров Холмурод, уже в течение 2 лет занимается земледелием. Он также имеет отдельный участок земли для посева пшеницы. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на обработку земли, а также на покупку семян пшеницы для дальнейшего их посева. После сбора урожая местные жители получат возможность приобрести пшеницу по более низкой цене в отличие от рыночной. Так как большинство жителей этого района покупают пшеницу для дальнейшей ее переработки в муку и выпечки хлеба. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Fertilizing the land and planting wheat

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 24 year old young man. Ahmad is single and lives with his family in Tyre, in south Lebanon.
Ahmad sells car tyres and needs a loan to buy new merchandise. Ahmad is a micro entrepreneur who is determined to do the best he can to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise

loans.name: Kiyinki B1 East A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Florence M.. She is currently in the business of clothing sales and is requesting a loan to expand business. Florence is 42 years old and is married. She has 8 children ranging from age 5 to 25 and her children go to school. Each week, Florence makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to re-invest in her business. Florence has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to add to her clothing business and the loan was paid back on time.

Florence is joined in her small group by Stella A., Grace M., Kevin A., and Rehema K.. Stella A. has a business running a retail shop and wants to add stock. Grace M. is currently operating a beauty salon business and wants a loan to purchase a hair dryer. Kevin A. operates a restaurant business and wants to add to her business. Rehema K. is currently in the business of trading produce and is requesting a loan to uplift business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.en:
Mrs. Tran Thi L. is 45 years old and lives in Hanh Lam commune, Hung Yen province. She and her husband have 2 daughters; the elder is at university and the younger is in high school.

Every day she and her husband produce tofu and rice wine. It is actually a hard job as they have to wake up at 1 am and only go to bed late at night. However, they are very happy because their business is profitable and their children study well. "We don’t mind working hard. We just want to earn enough money to send our children to good universities." With this motto, Mrs. Tran Thi L. wants to borrow $625 USD to expand their business.

loans.use: Invest in rice to increase production of rice wine

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence A. is thirty-five years old. She is a divorced mother of three children who are currently in school. She is really industrious and resourceful to provide for the needs of her children and her business. Florence owns and operates a clothing and cosmetic shop in the local market. She believes she can make her business grow bigger and brighter with loan support and wants to use the loan to buy more clothing and assorted cosmetics to increase her stock of goods. She belongs to the community group called Shepherd Trust Group. Members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and assorted cosmetics

loans.name: Mao Khuon Group

texts.en:
Mr. Mao K. is the leader of a four-person business group in Au Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He is 37 years old and the father of three children, two of whom attend school, while the other is too young to work or study.

Mr. Mao K. is a subsistence farmer and a fisherman. In addition, he makes pots in the local village. His wife, Mrs. Chanthorn Ven, is employed in a garment factory. Even though the family is engaged in many different business activities, Mr. Mao K. cannot support the family well, so Mr. Mao K. has decides to start a pig breeding business. He is asking for a loan to buy pigs to raise. Previously, Mr. Mao K. obtained a loan from AMK to buy fertilizer and to hire a pump to water his rice field.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy pigs for raising.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of pork and chicken meat to resell in her neighborhood.

loans.name: Ki

texts.en: Mrs. Ki C. lives in Takul Village in Kandal Province. She makes a living growing different kinds of vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Heang Heng, is a contractor who earns a small income. They have one child who is too young to work or study. Mrs. Ki C.’s family lives in poor conditions in a very old house. Mrs. Ki C. is applying for a loan which she will add to her saving to build a new house. Last year, her child came down with typhus and she had to spend $100 to cure the disease. This is why she does not have enough money to build the house without the loan.

loans.use: To pay for part of the cost of building a new house.

loans.name: Nermina

texts.en:
Nermina is from Banovići and she has one child, five years old. She works as a seamstress in a factory that produces clothes.

This is her first loan, in the amount of 1000 KM. With it she wants to buy chickens. Her goal is to fatten them and after that to sell them and earn additional money for her household. Her salary from the factory is not enough because her husband is a seasonal worker.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena  es propietaria de dos motocarros, al mismo tiempo, se dedica  a la venta de pescado, tiene cuatro hijos menores que estudian. Su esposo Ulises es chofer de uno de los motocarros y realiza transporte de pasajeros, y se encarga de cuidado de estas.En el futuro, desean que sus hijos sean profesionales, es por eso que Elena vende pescado en un puesto del mercado para incrementar los ingresos económicos.Solicita este dinero que será invertido en el mantenimiento y arreglo de sus motos, además de mejorar la venta de su pescado. Apoyemos a esta madre que con esfuerzo y dedicación  sigue trabajando arduamente por prosperar.
texts.en:
Elena is the owner of two motorcars and she also sells fish. She has 4 children, all of whom study. Her husband Ulises is a driver of one of the motorcars and he transports passengers and is in charge of maintaining the motorcars. In the future they hope that their children become professionals, and this is why Elena sells fish from a stand in the market, to increase their income. She is asking for this money to invest in the maintenance and care of their motorcars as well as improve selling fish. We support this mother who with effort and dedication continues working hard in order to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair motorcars and invest in fish selling business

loans.name: Luz Karminia

texts.es:
La señora Luz pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Siete Estrellas”, ubicado en el Jr. Libertadores Nº 299, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 30 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como empleado de Maple Gas. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de néctar. 

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza (EBEL). Se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus pequeños hijos, para luego en las tardes salir a vender sus productos de diferentes aromas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará productos de belleza, actividad que le brinda ganancias para poder pagar su préstamo puntualmente.  
  
Luz demuestra felicidad en su rostro porque ha logrado salir adelante con la ayuda de Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Señora Luz belongs to the communal bank called "The Seven Stars", located in the district of Calleria, in the town of Coronel Portillo in Ucayali. She's 30 years old. She has 2 young children. She's married and her husband works for Maple Gas. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest it in selling fragrances. She currently sells cosmetics Ebel. She gets up early every morning to take care of her little ones and then in the afternoons she goes out to sell her fragrances. With this loan, which she will repay within 6 months, she will purchase beauty products. This business has turned out to be very profitable because she makes enough money to make her payments on time. Luz's face is full of happiness because she's able to move ahead with the help of Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products

loans.name: Mierna

texts.en:
Mierna D., 52, resides at Looc Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena. Blessed with 3 children, they help one another to save their fishing business. Seafood vending is also a big help for added income. They bring their catch to Oroquieta market.

Mierna is considered a Member in Good Standing, having reached her fourth loan. She hopes to expand her business with a loan of PHP 7,000. Faced with various challenges, they are assured of Paglaum MPC’s help. They are fond of the cooperative’s various programs and services, micro-entrepreneurship training among others.

Mierna never considers herself too old to strive for a better living. With her children and Paglaum MPC, she dreams of escalating her business and aspires to have her children have individual business as well.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net and accessories

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena , Misamis Occi

loans.name: Santos Isabel

texts.es: El señor Santos Isabel García tiene la edad de 51 años, habita en el barrio Panamá ubicado en municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa y hijos , la esposa de don Santos le ayuda con la casa ya que ella no trabaja ,los planes de don Santos es mejorar la producción y darle mejor condición de vida a su familia . La ayuda que el recibe es por parte de un hijo el cual trabaja como albañil. Este cliente desde hace treinta  años trabaja como agricultor y por falta de financiamiento y de recursos no ha podido ampliar su plantación. El necesita el apoyo para comprar fertilizantes para aplicarle a sus cultivos y poder vender una buena producción que le genere buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Santos Isabel García is 51 years old and lives with his wife and children in the Panamá neighborhood of Ticuantepe. His wife takes care of their home since she is no longer employed. He has a son who is a construction worker and helps support the family.

Santos has worked for thirty years as a farmer, but due to lack of funding and other resources has not been able to increase his farm's production. His dream is to increase his harvest in order to give his family a higher standard of living. He will use this loan to buy fertilizer for his crops so that he can sell more and generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides for crops

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica A. sells sarongs. She hopes to expand her business by purchasing more sarongs to sell to her customers. Veronica is 51 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Asaba, Delta state, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of N100000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Lucresse

texts.fr:
La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé. 
 
S. Lucresse a 21 ans et elle s’est mariée avec HOUNKOLA Jules. Ils ont deux enfants, Alex et Doris. Doris est scolarisée. Lucresse a commencé avec la vente des arachides il y a 8 ans, et actuellement elle vend les divers et elle est coiffeuse. Le revenu de ses autres crédits lui a permis de construire son lieu d’activité. Avec ce crédit, elle va acheter les œufs pour vendre. Dans l’avenir, elle voudrait commencer par vendre les produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
Lucresse S., 21, is married to Jules Hounkola, and they have two children Alex et Doris. Doris is enrolled in school. Lucresse began selling peanuts 8 years ago and presently she is selling various items and working as a hairdresser. The income from her other loans has allowed her to build her own workplace. With this loan, she plans to buy eggs for re-sale. In future, she would like to begin to sell cosmetics.

The meaning of Alidé in the local language of Benin, Fon, is "another path always exists for the most poor". Benin is a small country in West Africa beside Nigeria, where the GNP per capita is US$ 1,500. Alidé offers special 0% interest loans to very vulnerable clients and it is in a group which will soon be beginning a micro health insurance program.


Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various items for re-sale

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Mrs. Lydia A., 50 years of age and a widow, is a resident of Tipan, Oroquieta City. She was blessed with 2 healthy children. At first she experienced hardship in raising her children because of her status, being a single mother, the only one working to sustain their daily needs.

Lydia thought of a livelihood project that could sustain their financial needs, that is why she came to think of a business in “Pig Selling”. In order for her to have enough capital to buy pigs, she decided to join Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative on August 19, 2008, to be exact. She already received loans last year. And now, she is applying for PHP 10,000 to buy pigs.

Eventually, all her pigs are sold for occasional reasons. She wishes to have a lot of capital to have her own piggery. For this, she knows, would bring a good way of living for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy 5 pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Cassava and corn growing

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en: Eugenia O. has cultivated cereals and grown vegetables and grapes for several years already. She owns 2.3 ha of land and 0.8 ha of Moldova vine. The production is commercialized on both the local market and the market in Cahul. She works at this small business together with her husband. Her long-term plan is to purchase more land near a water source in order to grow more vegetables and grapes. This business seems to be one of importance for Eugenia, as it covers 60% of the family’s expenses.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica B. is divorced with three children and received an education through senior high school. Since 2006 Veronica has worked as a petty trader at Shama Junction selling oil. She uses her income to pay for her family’s various expenses including the water and light bills as well as rent.

Veronica will use the loan to purchase additional oil for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Veronica plans to support her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase additional oil for resale

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.en:
Linh Bui Thi is twenty-eight years old and lives in the town of Quang Xuong.  She is married and has one school-age child.  To make a living, Linh raises livestock.  The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale.  Linh earns approximately $60 a month from these activities.

In 2005, Linh joined the Kiva field partner, TYM Fund, to gain access to financial services that would give her the ability to engage in business activities and thereby improve her living situation. Linh has successfully repaid previous loans from TYM Fund.  These loans were used to invest in expanding her business.  Linh is now requesting a new loan which will be used to purchase breeding livestock.  This will be her fourth loan from TYM Fund.  Linh plans to use the additional revenue generated from this investment to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock.

loans.name: Reynaldo Jose

texts.es: El señor Reynaldo Jose R. tiene la edad de 44 años, además tiene 1 niño de 6 años de edad y es quien ha sido para el la inspiración y el motor de su vida. Su trabajo es el transporte de personas en triciclo y venta de productos de baño tales como: jabón, toallas, cortinas, adornos, etc., productos que su esposa los elabora y que el sale a vender de manera ambulante, el ya tiene mucha experiencia pues se dedica a este oficio desde hace 13 años aproximadamente, y aunque es un oficio cansado, peligroso y agotador, ha sabido desempeñarse excelentemente pues recorre muchas calles en busca de sus clientes. Esta vez Reynaldo solicita un préstamo que le ayude a sufragar gastos en el mejoramiento y mantenimiento de su triciclo e invertir en materia prima para elaborar los productos de baño ya que su meta es tener un ingreso estable e instalar un local que le permita a sus clientes llegar a comprarle.
texts.en:
Reynaldo Jose R. is 44 years old and also has a 6-year-old son who has been his inspiration and driving force.
He makes a living transporting people in his cycle rickshaw and selling bathroom products like: soap, towels, curtains, decorations, etc. His wife makes the products and he goes out and sells them as a street vendor.
Having worked this job for approximately 13 years, he already has a lot of experience. Although this profession is tiring, dangerous and exhausting, he does his job excellently since he covers many streets in search of customers.
This time Reynaldo is requesting a loan to help him pay for the cost of improving and servicing his vehicle, and to also purchase materials used in making the bathroom products. His goal is to have a stable income and to set up a store where customers could come and buy from him.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia M. raises hogs. She is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva lenders for PHP 6,000 to sustain the daily feed supply of her hogs.

Virginia is married to Hilario, who is a farmer. She is already 48 years old and has three children in high school. She hopes to send them to college to earn a degree and have a decent job in the future.

Virginia tries her best to assist her husband in providing for their family's basic needs and children’s education. Virginia shared that, “Poverty is not a hindrance to success. We have many options in life and it’s up to us to choose the right one."

loans.use: To purchase hog feed.

loans.name: Ruben Antonio

texts.es: El señor de nombre Rubén Antonio C. tiene 24 años de edad. Su actividad económica es ofrecer los servicios de soldaduras. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que inicio desde muy joven, trabajando para salir adelante. Por lo que sus servicios los brinda de manera ambulante, y por medio de sus amistades ha conseguido obtener a sus clientes. Rubén es un hombre muy responsable disfruta mucho su trabajo pues cada día se instruye en algo nuevo. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de herramientas. El deseo de Rubén es  seguir con alternativa para vivir.
texts.en:
Rubén Antonio C. is 24. He offers his soldering services as a street vendor. He has been doing this for more than eight years. He started working to get ahead when he was very young. He offers his services as a street vender. He obtained his customers through his friends. Rubén is a very responsible man who really enjoys his work. Every day he learns something new. The loan is for working capital to buy tools. Rubén’s wish is to continue working towards an improved lifestyle.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rodelia

texts.en:
Rodelia T. is from the city of Oroquieta. She is 36 years old. Rodelia is married. To make a living, Rodelia owns and operates a sari-sari store (variety) store in her local community. Rodelia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Rodelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodelia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Rodelia is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Rodelia's 10th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Niño Divino Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo “Niño Divino” están representadas por la señora Saturnina y conformada por  12 miembros que residen en el mismo, la mayoría de las socias de dedican a la elaboración y comercialización de pan y algunas a la venta de ropa, comida y F.. La competencia a nivel comercial es lata pero la socias tienen mucha experiencia y saben como sacar adelante sus negocios ofreciendo productos variados y de buena calidad. El destino del financiamiento es para adquisición de herramientas mas modernas para realizar un pan de mayor calidad en menor tiempo, también para la adquisición de mercadería mas acorde a las exigencias del mercado en especial para el cambio de temporada. La socias van cursando su primer ciclo pero ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo se comprometen a dar todo de si para salir adelante con responsabilidad y unidad.
texts.en:
The group “Niño Divino” [“Divine Child”] is composed of 12 members that reside in the same neighborhood; the group members are represented by Saturnina. The majority of the group members dedicate themselves to the production and sale of bread, and some sell clothing, food, and flowers. Competition at the commercial level is high, but the group members have a lot of experience, and know how to move their businesses forward by offering a variety of products of good quality. The loan will be used to purchase modern tools to make higher quality bread in less time; they will also use the loan to acquire merchandise that will better match the demands of the market, especially for the change of season. The group members will be in their first loan cycle but they already count on experience in solidarity groups; they are committed to giving everything of themselves to get ahead in life with responsibility and unity.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operations capital (to purchase tools to make bread of a higher quality in less time; they will also use the loan to acquire merchandise).

loans.name: Togetherness Group

texts.en:
Togetherness is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Krubo Y., living in Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia.  

Krubo is married with 4 children, ages 5-22.  Her 15 year old is only in the 6th grade because she was forced to drop out during the war.  Krubo is 35 years old, illiterate, and lives in Borkeza Town.  

Krubo’s business is selling dry food goods in the market, including onions, manpo (local spice), sugar, salt, tomato sauce, etc.  She buys these food items wholesale in neighboring Guinea.  She has been running her business for 2 years.   She’s taking a loan to increase her inventory sufficiently so she can serve more customers.  With the profits she dreams of building a more permanent shop and investing in the future of her children, especially investing in education since she was unable to attend school.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina S. is from the village of Saray, Iligan City. She is 44 years old. Gina is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns & operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products,  including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Gina is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Gina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Juana Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora Juana S. de 45 años de edad, habitante del barrio Villa Reconciliación, soltera, tiene tres hijos, como planes seguir creciendo en su negocio  para obtener mayores utilidades,  madre soltera y por dificultades que se presentó ella inicio con su propio negocio con pocas cantidades de mercadería, desde hace once años tiene su pulpería en el tiempo que lleva con su negocio ha ido aumentando su inventario. Agradece a la institución por el préstamo ya que será invertido en compra de productos como: granos básicos, lácteos, golosinas, gaseosa, y productos de limpiezas. Y ofrecer a sus clientes la variedad. El cual espera captar clientes nuevos, y poder ofrecer a su familia mejores oportunidades.
texts.en:
Juana S., 45, lives in the Villa Reconciliación. She is single and has three children. She plans to for her business to keep growing to get better profits. As a single mother facing some difficulties, she started her own business with a small amount of merchandise. She has had her mini market for 11 years. In the time she has had the business she has increased her inventory. She is grateful to the institution for the loan that she will use to buy products like basic grains, dairy products, sweets, soft drinks, and cleaning products. This will provide her customers with variety. She hopes to get new customers this way and be able to offer her family better opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains, dairy products, and sweets

loans.name: Hagar

texts.en:
Hagar, 38 years old, is married and the mother of four children. She is a hard-working business woman. She enjoys selling goods. She sells cosmetics and that has been her major source of livelihood for the past six years. She says selling cosmetics is lucrative and her experience in the market has enabled her to gain many loyal customers.

Hagar does not have a shop now, so she sells on top of a table at the community market. She believes that with the loan, she will be able to purchase more stock of cosmetics to increase her inventory and income, for that matter.

loans.use: To buy more  cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Maurice Obonyo

texts.en:
Maurice is a 26-year-old father of a three-year-old child called Obama, named after President Barack Obama when he visited Kenya in 2006. He is married to Jecinta Obonyo.Their son goes to a nearby school. 

He was introduced to Kadet by his friend who is a Kadet client. With this first loan he plans to clear school fees for his younger brother and purchase additional fabric for his tailoring business.

His business is located on a street in town and he pays rent for the space he occupies. He has done the business for six years and he hopes to continue to expand his business and generate additional income to buy a plot of land and build a home for his family.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To pay school fees and purchase fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 25 years old and the father of two children. He has operated this shop for five years.

This is the third loan that he has received from Al-Thiqa to develop his shop and the loans have enabled him to raise his income and gain lots of customers. He made all his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phones

loans.name: Laban

texts.en:
Laban is 29 years old and married to Lucy Wairimu, who is 26 years old. Together they have one daughter. Laban has run a beauty shop for 5 years. He now wants to set up a butchery in Mwiki, next to where his beauty shop is. 

Laban has never borrowed from another MFI and this will be his first loan with KADET. He wants to use the loan to set up a place where he can sell diffent types of meat. He hopes to open supermarkets in different areas of the country one day. His dream is to improve his standard of living for his family and he views opening a butchery as part of his plan.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: For setting up a butchery

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is 37 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with them and her husband in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people there. 

Emilia is a trader. She runs a provisions store. Her store is by the roadside in her community. Emilia buys the goods from Accra. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure all kinds of provisions in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en: Ghassan is a 41-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Ghassan has been working in constructor since 1989. When he first started his business, he had to face competition, especially because he didn’t have a large network, as well as had some financial issues. Ghassan is special in his work because he is known for his good work. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and wood for his work. This is the first time that Ghassan has requested a loan.  His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by working in surrounding villages.

loans.use: To purchase tools and wood for his work.

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: Aïssatou N. est âgée de 42 ans, elle es mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est membre de banc Villageois de puis 4 ans et demi. Elle est teinturière, elle achète du tissu blanc le teint pour revendre. Ses revenus lui permettent de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels et de renforcer le niveau de son épargne.
texts.en:
Aïssatou N. is 42 years old, married, and has 2 children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" (Village loan group) for 4 and a half years. She is a dyer, and buys white fabric to dye for resale. Her income allows her to provide for herself and raise the level of her savings.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her self-financing capability

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo K. is 50 years old, married, and has one child living at home. She lives with her family in the Takeo province. She buys and sells rice, typically making US$1.60 each day, and her husband does construction work. Her husband typically makes about US$6 each day. Keo K. would like a loan of US$600 to purchase more rice to sell in the market.

loans.use: Purchase more rice

loans.name: Boubacar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Boubacar Sangaré est un homme marié de 30 ans qui vit avec sa femme et son enfant dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance de fréquenter le système scolaire, il s’intéressa très vite aux activités génératrices de revenus. C’est ainsi qu’il a mené pendant des années différentes activités dans le chef lieu de la  capitale régionale (Sikasso), mais sans succès, il décida alors de venir à Bougouni, au bercail, pour apprendre la menuiserie bois auprès  d’un de ses amis. Avec une expérience de 10 ans, il maîtrise son activité et est très sollicité.
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, Monsieur Boubacar Sangaré décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son deuxième prêt individuel. Le premier a été remboursé sans aucune difficulté. 
Il compte acheter avec ce deuxième prêt,  25  planches en bois, 3 boites de colles et 10 kilogrammes de pointes.  Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et à Manankoro auprès des grossistes et producteurs. 
Il  compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 55 000 FCFA.  Avec ce bénéfice il compte améliorer son atelier et assurer les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr Boubacar Sangaré, aged 30, is married and lives with his wife and child in the neighborhood of North Hérémakono in the city of Bougouni, located in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. Since he was not fortunate enough to attend school, he took very early an interest in income generating activities. He unsuccessfully tried for several years different activities in Sikasso, the capital city of the region, before deciding to return to his native Bougouni, where le learnt carpentry with a friend of his. Now, ten years later, he is a skilled and experienced carpenter and his work is in high demand. To meet the needs of his growing customer base, Mr Boubacar Sangaré decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is his second individual loan. He repaid his first loan without any difficulty. He wants to use his second loan to buy 25 planks, 3 boxes of glue and 10 kilograms of tacks. He gets his supplies from wholesalers and producers in Bougouni and Manankoro. He expects to make a profit of 55,000 CFA francs a month, which he will use to upgrade his workshop and provide for his family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy carpentry materials

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen is 40 years old and married with 4 young children, who all attend school. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports the family. Queen is a friendly and hard working woman. She sells foodstuffs such as tomato paste, cooking oil, rice, beans, plantains and drinks. She loves this business because of the opportunity to interact with her customers. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 160,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstufs to sell

loans.name: Chek

texts.en:
Chek L., age 23, is married and resides with her one-year-old child in Takeo province, Cambodia.

L. is engaged in the business of weaving Cambodian traditional silk products, earning an income of 2 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband is a security guard for a private company, earning an income of 2 USD per day. Their standard of living has been improved since L. and her husband have had these businesses.

L. is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase more raw silk to produce more output of the famous silk products. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy more silk for her silk-weaving business

loans.name: Sherryl

texts.en:
Sherryl C. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASHI. This previous loan was used to purchase more stock for her business of buying and selling rice. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory of rice. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Sherryl from ASHI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

In 2008, Sherryl joined ASHI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. With the chance given to her family by ASHI and KIVA partner, the couple believes that they are getting closer to the achievement of their family's dreams. Her long term goals are to build a profitable business, send all of her 8 children to college, and invest in her home.  With the support of Kiva lenders, Sherryl is dedicated to continuing her business and determined to achieve financial stability for her family.

loans.use: To purchase inventory of rice.

loans.name: Marta Fernando

texts.pt:
Marta Fernando M. nasceu no Distrito de Guija, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique tem 46 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 5 filhos de 28, 24, 20 e gémeos de 14 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 6ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta uma irmã que vive com ela.
Saiu de Guija para Ndlavela arredores da cidade de Maputo com os seus pais ainda muito jovem. Depois do seu casamento decidiu iniciar uma actividade comercial para ajudar nas despesas de casa. É vendedor ambulante ha mais de 14 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu cunhado que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 12.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento cola, tijoleira, e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa. O empréstimo anterior foi de 8.000.00mt também para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro, gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar na ampliação do seu negócio e concluir a sua residência.
texts.en:
Marta Fernando M. was born in Guija District, Gaza Province in southern Mozambique. She is 46, married, and has five children, ages 28, 24, 20 and 14-year-old twins. All the children go to school. Marta finished sixth grade but did not continue because of financial difficulties. She lives in her own house with her family and supports a sister who lives with her. She left Guija for Ndlavela, on the outskirts of the city of Maputo, with her parents when she was very young. After her marriage, she decided to start a business to help with household expenses. For more than 14 years, she has been a traveling salesperson. She has no employees and earns around 6,000 meticais monthy. She uses this money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account. Marta has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through her brother-in-law, who is also a customer of this institution. This 12,000 meticais loan is her second. She will use it to buy construction materials (adhesive cement, bricks and other items) to continue construction on her house. The earlier loan of 8,000 meticais was used for the same purpose. She promises to pay off this loan on time so she can take out other loans. In the future, Marta would like to ask for more loans to use for expanding her business and finishing her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (adhesive cement, bricks and other items)

loans.name: Batsuuri

texts.en:
Batsuuri S. is 61 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic tent). His youngest daughter, Oyun-Erdene, is a university student. Batsuuri operates a water trading business in his town. He buys water and resells it, delivering with his horse cart to the local cafes, organizations and individuals. 

Batsuuri started his business in 2005 with a working capital of 10,000 MNT. With a lot of hard work and determination, his working capital today is 1,000,000 MNT.  Over the past five years, he has built a loyal customer base. Since he started his business, he has been providing money for his family expenses and paying his child's university tuition fees. 

Batsuuri has a good personality and has very good communication skills. He says, “My dream is one day to create my own well in order to provide my service to more customers.” He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a car for his business, which will be used to transport water to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a car for delivering water

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en: Emilia R. is from the village of Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 61 years old. Emilia is married and has nine adult children. To make a living, Emilia raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from selling copra (the dried meat of a coconut) to local community members. Emilia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Emilia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to pay for the services extended by farm helpers to increase her crop yield. Emilia is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Emilia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Duk

texts.en:
Duk M., 40, is married and lives with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples.

M. is a teacher of illiterate people in her village and earns an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband sells brooms, earning an income of about USD 2 per day to help cover the family expenses.

M. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a truck for one of her children to use to transport workers from the factory. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a truck for one of her children to transport workers from the factory

loans.name: Dios Bendice Group

texts.en:
Ruth is the coordinator of her group Dios Bendice (God Bless), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican  clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, an area where the economy is dominated by sugarcane and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and three children.

Ruth is excited to be taking her first loan from Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her two businesses which are both food markets by purchasing rice, soup, beans, and various other foods by the dozen or in sacks to sell. She will use the profits to save towards continuing to grow her chain of food markets. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Rice, soup, beans, various other foods by the dozen or in sacks

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en:
Kiden M., on the right in the photo, sells bread, ice cream and groundnut phase (peanut paste) at the market and is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes, onions, etc., to sell.

Kiden M. is 39 years old and is married to a peasant. She has three children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To stock tomatoes, onions, etc., to sell

loans.name: Adodo Dédé

texts.fr: H. adodo dédé exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes, elle a entamé ce commerce en 1990 et a associé plus tard le commerce de cartes de recharge. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes dont la plupart des femmes. elle voudrait se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de d'une  quinzaine de pagnes de différentes qualités et de quelques cartes de recharges téléphoniques.
texts.en:
H. Adodo Dédé makes her living by selling wax cloths. She entered into this trade in 1990 and afterwards began selling phone topup cards as well. Her customer base is made up of many people, most of whom are women. She would like to replenish her stock and so is seeking a loan from WAGES so that she may buy fifteen wax cloths of varying quality as well as several phone topup cards.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing wax cloths

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda D. T. is a widow who lives in Brgy. Maloray, Dalaguete, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a general store, fish selling, and farming. Merlinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past ten loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Merlinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of PHP 12000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7500, improving the family's standard of living.  This time, for her eleventh loan, she is borrowing PHP 13000, which she intends to use to stock her general store with a bigger volume of the basic commodities that she sells.  In this way she can continue to save up for future plans for her family. Merlinda D. T. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To restock her general store

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel M. is from the village of Barangay 1, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 28 years old. Maricel is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Maricel owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies like baked "siopao" and sugar-coated bananas in the local community. Maricel has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maricel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Maricel is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Maricel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a member of 'Huruma B' group in Faulu Kenya.  He is married to a business-lady who sells tomatoes wholesale while he sells bananas.  He was previously selling sugarcane to earn a living.  He hopes to see his children acquire the best education.  He has requested his first loan of 15,000 KES from Faulu Kenya.  With the loan, he will buy more bananas for resale.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for resale

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita S. is a 27-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a used-clothing business. She lives in Yulo Street, Brgy. 8, Isabela, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her used-clothing business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). Anecita is now borrowing PHP 28,000 so that she can continue to purchase more stock of used clothes to sell. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 26,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Anecita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending-team page on Kiva to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Ma. Suzette

texts.en:
Ma. Suzette A. is from the village of Sta. Rosa. She is 43 years old and married with five school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Suzette owns a business raising pigs to fatten and sell. Ma. Suzette has been engaged in her business for over two years and makes approximately 4000 PHP when she sells one of her grown pigs.

In 2009, Ma. Suzette joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI and is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Ma. Suzette from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.
