About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Annah Jillo

texts.en:
Annah Jillo is 39 years old and is married to John Kinyimu who is a police officer. Together they have two children aged 14 and 8.  She has a boutique where she sells clothes to people in Kajiado market and its surroundings.  She learned about Kadet Ltd in a Kadet Business awareness meeting which was conducted at Kajiado market.

The boutique business gives Annah a monthly income of Kshs 4,000 which she uses to help her husband in taking care of their family. With the loan she plans to use Kshs 25,000 to buy clothes for selling and the other Kshs 25,000 to rent and open a shop in Kitengela town where there are more customers.

She intends to grow her business to wholesale with the extra money generated from the business.

Annah describes herself as enterprising.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale and open a second shop.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert M. is 44 years old and a father of five.  He has been running a restaurant in Bwombaso-Rukungiri for the past decade.  His business brings in 260,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) per month.  Robert plans to use his loan to restock his restaurant with more food supplies.

loans.use: The purchase more food supplies for his restaurant

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina makes beautiful embroidered clothes to earn an income for her family. She learned this art from her mother as a teenager.

Zarina and her family live a in a small housing colony named Arshad, in a three room brick home in the city of Riwind, Pakistan.  It is famous for its dairy industry. Her husband buys candy at wholesale prices and sells to shop owners for a profit. 

She is the mother of three sons and two daughters.  She couldn’t provide an education to her sons and they started working as teenagers.  Her daughters are in school.

Zarina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to provide financial assistance to her husband.  He will utilize the loan to purchase more candy. He has been in business for seven years and Zarina is hopeful that a loan will improves the financial condition of their family. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application.  Zarina has built a good credit history and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To buy candies to sell

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon O. is a married man who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

He has operated a vegetable stall business for the past two years, selling from home to his neighbors and passersby. Simon faces a major challenge of seasonality and fluctuation of prices in the market. He hopes to expand his business and establish a retail shop in the future.

With the 20000 KES he wants to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes, onions and fruits. He decided to join Yehu because of the efficiency of the financial services.

loans.use: To purchase green vegetables, tomatoes, onions and fruits

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis Enrique Y. N. tiene 30 años de edad, Es soltero, vive con los hermanos  en  el  Cantón de Moncache  Provincia los Ríos. No tiene hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. 27 DE OCTUBRE   se encuentra ubicada  en el recinto Santa Sofía, Todos los socios se dedican al cultivo de ciclo corto especialmente siembran maíz, arroz y fréjol gandul, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Luis Enrique se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Briones  y vende los  productos en el Comercial Vaca y García.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una finca y comprar una casa.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en:
Luis Enrique Y. N. is 30 years old.  He is single and lives with his siblings in the canton of Moncache, which is in Ríos province.  He does not have any children.

The members of the "27th of October" rural communal bank are based in the precinct of Santa Sofía.  All of the members work in short-cycle agriculture, planting corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  Collectively, they have many years of experience in this activity.

Luis Enrique plants corn, rice, and pigeon peas. He buys products in the Briones market and sells what he produces in the Vaca y Garcia market.

He is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for cultivating corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  With the economic support provided by this loan, he will be better able to meet his needs.  He faces challenges like insect plagues, crop illnesses, and variations in the climate.  His dream is to buy a farm and his own house.

He enjoys sports.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Mr. Pen Bros Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of thirteen people in Thnoas village in Takeo province. They will use their portion of the loan for different purposes in order to improve their families'  living.
Mr. Pen B. is a village bank president who has been selected by the other members. He was born in 1972. He is a widower with four children, three of whom are studying in local public school, but the other one is too small to work or study. He is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where he grows rice to sell in order to support his family.   Besides farming, he is a laborer and rock breaker, too. He does very hard work, and yet he can earn only a little income. So Mr. Pen B. is applying for a loan to buy two piglets for breeding as well as pig food, to start a new business.  With the rest of the  loan, he is going to pay his children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy two piglets and pig food, for breeding

loans.name: María Julia

texts.es:
La Señora. María F. es socia del banco comunal Unión Progresista, vive en la comunidad de Llariviña que  pertenece a la parroquia de Santa Ana, en esta parroquia se puede admirar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, cuenta con una hermosa vista de la naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes cargos.
 
Doña María tiene 75 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, casados y viven independientes. Su esposo pasa en casa ya que es jubilado, con el trabajo conyugal ha construido su casa propia.
 
La Señora. María labora en una tienda que es de su propiedad hace 40 años, atiende su negocio de domingo a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 10 años, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más productos para su tienda. Su meta es mejorar su tienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. María F. is a member of the Unión Progresista (Progressive Union) communal bank.  She lives in the community of Llariviña which belongs to Santa Ana parish.  In this parish one can admire a large part of the city of Cuenca.  It has a beautiful view of nature.  Its residents are farmers and raise animals; many work at different jobs in the city.

María is 75 years old, married and has three adult, married, independently-living children.  Her husband is retired and stays home.  Through their labor as a couple they have built their own house.

María works in a store she’s owned for 40 years.  She is open from Sunday to Sunday from 6am until 8pm.

She’s been a member of the communal bank for 10 years and will use the money from her loan to buy stock items for her store; her goal is to improve her store.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents and other basic need items.

loans.name: Nazaria Yamileth

texts.es:
La señora Nazaria Yamileth García R. tiene 24 años de edad, vive en union Libre con el señor Emil Alberto Martinez quien se dedica  pintar carros en su taller y Nazaria se dedica a la venta de productos varios tiene una tienda en la cual vende cuadros, flores, adornos para la cocina, sala y dormitorios tambien vende achineria como ganchos para el cabello, colitas para las niñas, fantasia fina, Calcomanias, etc.
el credito lo utilizara para compra de cuardenos, lapices, zapatos, pantalones, juguetes, tenis, borradores y papel. todos los productos son materiales para escuela, en estos momentos es temporada de inicios de clases y desea tener surtido su negocio.
Nazaria tiene dos hijos y junto a el padre de sus hijos trabajan duro para salir adelante con ellos.
Nazaria nos comento sentirse feliz ya que su negocio esta creciendo rapido y esta teniendo buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs.Nazaria Yamileth García R. is 24 years old. She has a common law marriage with Mr. Emil Alberto Martinez, who paints cars in his workshop. Nazaria sells various products in a store she has. She sells pictures, flowers, kitchen, living room and bedroom decorative items, and items such as hair clips, hair band for girls, stickers, etc. She will use the loan to buy notebooks, pencils, shoes, pants, toys, tennis shoes, erasers and paper. All of these products are school supplies. It is back to school time right now and she wants to supply her business. 

Nazaria has two children and with her children's father she works hard to get ahead with them. Nazaria told us that she feels happy since her business is growing and she is making good profits.

loans.use: To buy backpacks, notebooks, pencils, shoes, pants, toys, tennis shoes, erasers and paper.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Bibian's Group

texts.en:
Bibian A. is from the village of Faustino, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 34 years old. Bibian is the group leader of a 12-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Bibian is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP monthly from these activities.

In 2010, Bibian joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from ASKI. That loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Bibian is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be her 2nd from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated  to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase livestock feed & supplies

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian G. is currently in the business of selling groundnut paste, which is similar to peanut butter. 

She is 25 years old and married, with three children. Two of them go to school. 

Lilian borrowed a loan to stock more paste to sell. She hopes to buy land with the extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more groundnut paste to sell

loans.name: Wenecorde

texts.en:
Wenecorde, age 62, is a hard-working entrepreneur who owns and operates a sari-sari (general store) business. She has been in this business for 10 years. She and her husband have raised two children. 

Wenecorde has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF. She intends to implement it by purchasing more products to sell in her store. In the future, Wenecorde would like to save money so as to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: increase his income

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Jeune homme marié de 37 ans,kodjo  est papa de deux enfants.sa femme et lui sont revendeur.il vend des boissons et des produits alimentaires dans un kiosque à lomé.il a ouvert sa petite boutique  depuis 1990 et s’approvisionne sur place et à Accra(pays voisin).il est à son deuxième prêt.ce dernier lui permettra de stocker les marchandises qu’il vend pour les besoins des consommateurs.
texts.en: Kodjo, a young man of 37 years, is married and the dad of two children. He and his wife own a vending stall in Lomé where they sell drinks and groceries. He opened his small store in 1990 and gets his supplies on location and from Accra in neighboring Ghana. This is his second loan. It will help him to stock up his inventory and meet his customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Bethel 4, 5 & 8 Group

texts.en:
Rafaela is one of the members of the group Bethel 4, 5 & 8. This group is located in one of the rural communities surrounding San Pedro D. Macoris. They are 15 borrowers who are businessmen and businesswomen. Rafaela makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their 4 children. Her business is based on underwear sales from her house and by walking to sell. 

Rafaela is excited to be taking her 8th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for almost 4 years. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing dozens of pairs of underwear for men, women and kids, and also swimwear. She will use her profits to invest in her business and to save.

Her group is located in San Pedro D. Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and the sugarcane industry. The main economic activities here are a free traD. zone and a cement factory.

loans.use: to buy underwear

loans.name: Ubalda

texts.es: La señora Ubalda es de la comunidad de Moyotepec, Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México, ella tiene 47 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 1 hijo Amner de 11 años de edad está estudiando la primaria, ella tiene su cocina económica y venta de perfumes y cosméticos de Jafra por catalogo, ella solicito su préstamo para ampliar su negocio va a comprar mesas para su negocio de comida y va a comprar perfumes de dama, caballero y niños y cosméticos de Jafra,  ella inicio su negocio hace 2 años, como es animadora de Jafra, tiene a su cargo 29 personas, las atiende, les entrega sus catálogos, ella se vio en la necesidad de no salir de su casa y como le gusta cocinar decidió poner su cocina económica se llama “Los Arbolitos” así atiende los dos negocios, a su hijo y cuida su casa, ella está orgullosa de su negocio porque se manda sola, no depende de nadie y le gusta cocinar, le da empleo a dos muchacha una de ella elabora las tortillas a mano y la otra atiende a sus clientes que son visitantes que vienen en sus autos  transitando en la carretera y como está a la orilla de la carretera pasan a comer, los desafíos que enfrenta el negocio es el costo del maíz y el frijol, las ganancias las utiliza para dar el pago, comprar trastes para cocinar y para salir a pasear, ella está contenta con este préstamo que va a recibir va a comprar las mesas para que su negocio se vea más bonito. Sus sueños son que su hijo estudie la universidad para que tenga su carrera y hacer un local para su cocina económica. Moyotepec es de clima cálido, hay campo siembran maíz, cebolla, caña. Ella quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación realidad “gracias por sus préstamos, que Dios les Multiplique su ayuda”.
texts.en: Señora Ubalda is from the community of Moyotepec, Ayala, in the state of Morelos, México.  She is 47 years old, married and has 1 son, Amner, who is 11 years old and attends primary school.  Señora Ubalda runs an informal restaurant, and she sells perfumes and cosmetics through the Jafra catalog.  She is requesting the loan to expand her businesses. She is going to purchase tables for her restaurant, women's, men's and children's perfumes and Jafra cosmetics.  She started her business 2 years ago.  As a Jafra consultant, she is responsible for 29 people.  She helps them and gets them their catalogs.  Señora Ubalda found it necessary to stay at home, and since she likes to cook, she decided to open her informal restaurant called “Los Arbolitos” (The Little Trees).  This way, she can take care of both businesses, her son and her home.  Señora Ubalda is proud of her business because she runs it herself and is not dependent on anyone.  And she likes to cook.  She employs two women, one of whom makes the tortillas by hand and the other takes care of the customers.  The customers are travelers passing through on the highway.  And since she is located at the edge of the highway, they come in for something to eat.  The challenge that Señora Ubalda faces with the business is the price of corn and beans.  She uses her earnings to pay her workers, to purchase dishes for cooking, and for her own outings.  Señora Ubalda is happy with the loan she will be receiving, and she will use it to purchase tables so that her business looks nicer.  Her dreams are that her son goes to University and studies a career and to have a store front for her informal restaurant.  Moyotepec has a warm climate and fields where they grow corn, onions and canes.  Señora Ubalda wants to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad, “Thank you for the loans.  May god return your generosity many-fold.”

loans.use: to purchase tables for her informal restaurant, women's, men's and children's perfumes and Jafra cosmetics.

loans.name: Ikhtiyor

texts.ru: Ихтиёр житель Гиссарского района. Ему 21 год. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Он живет вместе с матерью. У него среднее образование. Ихтиёр уже год как занимается торговлей. Он имеет магазин, где продает продукты питания. Кредит берет для покупки молочных продуктов, колбасных изделий и приобретения холодильника.
texts.en: Ikhtiyor lives in Gissar. He is 21 years old, married, and has three children. His wife is a housewife. He lives with his mother. He has a secondary education. Ikhtiyor has been working in trade for a year. He has a shop where he sells groceries. He is taking out a loan to buy dairy products, sausage, and a refrigerator.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, sausage, and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Hilda Leopoldina

texts.es:
Hilda Leopoldina  tiene 23 años, es separada vive con sus hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tienen 2 hijos Gabriela de 8 años y Cristhian de 4 años.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALLE ALTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Voluntad de Dios en el Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra maíz y arroz.


Hilda se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol de palo, cacao y café Compra sus productos en Comercial Peña y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para mejorar su producción y suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es tener en 5 años una casa propia y seguir adelante con su familia. Enfrenta el desafío de la cinta roja y la langosta.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Hilda Leopoldina, 23, is separated and lives with her two children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  She has two children: Gabriela, 8, and Christhian, 4.

The members of the “Valle Alto” (High Valley) communal bank are located in Voluntad de Dios, Ventanas Canton and are dedicated to short cycle rice and corn farming. 

Hilda is a corn, rice, pigeon pea, cocoa bean and coffee farmer.  She buys her supplies in Comercial Peña and sells at the Ventanas wholesale market.

She requests the loan to plant rice and corn, to buy supplies and fertilizer for the crops.  Support from the loan will help her economically to improve production and meet her needs.  Her dream is to have a house of her own in five years to continue moving forward with her family.  Two challenges she faces are the plant scourges “cinta roja” and “langosta.”

She enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and fertilizer.

loans.name: Merlyna

texts.en:
Merlyna is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated and has 2 children. 

Merlyna has a shop where she sells used clothing or ukay-ukay. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more stock of used clothing.

Merlyna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Merlyna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of used clothing.

loans.name: Baya

texts.en:
Baya is a 40-year-old married man. They have four children. He runs a tailoring business and also sells clothing. His business has been in operation for the last nine years.

This is his second loan from KADET LTD. He plans to purchase more fabric for his tailoring business and more shirts and leso (wraparound) skirts for his clothing business.

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and gradually expand his business. His dream is to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more fabric for his tailoring business, and also more shirts and leso (wraparound) skirts for his clothing business.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
El señor Valentín nació en Samaipata casado con la Sra. Rosario con 5 hijos, el vive en Villa Florida donde tiene su parcela ellos viven y trabajan en esas tierras, ellos se dedican a la agricultura sembrando maíz, sandia, tomate, y también se dedica a la ganadería.    
El es cliente antiguo de la institución va sacando de Emprender como 7 créditos por la facilidad de pago y la comodidad de visita a domicilio por lo lejos de su vivienda, el paga todas sus cuotas sin atraso alguno, es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en lo que implica el preparado de la tierra y la compra de semillas para la siembra de sandia.
texts.en:
Sr. Valentín was born in Samaipata and is married to Sra. Rosario. They have five children. He lives in Villa Florida, where he owns a parcel of land. Valentín lives and works on this land. He works as a farmer and grows corn, watermelon, and tomatoes. In addition, he raises cattle.

Valentín is a long-time client of Emprender who has received seven loans. He enjoys the convenient payments and being in the comfort of his home since he lives a long distance away. All of his payments have been submitted without delay. Valentín is a responsible and hardworking individual. The money from this loan will be used to prepare his land and to buy watermelon seeds for planting.

loans.use: to buy seeds and supplies for planting watermelon.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a hardworking business man. He is 35 years old and married.  For the last three years he has been operating a retail shop in order to support his family.  In the next five years, he wants to become a wholesaler.  His dream is to become successful in his business.  He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, rice, soap, and soda for his store.  Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now able to access credit easily.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, soap, and soda for his retail shop.

loans.name: Believe In God Group

texts.en:
Koloneh (who is pictured on the right) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born in the village of Rowalla, Koloneh is approximately 45 years of age. She is married to a businessman and the couple has five grown-up children.

For over 12 years now, Koloneh has been selling palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice, etc. Koloneh and her group members have applied for a loan of 800,000.00 SLL for each from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Koloneh will use her share of the loan to expand her business. She will buy palm oil and rice at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and rice at wholesale

loans.name: Joelynda

texts.en: Joelynda is a farmer from the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. She is married and has three children, ages 22, 14 and 3. Joelynda’s husband is also a farmer. Together, they till their land and plant rice and corn crops. Joelynda does her best to improve their business and support the family. She plans to use her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to become a successful businesswoman someday.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 26 years old, married, and has one child.  She lives in the Philippines. Mary Grace has a retail shop that sells napkins, detergents, soaps, and shampoo. She has had this business for three years. She is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will  use to buy detergents, napkins, and soaps to sell.

Mary Grace is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Mary Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase detergents, napkins, and soaps to sell.

loans.name: Said

texts.ru: Саид проживает в районе Дангара. Он женат. Ему 59 лет. У него трое детей. Саид занимается торговлей на рынке. Он в основном продает овощи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 15 лет. Кредит берет для покупки в оптом картошки, лука и моркови.
texts.en: Said lives in the Dangara district.  He is 59 years old, married and has three children.  Said is involved in sales at the market.  He primarily sells vegetables and has been in this business for 15 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of potatoes, onions and carrots.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru Town for the last two years.  She is 25 years old and married to a man named Macharia, with whom she has two children.  

Veronica was introduced to Kiva field partner KADET Ltd by an existing borrower and this will be her second loan. She paid all her previous loans off on time. She plans to use this loan to buy more milk to sell in her dairy shop.

In future, Veronica hopes to expand her business and become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy milk

loans.name: Ada Maria

texts.es: Ada, está solicitando otro préstamo, porque quiere surtir el negocio de mercadería como: calzado para niños, damas y caballeros, sandalias, yinas, el objetivo de ella es tener más variedad para ofrecerles a sus clientes. Los financiamientos anteriores le ayudaron a fortalecer su negocio y ha podido comprar nuevos estilos y variedad, este avance le ha servido para mejorar lo económico a su familia.
texts.en: Ada is requesting another loan so that she can increase her inventory with shoes and sandals for children, women and men.  She wants to have more variety to offer to her customers.   Her previous loans helped her to grow her business and purchase new styles.  This loan will help her improve the economic situation for her family.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of shoes and sandals for children, women and men.

loans.name: Leslie Hindira

texts.es: La socia actualmente se dedica a la preparacion de mazamorras y arroz con leche, ella elabora sus mazamoras y los vende en una carretilla de manera ambulatoria, la socia vende frente a la universidad y en su carretilla ella lleva empujando tambien por la puerta del hospital del seguro social; la socia desea el credito para poder implementar su carretita y comprar los potecitos de tres tamaños para la venta de mazamorra y arroz con leche, la socia solicita el prestamo para comprar potecitos descartables, ingredientes como canela, clavo de olor, arroz, leche, maíz morado, piña entre otros ingredientes secretos.
texts.en: This member makes desserts such as rice with milk, which she sells in a mobile cart near a local university and near the social security hospital; she now wishes to expand her sales, and with this loan she plans to buy three different sizes of containers for the desserts, as well as ingredients such as cinnamon, cloves, rice, milk, purple corn, pineapple and other secret spices.

loans.use: to buy disposable cartons, as well as ingredients such as cinnamon, cloves, rice, milk, purple corn, pineapple and other secret spices.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es:
El cliente tiene 34 años y radica en el trópico de Cochabamba, desde hace 10 años, ella es del departamento de Santa Cruz de la localidad de Montero, ya que sus ingresos eran insuficientes para poder sobrevivir y vio una opción de ir al trópico de Cochabamba, buscando mayores oportunidades de vida,  aunque los primeros años fue difícil pero con esmero y muchos esfuerzos y mucha fe, logro seguir adelante, trabajo en muchas cosas, hoy en día trabaja vendiendo cosméticos al por menor,  poco a poco quiere aumentar capital de su negocio. Y seguir creciendo.
El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar más mercadería ya que su capital es insuficiente,  en el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio a mayor escala y convertirse un una exitosa vendedora de cosméticos en el trópico de Cochabamba.
texts.en:
The client is 34 years old and has lived in the tropics of Cochabamba for ten years. She is from the department of Santa Cruz in the Montero area. Since her income was insufficient to be able to survive and she saw the option to go to Cochabamba, looking for greater life opportunities, even though the first years were difficult but with care and much effort and a lot of faith she managed to get ahead. She worked in many things. Today she works selling cosmetics at retail. Gradually, she wants to expand her business' capital and continue growing.

The loan that she is requesting is to buy more merchandise since her capital is insufficient. In the  future, she wants to expand her business to a greater scale and convert into a successful cosmetics seller in Cochabamba.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her cosmetics and perfume business.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic wants to improve her business and is asking for additional capital to provide good nutrition for her hogs. She wants to obtain a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed, vitamins and medicines. This loan will help her grow her hogs and be able to sell them at a higher cost upon distribution. 

Marivic’s priority in life is to uplift her family's living conditions. She is 41 years old and is married with two children. She wants to earn steady income for her family’s needs. She described herself as a hardworking and responsible woman. She raises hogs to fatten and breed and usually sells them to butchers who come into her village. She earns about PHP 3,000 whenever she sells a raised hog.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and medicines

loans.name: Ssebatta

texts.en:
Ssebatta is 38 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala south region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, of whom three are currently in school. For the past 5 years, Ssebatta has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells shoes.

To help expand his business, Ssebatta has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes for resale, and will help Ssebatta to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Ssebatta hopes that in the future he will be able to construct his house. 

Ssebatta is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ssebatta who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is 42 years old, married to Okello and has five children. She has been in the greengrocery business for last 16 years and earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES. She is requesting her first loan of 20,000 KES  from Kiva partner KADET. She plans to use the funds to buy more vegetables for resale such as onions, tomatoes and kale. 
Everlyne plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children to college level and grow her business into a big greengrocery store.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of vegetables.

loans.name: Jedidah

texts.en:
Jedidah is a 40-year-old, married woman with four children.  She has been a bread distributor who operates a retail shop for the past 10 years.

Jedidah is applying for her second loan from Kiva partner KADET Ltd.  She was introduced to the organization by another KADET client.  Jedidah requests a loan of 100,000 KES to buy bread stock for distribution to her customers and to supply her shop.  In the future she aspires to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy bread for distribution

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is a 30 year old man, married with a 3-year old daughter. He is the third born in a family of 5, raised by a single mother who struggled to see him through school. After completing high school, he took it upon himself to further his education. As a result, he juggled several jobs to pay for his fees. He managed to earn a postgraduate diploma in Marketing. He runs his business from his house because he does not have a shop yet, but plans to set up a shop once he gets financially stable.

With a Kiva loan, Timothy intends to buy EcoZoom energy-saving stoves and solar lights at wholesale prices and then sell them at retail prices to his community. This will greatly benefit his business, which has begun to rapidly increase lately after he began selling EcoZoom products. 

He has been running his business for 5 months now. With the flexibility of being an individual entrepreneur, he is able to get time to attend classes, tend to his farm and enjoy time with his young family.

Timothy likes working with EcoZoom because he is assured of quality, reliable and efficient products. It has also created him a full time job where he is his own boss, works at his own pace and sets his own goals.

The impact of Timothy’s work in his village is very evident. Most school going children can now read from home at night, since they use the solar lights and people spend 60% less on fuel, allowing them to reinvest in their homes.

Timothy has hopes and dreams for the future to be a well-established distributor of EcoZoom energy saving products.

loans.use: To purchase energy saving stoves and solar lights at whole sale price

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia retails charcoal in her area. Her activity serves as an important source of energy for the community in which she resides. She is regular participant and a positive contributor to the the TEACH lending program. She has developed a business and marketing plan with the aim of diversifying her activity into sales of domestic gas and promoting tree planting within her community. She needs to start the gas sales project. She is soliciting for KIVA loan assistance to enable her start the Community Gas Sales project.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Yojane

texts.en:
Yojane’s business caters to the women of her community, selling clothing and cosmetics from the front porch of her home in the town of Chavón. The loan will pay for shoes, purses, and cosmetics to round out her inventory. This will make Yojane’s business a one-stop shop for all the main types of accessories her customers are in the market for.

Yojane did not receive formal education beyond elementary school, but is now able to manage her own business thanks to business training provided by Esperanza, along with her hard work and ability. She also receives good feedback, support, and connections to a large demographic from her three daughters, ages 21, 19, and 17. All three attend school; the two oldest were accepted to college and are studying marketing and accounting. With the help from this loan, Yojane can better support and care for her children.

NOTE: Yojane has established her business with regular clientele in the community and is a leader of her solidarity group, called 'Las Empresarias'(The Entrepreneurs). She represents four other small business owners, who will each receive an equal $150 share of this $750 loan to invest in their respective businesses. Each member has passed Esperanza's training program and demonstrated the ability and motivation to support their families and pay back their loan.

loans.use: Invest in shoes, purses, cosmetics, and clothing accessories to expand her retail store

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.en:
Maria is divorced and has a young son. Facing the need to obtain the necessary resources to feed and educate her son, she started her own business. She sells glasses, scarfs and other accessories for women. This is her only income because she does not receive any help from her previous spouse.

Maria makes an effort day after day to pull her son through, and knows that offering a greater variety of products will allow her to make her business grow and increase the benefits she reaps from it. With that end in mind, she is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase merchandise. She is committing to pay back the loan in 5 to 10 months.

Now is the time to help those who need it the most. You can contribute to the growth of this business and the well-being of this family. It hasn't been easy for Maria to work so hard but she is willing to go on for her son's sake. Support her!

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Maria es divorciada y tiene un pequeño hijo, ante la necesidad de obtener los recursos necesarios para alimentar y educar a su hijo, ella inició su propio negocio en el que vende accesorios para dama, lentes, bufandas, etc., este representa el único ingreso para ella porque no recibe ayuda alguna de su anterior pareja. Maria se esfuerza día a día por sacar adelante a su hijo y sabe que al ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes podrá hacer crecer su negocio e incrementar sus beneficios, con esta finalidad ella solicita un préstamo de $ 700 dólares con la que comprará mercancía, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 5 a 10 meses.

Hoy es tiempo de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, tú puedes contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio y al bienestar de esta familia, no ha sido fácil para Maria tener que trabajar tanto pero esta dispuesta a continuar por su hijo. ¡Apóyala!

loans.use: Purchasing Merchandise

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Martha is single and has three children: a 16-year-old son and two 13-year-old daughters. They have been the main reason that she began to sell food four years ago. She has never had anyone’s help supporting her children, and she started her business to be able to give them a better quality of life and a good education. Little by little, her clientele grew, and now she has a small restaurant in her home.

Martha prepares specialty meals and roast chickens. The high quality of her products has caused the business to grow quickly. She is now asking for a $375 loan to purchase ingredients to increase her production and meet the demand of her clients. She will pay the loan back in 6 months. The well-being of this family is in your hands. Support them. They will greatly appreciate it.

Martha es soltera y tiene tres hijos, uno de 16 años y dos mujeres de 13 años de edad, ellos han sido el principal motivo para iniciar con la venta de comidas hace cuatro años, nunca ha tenido el apoyo de nadie para sacar adelante a sus hijos y para poder ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida y una buena educación empezó su negocio, poco a poco fueron incrementándose sus clientes y ahora ya tiene un pequeño restaurante ubicado en su propio domicilio.

Martha elabora comidas especiales y pollos asados, la buena calidad de los productos que ofrece le han permitido crecer rápidamente, ahora está solicitando un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos con lo que espera incrementar su producción y cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia, decídete a apoyarlos, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use:
Purchase of ingredients

Compra de insumos

loans.name: Fuad

texts.en: Fuad has his own farming business. He is 26 years old and single. He lives in the Yenikand village of the Salyan region. Fuad has 4 years of experience in this business and now requests a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Valentin

texts.en:
Sr. Valentín A. is 37 years old.  His wife, Valentina is 34, and together they have three young children. They live in their own house in Benjamín Aceval, Paraguay. They were able to buy this house through the sacrifice of Sr. Valentín and his auto-repair shop. Valentina also contributes to the household income by selling sodas out of their home. 
Before establishing his own business, Valentín worked in a transportation company where he acquired knowledge and experience as a mechanic. It is this work that led Valentín to establish his own shop in 2004. He opened his business with very little but after 3 years of hard work it has grown. 
He provides his services to a number of bus drivers, because he receives so many buses as part of his work he needs more space in which to work on them. Thus, it is his desire to build an additional space closer to the bus Terminal. He has requested this loan to buy the materials needed for this new construction.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MATERIALS TO CONSTRUCT A LARGER SPACE FOR HIS AUTO REPAIR BUSINESS

loans.name: Sumiati

texts.en: Sumiati, 29 years old,  is the mother of a child aged 9. She raises chickens at her house, feeding them for some time before she sells them. Her husband, W., works at a repair shop and earns US$ 5 per day. Sumiati needs a loan of US$ 75 to buy more chickens to raise so she can expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to raise for sale

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
With the goal of helping her household budget, Susana had the idea of opening a hair salon outside her home. Nevertheless, because of worrying about taking care of her 3 children, she moved the salon into her home.

That is how Susana, in addition to offering personal beauty services, sells beauty products as well.

If she had the opportunity, she would expand her business and open a bazaar. But her biggest dream is to open a beauty institute in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

A fin de ayudar con la economía de la casa, Susana tuvo la idea de poner una peluquería fuera de casa. Sin embargo, por la preocupación de cuidar a sus 3 hijos, esta se trasladó a su hogar.

Es así como Susana además de ofrecer servicios de arreglo personal, vende productos de belleza.

De tener la posibilidad, ampliaría su negocio y pondría un bazar. Pero su más grande sueño es poner un instituto de belleza en su casa.

loans.use: Expand her business and open a beauty school in her home.

loans.name: Lesilice's Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Lesilise Matembo, age 27, is married with 2 children (3 and 10 years old). Lesilise owns a cosmetics and clothing business, which she started 2 years ago. Working from 10am-4pm daily, she earns about $140 a month from this business.

Lesilise now hopes for a loan to purchase more cosmetics and clothing. Lesilise belongs to the loan group called Tumaini and will be sharing this loan with subgroup member Salama Muhumbe. Salama also sells clothing.

loans.use: To buy clothing and cosmetics stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothing in bulk to boost a small business.

loans.name: Anthonia's Muamko Group

texts.en:
Anthonia is 38 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 12,10 and 7 years old. Anthonia is a jewelry seller, and she started in 2005. Every day, she works from 6am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to start poultry business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Maimuna and Zaina, who have businesses dealing in snacks, soft drink sales, tailoring and food vending.

loans.use: To start poultry business.

loans.name: Amina's Kimandolu Group

texts.en:
Mary is widow woman with 2 children, ages 14 and 7 years old. Mary is a clothes seller, and she started in 1994. Every day, she works from 8 am to 7 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Amina and Beatrice, who have businesses in electrical wiring and earth moving.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Hello from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 26 year-old Asha S.. She is married, and has two children ages 2 and 5. In 2008, Asha established her traditional African cloth business. Asha requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of traditional cloth.

loans.name: Victorine

texts.fr:
Victorine A. is 39 years old, married, and the mother of four. She has maintained a shop of general food items for three years in Assahoun, a village located about 50 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. With this second loan, Ms. Victorine wishes to buy canned food, medical ointments, and cartons of milk to increase the capacity of her business and thus to provide for her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Victorine A. est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle tient une boutique d'alimentation générale depuis 3 ans à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Avec ce second crédit, madame Victorine désire acheter des boîtes de conserves, des pomades et des cartons de laits pour augmenter la capacité de son activité et par là subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy canned foods, ointments, and cartons of milk

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en: Mathew A. sells wood and he says life can be better if you assist him to buy more wood to increase his profit margin. He is married, but his wife's income as a fishmonger is not sufficient for Mathew and his 3 children. Demand for his goods is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase her profits.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business.

loans.name: Šerifa

texts.en:
Šerifa is a 52-year-old widow who lives with her two children in the village Rainci, near the town Kalesija. She does the agriculture and sells vegetables that she plants.

This loan in the amount of 600 KM ($US450) she will use to buy chicken for fattening in order to sell them and to use that money for her children and their school. Business with chicken is safer than with vegetables during the winter and she hopes that she will improve her household incoM. until the spring when she will again start with sowing vegetables.

loans.use: To buy chicken.

loans.name: Sles

texts.en:
Mr. Sles L. (pictured with his fishing nets), 51, and his wife, Mrs. Saros San, 47, live along National Road Number Six about twenty Kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1975 and have seven children: three sons and four daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the famiL. home. Two children study in the local school, and the other two children assist in the fishing business.

Mr. Sles and his wife have been fishing since they were young. They fish from the Mekong River and the lake near their village to sell to the middle man who sells the fish in Phnom Penh City. They also sell some fish in their village.
 
Sles is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase new fishing nets to replace broken nets.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Yoni

texts.es:
La señora Yoni pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Flores de los Próceres”, ubicado en la calle 20 Mz. 27 Lt. 4 AA.HH Primavera Segunda Etapa, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como profesor de Educación Secundaria. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertir en la venta de ropa interior. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal.  

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de ropa usada para niños y niñas y cuenta con un pequeño taller de costura. En las mañanas se ocupa de sus hijos y en las tardes a confeccionar prendas de vestir sólo para niños (as) y ropa interior para vender a sus clientes. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 5 kilos de telas de algodón, 5 docenas de polos, 4 docenas de blusas y 5 docenas de vestidos para niñas.  

Yoni agradece al Banco Comunal de Manuela Ramos por el apoyo que siempre le brinda y por la oportunidad de emprender un negocio propio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yoni belongs to the Communal Bank "Las Flores de los Próceres" (The Flowers of National Heroes). The bank is located on 20 Mz. 27 Lt. 4AA. HH Primavera Segunda Etapa, in the Callería district in the Coronel Portillo province in the Ucayali department. Yoni is 42 years old and the mother of 2 small children. Yoni is married and her husband works as a high school teacher. With her first loan of 300 soles from Manuela Ramos, Yoni invested in her underclothes business. She's been working with the Communal Bank for four years. Now Yoni sells used children's clothes and she has a small sewing shop. In the morning she tends to her children and in the afternoon she sews children's clothing and underclothes to sell to her clients. With a loan of 1,000 soles Yoni will buy 5 kilos of cotton fabric, 5 dozen polo shirts, 4 dozen blouses, and 5 dozen girls' dresses. Yoni is thankful for the Manuela Ramos Communal Bank for its constant support, and for the opportunity to start her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cotton fabrics, polo shirts, blouses, and girls' dresses

loans.name: Channa

texts.en: Mrs. Channa H. lives in Prey Char Krouv village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have oxen to plow her field. In order to deal this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow her field and to buy fertilizer to support her field. Her husband, Mr. Loav Ty, is a laborer in the rice mill. Mrs. Channa H. is 22 years old and the mother of a two-year-old child. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To hire a laborer and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Moeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Moeurn K. is a villager from Ampil Village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who owns 1.5-hectares and cultivates rice to earn a living. 

She now faces a lot of problems, because she does not have enough money to buy rice seed, so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy it. She will use the rest of the loan to purchase fertilizers, fuel and pesticide to support the field to make her crops more productive. 

Her husband, Mr. Morn Run, helps her on the farm. Mrs. Moeurn K. is 50 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are employed as garment factory workers, while the youngest one is attending the local school. Her husband appears with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizers, fuel, and pesticides

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is a widow. She had to raise her two children on her own. Nina admits she has had to struggle with many challenges before she could finally find her niche in business. She start selling footwear to provide for her family’s basic needs. Nina has been in the business for seven years.  
The business is the sole source of income for Nina’s family. A true entrepreneur, she always tries to determine client needs and preferences. In addition to her marketing skills, Nina brings the qualities of efficient and focused work to creating affordable and high quality merchandise. She is friendly and gracious, always seeking opportunities to meet the needs of her clients. Today Nina is requesting a loan of $1075 to purchase additional inventory. With increased profits, she plans to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Alhasan

texts.en:
Alhasan U. is a 35-year-old local restaurant operator. She is married and had four kids; one is married, unfortunately one is deceased, and the other two are still in school. Alhasan lives at Koforidua, a suburb of Kumasi, in the Ashanti region. And she has been there since she started her local restaurant. Alhasan's husband is very supportive in providing the basic needs for the family.

Alhasan prepares and sells local foods like "banku" and other local dishes. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. With her tasty meals she has attracted lots of customers in the area where she serves food. Therefore it has become necessary to employ additional hands to assist her in food service. She has added the sale of bananas to her stock.

Alhasan says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to meet her production expenditure. With the loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, firewood, and bunches of bananas to prepare her meals. She would be grateful for your assistance.

Alhasan belongs to a village bank called ‘Nhyira Mma’ which means "Blessed children". She hopes to receive GHS 400 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more to help her husband take care of the Children's educational needs.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, meat, fish, vegetables, firewood, and bunches of bananas

loans.name: Parveen Kosar M. Yaseen Group

texts.en:
Parveen kosar baji is a 36 year old married lady, and a citizen of a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 14 years. Parveen baji married a man whose name is M. Y. and he runs a sweetmeat shop. Basically, he is a professional sweetmeat maker and Parveen baji helps him in making the sweetmeat. She is applying for a loan to buy material (sugar, cooking oil and essences and dried fruit) for her husband’s sweetmeat selling business. 

She is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Khalida parveen baji wants a loan to buy milk to sell. Ramzan baji wants a loan to buy bakery items (bread and butter) to sell. Naziran begum baji wants a loan to buy an embroidery machine for preparing embroidered dresses. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for sweetmeat business.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel A. is married and has 4 dependents. He has received schooling through junior high. Daniel sells electrical items at Kisi near Elmina, which he has done since 2004. His wife is a trader. Daniel uses his income for paying the children's school fees, rent, utility bills and other expenses. Daniel will use the loan to purchase more and a greater variety of electrical items to meet the increase in demand by his customers. With the new profits from his expanded business, Daniel plans to save towards a house he wants to put up so that he can stop renting apartments.

loans.use: To increase size and variety of store inventory

loans.name: Afde N°1 Group

texts.fr: Les cinq femmes du groupe Association Femme Développement Entreprise AFDE N°1  ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Parcelles Assainies U2 (région de Thiès). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Elles exercent presque la même activité de vente de tissus et des habits. Elles sont très sollicitées dans ces activités. Dans le cadre de l’amélioration de la qualité de leurs services et l’agrandissement de la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe confiance ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de micro finance IMCEC avec laquelle il est à son deuxième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour constituer un stock important de tissus et des habits. Les tissus et les habits sont vendus en détail, au comptant au marché grand Thiès.  Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 30 000FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités. Elles ont pour ambition de renforcer leur commerce en faisant le stockage de tissus et habits.
texts.en:
The 5 women of the Association Femme Développement Entreprise AFDE N°1 group have an average age of 40 and live in big traditional extended families in the Parcelles Assainies U2 neighborhood (Thiès region). They met through ties of neighborhood and kinship. They have almost the same business selling cloth and clothing. They are very much sought after in their businesses.

In order to improve the quality of their service and expand their businesses, the members of this confidence group decided to join the micro-finance institution IMCEC, with whom they are on their second solidarity loan (group loan). The preceding loan has been correctly reimbursed.

They intend to use this loan to buy a large quantity of fabric and clothing. The fabric and clothing will be sold retail, for cash, in the big marketplace of Thiès. They each hope to make an average profit of 30,000 F CFA during this loan cycle; the money will be used to cover the needs of their extended family, investing any remainder back into their businesses.

Their ambition is to expand their business inventories of cloth and clothing.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolstering their little businesses

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es: Yovana es una joven muy trabajadora, tiene 26 años y vive en la casa de sus padres con su única hija Elizabeth de 4 años, a quien quiere dar una mejor vida. La crianza de ganado es una actividad muy rentable, pues ella cuida muy bien a sus reses, los alimenta adecuadamente y los mantiene sanos, es por eso que su ganado es uno de los más solicitados en las ferias dominicales de Huancane y Juliaca. Lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es cuidar a sus animales, puesto que ella les tiene mucho cariño. En el futuro espera incrementar el número de reses que tiene, para mejorar sus ingresos, lo más difícil de su trabajo es llevar su ganado hasta las ferias, puesto que le es muy cansado, aun así sabe que tiene que trabajar muy duro para lograr alcanzar sus metas. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, para no perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los 1000 soles solicitados planea comprar más forraje para su ganado y así alimentarlo mejor.
texts.en:
Yovana is a very hard-working young woman. She is 26 years old and lives in her parent's house with her only daughter Elizabeth, who is 4 years old and to whom she wants to give a better life. Raising cattle is a very profitable activity; she takes very good care of her animals, feeding them sufficietnely and keeping them healthy, which is why her cattle is some of the most requested in the Sunday markets of Huancane and Juliaca. She has been doing this for 6 years and what she most likes about the work is raising the animals, since she cares a lot about them. In the future, she hopes to increase the number of animals that she has in order to increase her income. The most difficult part of her job is taking the cattle to the markets, since it is very tiring although she knows that one has to work hard to realize his or her goals. This is her first loan with MFP and she is capable of making the payments on time, so as to not harm the rest of the member of her communal bank, where she is very admired for the responsibility that she demonstrates. With the 1000 Soles requested she plans to purchase more grazing food for her cattle to feed them better.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food for her animals

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Roda C. from Tukuyu. She is married with three children between the ages of 4 and 16. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two orphans. Roda runs a kiosk (grocery) where you can buy the ingredients to make your daily meals and charcoal, a type of fuel that is very commonly used in Tanzania She works at the business for nine to 12 hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by one employee. Roda currently earns about $130 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase commodities in bulk. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Roda thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase commodities in bulk

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica O. is the mother of five children and grandmother to ten children. She is unsure of her age, but guestimated (off-camera) it's around 70. She sells reed mats and vegetables in Dunga Beach, about 5 kms outside of Kisumu. She will use the loan to buy more bamboo for weaving and to buy more vegetables. Her main challenge is short finances and she sometimes must use her own vegetable stock, normally used for selling, for food. Her hope for the future is to receive a loan and improve her lifestyle. This is her first loan. 

In this video, you can hear the interviewer greet Monica saying "Idhi Nade" -- which is Luo for "How are you?" Monica responds, "Adhi maber," meaning "very good." Most people living in Kisumu descend from the Luo tribe, the same tribe as Obama's father. At the end, the interviewer fluctuates between Kiswahili and Luo, saying "Asante Sana" in Kiswahili, meaning "Thank you," and "Erokamano," which in Luo means "thank you." The voices in the background are people coming for a weekly K-MET borrower meeting. To see what one looks like, check out the first video in this blog post: http://fellowsblog.kiva.org/2009/05/14/m-banking/


K-MET, the NGO giving the loan, is unique in that it is not a traditional MFI. Rather, it is a development corporation focused on raising health standards in Kenya. To read more about K-MET’s work, please click here: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=24

loans.use: To buy materials for making reed mats, and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. is from the village of Kiwalan, Iligan City. She is 51 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Elizabeth operates a family member's business providing a recreational place for the people of Kiwalan, Iligan City. She manages a beach resort in their village and has been engaged in her business for over a year, earning approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Eddy Alfredo

texts.es: El Señor Eddy Alfredo A. Cáceres  vive en su propia casa con su esposa. Tiene un taller de soldadura en su vivienda, por lo que  muchos clientes lo visitan por el buen servicio que le ofrece, Eddy se gana la vida desde muy joven, ya que tenía muchas responsabilidades y con lo que ganaba ayudando en un taller de soldadura, logro terminar sus estudios, pero más tarde decide establecer su propio negocio. Eddy es hombre muy responsable y un buen cliente, además genera fuente de trabajos para 2 personas que lo ayudan. El crédito que solicita es para capital de trabajo es para materiales de soldaduras. Su deseo es ofrecer un mejor servicio y permanecer con su negocio.
texts.en:
Señor Eddy Alfredo A. Cáceres lives in his own home with his wife. He has a welding shop in his home, and many customers visit him because of the good service he offers. Eddy has supported himself since he was very young since he had a lot of responsibilities. He used what he earned helping out in a welding shop to finish school. He later decided to start his own business. Eddy is a very responsible man and a good client. He also provides jobs for two people that help him. The credit he is requesting is for working capital so he can buy welding materials. His dream is to offer better service so he can keep his business going for a long time.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Merelyn

texts.en: Merelyn P. is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old, married and has 8 children. She earns a living from her little sari-sari (variety) store. She manages to live comfortably on her earnings of PHP 3,600 per month. She joined Paglaum MPC last 2007 and has been able to make use of the various programs and services of the Cooperative, especially the loans. She is asking for a loan of PHP 9,000 to purchase additional inventory for her store. She hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital.

loans.name: Nazareno Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Nazareno inicia su quinto ciclo con 17 socias.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. comida, abarrotes en general, frutas, animales menores, cereales, quesos, ropa y servicios D. confección D. prendas D. vestir.
	
Como es el caso D. Juana es casada, tiene 50 años y 5 hijos, Juana tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 D. abril en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, además venD. comida y chicha, actividad que realiza todos los días.
	
Por otro lado Felicitas es soltera, tiene 39 años y 5 hijos, Felicitas venD. comida en L. feria D. platos típicos cada 15 días, además los días lunes venD. comida en L. feria D. las nazarenas. Felicitas tiene proyectado iniciar con L. crianza D. animales menores en su casa.
	 
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total D. 8,850 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. animales menores, telas, polos, chompas, arroz, azúcar.

Los sueños D. las socias son tener una tienda, mejorar sus negocios, sus hijos sean profesionales, tener casa propia y tener otros negocios.
texts.en:
The Nazareno (Nazarene) Communal Bank started its fifth cycle with 17 members. They are engaged in different retail businesses selling food, groceries, fruits, small animals, grains, cheeses, ready-to-wear clothes and tailored clothing.

One of the members is Juana, who is 50 years old, married, and has 5 children. She has a vending post at the “12 D. Abril” market where she sells groceries, food, and chicha (a regional fermented beverage). Her business is open every day.

Another member is Felicitas, who is 39 years old, single, and has 5 children. She sells food at the traditional foods fair every two weeks. Felicitas also sells food at the Nazarene fair every Monday. She has plans to start raising small animals from home.

The members need different loan amounts ranging from 300 soles, 600 soles, to 900 soles for a total of 8850 soles to the entire Communal Bank.

Their loans will be used to purchase small animals, fabrics, polo shirts, sweaters, rice, and sugar.

The members dream of having their own stores, improving their businesses, encouraging their children to pursue professional careers, owning their own homes, and starting other businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase small animals, fabrics, polo shirts, sweaters, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
El Sr. Angel S. de 43 años de edad esta casado con la Sra. Gloria Mareco de 37 años de edad, con 2 hijas.
   Don Angel se inició en esta actividad, cuando regreso del vecino pais Argentina, aproximadamente en el año 2.002; ya que su profesión es mecánico general compró todas las herramientas y máquinas necesarias para empezar a trabajar. En la actualidad ya cuenta con una gran clientela que concurre a su local por los buenos servicios que les ofrece. 
   El invertiría este crédito en generar un nuevo empleo a su esposa, como vendedora de ropas.
Desea un país prospero para todos los paraguayos.
texts.en:
Mr. Angel S. and Mrs. Gloria Mareco are 43 and 37 years of age and are married with two daughters. Angel started his business when he returned to Paraguay from Argentina in approximately 2002. Since he is a general mechanic, he bought all of the tools and equipment necessary to start working. Actually, he already has a strong clientele supporting his business because of the good services he offers. He will invest the loan to create a new job for his wife as a clothing salesperson. He hopes for a prosperous country for all Paraguayans.

Translated from Spanish by Cristina Bejarano, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying jackets

loans.name: Kheav

texts.en:
Kheav M. is a widowed mother, 34 years old, and currently lives with her two teenage children in the province of Kompong Tom. To earn a living, she buys mats in bulk at reasonable cost from rural people to retail them by walking around the village of her community.

Kheav M. has been operating in this sector since 2005 and usually earns an average of US $3.50. To make more profit, Kheav M. is looking for a loan to use as capital to accumulate a quantity of mats to resell.

loans.use: To accumulate a quantity of mats to resell

loans.name: Judice

texts.en:
Judice is a 29 year old mother of one who lives and operates a successful secretarial services business in Mukuru slums Nairobi. She was running a grocery previously before opening this business three years ago. She is requesting for a loan of Kes. 80,000 to buy computers and printers. Judice hopes to grow her business into a well established company and buy rental units. She describes herself as determined and focused.


About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Buy computers and Printers

loans.name: Magnolia Del Carmen

texts.es: Magnolia es una persona dinámica y  trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 44 años y es madre de cuatro hijos de los cuales tres son mayores de edad. Magnolia  se dedica a la venta de sandalias, actividad que realiza junto con su esposo en el mercado número dos de esta localidad y por las noches ella se dedica a la venta de comida, este negocio funciona en su casa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Virtuosas” desde hace ocho años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que invirtió en  la compra de gaseosa para vender, en la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 1500 soles que utilizará en la compra de sandalias al por mayor, ya que viajará a la ciudad de Lima a comrparlas. La meta de Magnolia es tener una tienda de calzados, carteras y accesorios.
texts.en:
Magnolia is a dynamic, hard-working, 44-year-old, mother of four children, three of whom are adults. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region where, together with her husband, sells sandals in the local market. During the evening she sells prepared food from her home. She has been a member of the "Mujeres Virtuosas" communal bank for the last 8 years. Her first 300 sol loan was used to purchase soft drinks to sell. Now, she needs a 1500 sol loan which will be used to buy sandals at wholesale since she will travel to Lima to buy them there. Her goal is to have a store specializing in footwear, purses and accessories.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wholesale sandals.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 28 years old and runs a business hawking tea leaves (going door-to-door). She has been doing this for four years and is requesting a loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more stock of tea leaves. Rose describes herself as hardworking and says the she has now developed savings skills from her experience at Faulu. She has hope for a bright future and that she will improve her standard of living through her business and continued loans. About Faulu Kenya: Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add to her stock of tea leaves

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa C. is from the village of Libertad, Misamis Oriental. She is 41 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Josefa owns and operates a business providing transport services to local community members using a motorcycle vehicle with her husband as the driver. Josefa has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $170 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Josefa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Josefa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide this service. Josefa is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. Josefa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James O. is a single man, 23 years old, and he lives in Kabarnet town. James' loan is for Kshs 40,000 and this is the first loan he has ever taken from an MFI. James owns a tailoring shop, which he started three years ago. From his business, he makes a profit of Kshs 12,000 a month. With this loan of Kshs 40,000 James wants to expand his business by purchasing textiles worth Kshs 10,000, buttons worth Kshs 3000, and a new machine worth Kshs 15,000 and use the rest for transport and other needed materials for his business. 

James was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who was already a KADET client. James' customers are residents of Kabarnet town and the surrounding area. James hopes this loan helps his business reach the point where he can employ others as tailors. James' dream is to expand his business and even open another business in a nearby town. He also hopes to buy a plot of land where he will build himself a house, marry and have a happy family.

James describes himself as a hardworking and focused man.

About KADET:
