The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy materials for making clothes

loans.name: Zounkpa

texts.fr: D. Zounkpa est née en 1969 et réside depuis une dizaine d'année à Sainte Cécile, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à HOUSSOU Hounyè, Zounkpa est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Zounkpa vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Zounkpa n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Zounkpa vend de l'huile de palme à Cotonou. C'est à Zinvié à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, que Zounkpa fait ses approvisionnements. Zounkpa a déjà 10 ans d'expérience dans ce métier. Zounkpa est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu deux crédits auprès de l'institution, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Zounkpa voudrait agrandir davantage son activité et mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. C'est la raison pour laquelle Zounkpa sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Zounkpa D. was born in 1969 and for the past decade or so she has lived in Sainte Cécile, a neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Hounyè Houssou, and she is the mother of three children, all of whom are in school. Zounkpa helps her husband with the family expenses. Zounkpa did not go to school. To cover her own costs, those of her husband, and those of her children, Zounkpa sells palm oil at Cotonou. She gets her provisions at Zinvié, in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Zounkpa has 10 years of experience with this work. She is a past client of ALIDé, and has already taken out two loans with this organization. These loans have been paid off properly. Zounkpa would like to continue to grow her business and better meet the needs of her clients. This is the reason why Zounkpa is asking for a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cans of palm oil

loans.name: Mrs. Han Horn Group

texts.en: Mrs. Han H. is the leader of a group of four members who all live in Roliek village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Kuch Mon, helps her on the farm. The couple has two children who both attend the local school. Mrs. Han H. faces a problem because she does not have enough money to buy fertilizer to support her field. Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her rice field

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D. est une femme de 50 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle est très expérimentée en matière de crédit pour y avoir accédé à 13 fois de suite. Avec son prêt elle acheter des des moutons les engraisse et les revendre. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de renforcer ses épargnes et de participer à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Fatou D. is a 50-year-old married mother of 7 children. She is very experienced in matters of credit, having obtained 13 loans in succession. With this loan, she buys sheep, raises them, and resells them. Her profits allow her to strengthen her savings and participate in taking care of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her self-financing capability

loans.name: Ankhbayar

texts.en:
Ankhbayar is the father of an energetic three year-old son and lives in a suburb of Ulaanbaatar.  He is an international economist.  He would like a loan to purchase clean and energy efficient heating fuel in order to reduce the fuel he purchases and uses.  He is worried about the air pollution in Ulaanbaatar and he thinks that the public needs to take more efficient action to reduce the air pollution.

About XacBank Eco Products Program:

Ulaanbaatar is the coldest capital in the world.  Winter temperatures can average -20 Celsius.  60% of the city population lives in tents called gers which consist of wooden frames covered by layers of wool felt. On average, households located in the Ger Districts use 5 tons of coal and 1.5 tons of wood per year. 60% of the pollution in the city during the cold season is attributed to coal burned in the Ger Districts. The bottom fifth quintile spend as much as 40% of their monthly winter income on heating fuels.

XacBank has worked with MicroEnergy Credits to launch a line of eco-products consisting of energy efficient stoves and ger blankets which will reduce energy consumption.

loans.use: To purchase clean and energy efficient heating fuel.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Юсупова Фируза проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 37 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Фируза более 7 лет занимается растениеводством. Она в основном сажает картошку. В этом ей помогает муж. Кредит просит для закупа минеральных удобрений. Фируза хочет расширить свой бизнес. Она намерена получить хороший урожай и продать на рынке.
texts.en:
Firuza Y. lives in the Shahrituz district. She is 37 years old, married and has 3 children. Firuza has been involved in agriculture for over 7 years. She mainly grows potatoes. Her husband helps her with this business. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers. Firuza wants to expand her business. She intends to get a good harvest and sell it at the market.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou N. est âgée de 36 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants et a aussi la charge de 2 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NGOHE depuis 4 ans et demi et a eu 9 expériences avec le crédit. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine, elle va acheter une paire de bœufs pour les engraisser pendant 4 ou 5 mois et les revend sur pied. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de participer financièrement à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Fatou N. is 36 years old, married and mother of four children. She also takes care of two other children. She has been a member of the NGOHE ‘Banc Villageois’ loan group for 4 ½ years and had nine previous experiences with credit loans. Her activity is to fatten cattle, and she will buy a pair of oxen to be fattened for four to five months, after which she will sell them on the hoof. Her earnings will allow her to participate in dealing with family expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a pair of oxen

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: 53-year-old Edna borrows money from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to support her sari-sari store and 1-hectare rice field. She joined CEVI in August 2008 and her business is growing. This time she needs to purchase groceries and farm inputs. She requested a loan of 15,000 Php to use for the needs of her businesses. This will really help her in making progress with her businesses.

loans.use: farm supplies

loans.name: Felipa Tinaza Group

texts.en:
"Obey God's word and have faith," said Felipa T., a simple villager of Leron Buguey, Cagayan. She is 49 years old. Felipa is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Felipa T.'s Group.

Felipa is widowed and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Felipa owns & operates a general store selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Felipa has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Felipa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felipa is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Felipa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda V. is from the village of Waterfall, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 70 years old. Yolanda is married. To make a living, Yolanda owns & operates a specialized business selling bamboo products like nipa and others in the local community. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over 35 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Yolanda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Yolanda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Choek

texts.en: Mrs. Choek K., a 60-year-old widowed homemaker, has two children, one a daughter who is now married and lives with her in the family home. Choek relies on the income from her daughter’s job as a garment worker.  Her son-in-law has a taxi that is in need of frequent repairs, so Choek is requesting a loan in order to mend and decorate it.

loans.use: To mend and decorate the broken taxi.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 41 years old and a father of two. He has been in the bodaboda (motorbike) transport business for two years. Besides this business, he also rears and sells heifers and distributes water using his donkey cart. He belongs to Perfect group in Faulu Kenya. Since he joined the group, he has been able to invest in his business using his weekly savings with the group. He has requested for a loan of KES20,000 to buy a heifer. Samuel hopes to own a piece of land in the future. He dreams of buying a pick-up, in ten years, for transporting animal feed. He describes himself as ambitious and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy a heifer.

loans.name: Sareth's Group

texts.en:
This group, which consists of four people, is based in Veal village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sareth T. has been selected by the other members to be the group leader. The members will each use a portion of the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Sareth T. is 42 years old. She owns a general store, where she earns money to support her family. Since her business has been doing well, she would like to expand the business. To achieve this goal, Mrs. Sareth T. is applying for a loan to buy more groceries to resell. Her husband, Mr. Koy Tout, is a farmer. Specifically, her husband owns a 2-hectare plot of land, where he cultivates rice to sell to support their family. This couple supports four children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the others attend a local public school.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional groceries

loans.name: Mayra Edith

texts.es:
Mayra Edith G. P. tiene 23 años. Es soltera y vive con sus padres en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar.

Magra es una socia de la ventanilla rural Santa Rosa, que está ubicada a una hora y media del cantón Chillanes.  Son 18 socios en total, que en la mayoridad tienen sus propios negocios. Esto es el primer  préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Mayra trabaja en pronaza. Se dedica a la venta de frutas como naranjas y mandarinas. Hace las compras y ventas en Bucay. 
Solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de cultivos de cacao. 

Le gusta escuchar música y jugar fútbol.
texts.en:
Mayra Edith Granzio P. is 23 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolivar. Mayra is a member of the Santa Rosa communal bank, which is located 1.5 hours from the cantón of Chillanes. There are a total of 18 members and the majority of them have their own businesses. This is their first loan with the Cooperativa San José. Mayra works at Pronaza. She sells fruit such as oranges and tangerines. She does her buying and selling in Bucay. She is requesting the loan for use in taking care of cacao plants. She likes to listen to music and watch soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To care for cacao crops

loans.name: 03.01.34-Dien Bien Group

texts.en: Huyen H. T. (166) is a 29-year-old femaL. living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Huyen is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, a Kiva partner. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 34-Dien Bien (03.01.34 Điện Biên). Huyen is married and has two infant children. To making a living, Huyen operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling clothing and shoe products in the local community. Huyen has been engaged in this business for more than four years and earns approximately 2.400.000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month from it. In 2010, Huyen joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Huyen is requesting for the first time a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women of 4.248.000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. Huyen plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. T. T. Hien (163) is a 48-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her general store. 2. L. T. Dap (164) is a 52-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her clothing business. 3. N. T. Dieu (165) is a 60-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her clothing business. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Huyen H. T. (166) là 29 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa. Huyen là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 34-Dien Bien (03.01.34 Điện Biên). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán áo quần & giày dép trong cộng đồng địa phương. Huyen thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Huyen kiếm được khoảng 2.400.000 VND. Vào 2010, Huyen đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Huyen đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. T. T. Hien (163) là 48 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa. 2. L. T. Dap (164) là 52 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo. 3. N. T. Dieu (165) là 60 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 40-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She has 3 children and two are still attending school. She has run a tailoring business from her home since 1984 when she decided to start a home business to support her husband with the family expenses. She works at the request of clients, making different designs of clothes, robes, shirts, pants, etc. in addition to clothing repair. She also does embroidery work. She is requesting a $1000 loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional textiles and a new sewing machine. She specifically notes that she will be able to deliver her services faster because of the new machine. In the future, she would like to expand her client base and she hopes to open a small tailoring factory.
 
Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To buy more textiles and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene B. is from the village of Salay Angadanan. She is 40 years old. Arlene is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Arlene owns and operates a food stall, where she sells vegetables in the local community. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP monthly.

In 2010, Arlene joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be Arlene's second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel Z. is from the village of Andarayan South, Solana, Cagayan. She is 48 years old. Isabel is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Isabel owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising chickens for sale. Isabel has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Isabel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Isabel is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Isabel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna S. is a 45 year old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures; a general store and a pig fattening business. She lives in Brgy. Pasil, Santander, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005, and has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and pig fattening businesses, she is gradually making her family economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000.

Lorna is now borrowing PHP 16000 so she can purchase additional stock for sale. This will be her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 13000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Lorna aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase additional stock for sale

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia G. is a 60-year old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures: a general store and buying and selling rice. She lives in Prk. Sunflower, Barangay Calumangan, Bago City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and buying and selling of rice, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000. Letecia is now borrowing PHP 16,000 so that she  can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP13,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Letecia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and to ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden F. is from the village of La Paz, Saguday, Quirino. She is 35 years old. Eden is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Eden owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Eden has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Eden joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eden has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Eden is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Eden from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofia tiene 45 años, es casada y participa en el banco comunal “Señor De Los Temblores II” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Sofia es una madre emprendedora y trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de comida en la feria sabatina de Huancaro de la ciudad del Cusco. (En la ciudad de Cusco se encuentra ubicada una de las octavas maravillas del Mundo que es la ciudadela de los Incas llamado Machupicchu).  

Sofia con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 500 nuevos soles, ella invertirá el dinero para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, verduras, carnes y muchas cosas más.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Sofia is 45 years old and married.  She is a member of the Señor De Los Temblores II Communal Bank with the Arariwa microfinance entity in the city of Cusco, Perú.  Sofia is an enterprising and hard-working mother.  She sells food in the Sabatina Fair of Huancaro in the city of Cusco.  (One of the eight wonders of the world, the Inca citadel Machupicchu, can be found in the city of Cusco.) 

With her next loan for 500 soles that she hopes to receive Sofia will increase her business capital.  She wishes to buy ingredients like rice, sugar, noodles, vegetables, meat, and many other things.

She is grateful for the opportunity provided and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy ingredients like rice, sugar, noodles, vegetables, meat, and many other things

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia W. is a married woman and a mother of five children. She lives in Gitiha in the district of Kiambu. This region is good for agricultural activities. She mainly relies on crop farming and has been doing so for the last ten years.

Sophia got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member. She has never borrowed from any other financial institution. With this loan advancement she plans to expand her farming activities into dairy farming as well and so would like to buy a dairy cow for milk production.

From the profits gained from her farming, Sophia intends to buy a plot and develop it to achieve a higher income.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en: Boniface, 25 years old, is a single man from Kisumu City, a lakeside town in western Kenya near freshwater Lake Victoria.  Boniface has been operating a carpentry business in Kibuye market, an open air market in the town of Kisumu, for the last six years.  He designs, builds and sells sofa sets. He is taking out a second loan of KES 40,000, which he will use to buy wood and cushions and to pay labor costs for workers who help him. He anticipates selling more as the festive season of December approaches. Boniface intends to use the profits he earns to buy a piece of land, build a house and then start his own family. Later, he plans to expand his business by constructing a big workshop in the city.

loans.use: to buy wood and cushions for making sofas and to pay his workers

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with three children, one of whom attends school while the other two are too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a motorcycle business for the last four years. In addition she sells fresh water which contributes another source of income. Amina faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand and operate a taxi business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase spare parts to repair her motorcycle. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Jannette Marlene

texts.es:
Jannette Marlene G. V. tiene 36 años de edad, Es soltera vive con los hijos en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.


Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNION SAN ANTONIO, Recinto San Antonio parroquia San José del Tambo distancia de la oficina a 150 minutos de la comunidad se encuentra dentro de los límites del Cantón Chillanes. Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, cacao, naranja yuca. Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Jannette Marlene se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Compra sus productos en el Comercial  Matilde Esther y vende los  productos en Bucay.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, cacao, naranja yuca. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener una vivienda propia.

Le gusta dedicarse a los quehaceres domésticos.
texts.en:
Jannette Marlene G. V. is 36 years old.  She is single and lives with her children in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  She has 2 children.

The members of the UNION SAN ANTONIO community bank are located in San Antonio precinct, in San José del Tambo parish, 150 minutes from our office, in Chillanes canton.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  They have been in this business for a long time.

Janette Marlene is a farmer.   She grows corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  She buys her products in the Matilde Esther shopping area and sells her products in Bucay.

Janette Marlene is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for growing corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to own her own home.  She enjoys doing her household chores.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Susana Alexandra

texts.es:
Susana de 30 años, tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres ya que para darle una mejor vida a sus hijos ya que no era casada tuvo que invertir sus ahorros para ganar mas dinero. 

En la actualidad esta administrando su propio negocio y trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta las 22h00pm que termina la atención al publico. Vende todo tipo de productos a un valor muy económico para sus clientes. Tiene muchas aspiraciones para su negocio por eso quiere continuar para darle una buena vida a sus hijos y desea el préstamo para comprar arroz, aceite, bebidas etc. 

En el futuro quiere surtir la mercadería que vende y ubicar otra tienda en otro sector para tener mas ingresos y asi darle una buena vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Susana, 30 years old, has a small grocery store so she can give her children a better life. Because she was not married, she had to invest her savings to earn more money.

Now she runs her own business and works from 6:30 am to 10 pm, when she closes. She sells all types of products at a very affordable price to her customers. She has many goals for her business and wants to continue so she can give her children a good life. She wants this loan to purchase rice, oil, beverages, etc.

In the future she wants to stock up on the merchandise she sells and open another store in another area so she can have more revenue, thereby giving her children a good life.

loans.use: Rice, oil, beverages

loans.name: Deggo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité DEGGO est créé depuis environs 09 ans. Il est composé de 04 femmes qui sont du même quartier. Elles se sont constituées par affinité et par voisinage. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois des ressortissantes de Kaguitt.

Madame BINTOU D. tout à fait à droite de la photo et levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 65 ans et mère de 10 enfants.

Elle fait du petit commerce. Elle vend des tissus thioup et des fruits de saisons. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de mieux développer son activité en renforçant son niveau d'approvisionnement.

Son objectif est de subvenir aux besoins familiaux et d'augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
The Deggo solidarity group was created around 9 years ago. It is composed of four women, all from the same neighborhood. They know each other through ties of affinity and neighborhood. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of the residents of Kaguitt.

Mrs Bintou D., standing far right in the picture and raising her hand, chairs the group. She is 65 years old and the mother of ten children. She runs a small store. She sells thioup (hand-dyed) fabrics and seasonal fruits. She has been in this activity for over 10 years.

Her new loan will enable her to improve her business by expanding its inventory. Her goal is to provide for her family and save more money.

loans.use: To buy thioup fabrics and fruits

loans.name: Carmen Fresia

texts.es: La señora Carmen Fresia H. A. se dedica a la venta de carne hace más de un año aproximadamente en su puesto del mercado el cual es alquilado. La solicitante vive en casa familiar de sus padres comparte los gatos familiares. Está solicitando el crédito para capital de trabajo, se propone otorgarle el préstamo ya que cuenta con experiencia crediticia en otras entidades bancarias lo cual está pagando puntuamente.
texts.en:
For about a year, Carmen Fresia H. A. hace been selling meat in a rented stall at the market. She lives in her parents' house and shares family expenses.

Carmen is asking for the loan for working capital.  It has been decided to grant her the loan since she has loan experience with other banks and is paying off her loan punctually.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem K., 26, resides with her family in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorean temples. K. and her husband sell mats and pillows, earning an income of USD 3.30 each per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 45 on food and USD 107 on other expenses. K. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more mats and pillows to improve the current business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more mats and pillows to resell.

loans.name: Nena's Group

texts.en:
Nena U. is from the village of La Paz, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 45 years old. Nena is the leader of a 9-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Nena is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Nena sells vegetables in the local community. Nena has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Nena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nena has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Nena is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase vegetables to sell. This loan will be the 6th loan Nena has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire T. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Claire has a business of food production, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Claire has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more millet to make flour for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Claire hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Claire hopes to own a big boutique with clothes. 

Claire is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving more in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more millet to make flour for resale.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy N. is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Teddy has a clinic, which she has had for 10 years.         

To help expand her business, Teddy has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more medicine for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Teddy hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food.  In the future, Teddy hopes to open up another clinic.

loans.use: to purchase more medicine for resale.

loans.name: Paula Maura

texts.es:
Paula  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Victor echave”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 60 años de edad.  Es conviviente y tiene tres hijos independientes.  Estudió educación primaria (incompleto).
Viene trabajando  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace siete años,  se dedica al servicio de transporte urbano.  Paralelamente se dedica a la venta de utensilios, joyas y cadenas.  Su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles.
Con este nuevo préstamo de  S/ 3000.00 nuevo soles, comprará llantas y repuestos para su carro.  Trabaja junto con su esposo.
Su sueño es superarse más en el negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y las charlas educativas respecto al negocio.
texts.en:
Paula is a member of the communal bank "Victor Echave," located in the Puno district, Puno province and department. She is 60 years old. She has a common law husband and three independent children. She has an incomplete primary education.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for seven years. She works in urban transport. She also sells utensils, jewelry and chains. Her initial loan was 300 soles. With this new loan of 3,000 soles, she will buy tires and spare parts for her car. She works together with her husband.

Her dream is to get ahead more in her business and improve her earnings. What she likes about the communal bank are the punctuality and the educational chats about business.

loans.use: to buy tires and spare parts for her car.

loans.name: Saniya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Saniya, sont toutes des femmes mariées ont en moyenne 48 ans, 8 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Gnanbourouthila, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce du charbon de bois.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Saniya sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter exclusivement du charbon de bois.                                                                          
La cliente FANTA D. compte acheter du charbon de bois avec les charbonniers du village et environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes au niveau de la ville de Dioïla, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce de charbon.
texts.en:
The women of the group Saniya are all married, and they average 48 years of age and eight children each living in traditional extended families in the village of Gnanbourouthila, prefecture of Dioïla, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. And they do commerce in charcoal. These group members are on their first solidarity loan, which will be used to buy charcoal exclusively. 

Ms. FANTA D., a client, intends to buy charcoal from the charcoal providers in and around the village. She makes her sales in the village of Dioïla and accepts cash or credit from a customer base composed of women and men.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 10,000 francs CFA that will be used to make the loan payments and to help with societal ceremonies. The rest of the profits will be reinvested in her charcoal business.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: El Trebol I Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en casa de la señora Sandra un integrante D. grupo El Trébol 1, Que esta ubicado en VeraC., México. Se ve la señora dentro de su casa junto a las demás integrantes D. grupo en la foto.  Ella se dedica a venta de productos naturistas que inicio hace 2 años. Solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en mercancía para surtir sus pedidos. Sus clientes la consideran una persona trabajadora y responsable, en la cual se puede confiar. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente satisfecha por poder invertir en su negocio. Tiene 25 años, estudio hasta el bachillerato, es casada y tiene 1 hijos varon. Quiere este crédito para poder invertir en producto para surtir sus pedidos que le hacen. También espera poder ahorrar para rentar un local más grande ya que tiene mucha mercancia y no le es sufuciente el que tiene. Con las ganancias que obtenga quiere ahorrar una parte para la educación de su hijo y así logre una carrera Universitarias y una mejor calidad de vida para toda su familia.
texts.en:
This photo was taken in Sandra’s house; a member of the “El Trébol 1” (Clover) group located in VeraC., México.  In the photo she can be seen inside her house together with the other members of the group. 

She has sold natural products for the last two years.  She is asking for the loan to buy merchandise to fill her orders.  Her customers consider her to be a hard working, responsible person that they can trust.  At the moment of soliciting the loan, she feels satisfied for being able to invest in her business.  

She is 25 years old, studied up to high school, is married and has a son.  She wants the loan to be able to invest in products to stock the orders she has pending.  She also hopes to be able to save up to rent a larger locale because she has a lot of merchandise and the space she has available isn’t enough.  She wants to save whatever profits she gets part for her son’s education so that he will attain a university degree and for a better quality of life for all her family.

loans.use: to buy natural products.

loans.name: Javier Yvan

texts.es:
Javier  tiene 39 años de edad, el vive en casa de su suegra, la cual está ubicada  en una zona  urbana marginal, la vivienda cuenta con energía eléctrica, agua y desagüe, la zona donde vive es  pueblo joven en el distrito de la Victoria a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo

Javier  se dedica a prestar servicio de transporte público, el cuenta con una mototaxi (moto, con cabina para transportar personas). Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años.  En este tiempo el a adquirido clientela fija, experiencia en el rubro

Javier está  solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800  nuevos soles para poder realizar un mantenimiento a su unidad móvil, con sus respectivas actualizaciones de documentos y para comprar más mercadería para su negocio de verduras.

Javier es una persona bastante trabajadora y que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que lo conocen lo consideran una persona amable y siempre dispuesta a ayudar a los demás.
texts.en:
Javier is 39 years old and lives in his mother-in-law's home which is located in a poor, urban area.  The house has electricity, piped water and sewerage.  The area in which Javier lives is a young village in Victoria district, 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Javier's business is providing a public transport service.  He owns a motorcycle taxi (a motorcycle with a cabin in back for transporting passengers).  He has been in this business for three years.  Over the years he has acquired regular customers and experience in the field.

Javier is requesting a loan for 800 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can carry out some maintenance work on his vehicle as well as update some documents and buy more merchandise for a vegetable business that he has.

Javier is a hard-working person who strives to get ahead every day so that he can enjoy a better quality of life.  People who know him consider him to be a kind person who is always ready to help others.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance work on his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 33 years old and a focused businessman. He is married and blessed with two children aged  13 and one year and six months.  He has been running a pub since 2002. He gets extra income from his rental houses. 
 
In the next five years, he wants to open up other branches in line with his dream to become a major beer distributor. Through Faulu Kenya, he has become well informed on how to manage his finances.

He wants 80,000 Kenyan shillings to start a butchery.

loans.use: To open up a butchery.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “EL DIAMANTE DE URUBAMBA”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Urubamba en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Martin; el socio tiene 35 años de edad, el socio es soltero y se dedica a la construcción, el socio trabaja en este negocio desde hace 4 años atrás, el socio tiene su fábrica de bloquetas y el vende a las diferentes obras, el socio en esta ocasión solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de bloquetas al por mayor.

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Martin is a member of the "El Diamante de Urubamba" (Diamond of Urubamba) community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Martin is 35 years old, single, and is in the construction business.  He has worked in this business for four years.  Martin has a block factory and sells to different building sites.  On this occasion, he is requesting a loan to invest in buying materials for making blocks wholesale.

Martin is grateful for the support that he is being given and pledges to make his loan repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy materials for making blocks

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is 56 years old, married, and has nine children, one of whom is in school. Nida is in the agricultural business of farming vegetables in the Philippines. Nida requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Nida has been farming vegetables for six years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Nida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is a responsible father who says that, "hard work is the only key to overcoming poverty". He is 54 years old and has four adult-aged children. He works as a farmer raising livestock and in crop production for 30 years now, earning an average net profit of P40,000 per crop season, usually during April and November each year.

To improve his rice production, he is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pay labor fees for his hired people who work with him in the farm. He hopes to harvest a better yield to increase his income that will be used in acquiring  a vehicle for service.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pay labor fees for his hired laborers.

loans.name: Elvia Margarita

texts.es: Doña Elvia tiene 37 años de edad, su familia esta integrada por su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura y ganaderia, y sus tres hijos de los cuales dos son mujeres. Ella es una persona muy simpatica y muy orgullosa de sus tres hijos porque son muy buenas personas y muy buenos estudiantes. Elvia inició con su pequeña pulperia en el 2005 y le dio el nombre de Pulperia Gerson, la cual atiende desde las 7:00 am hasta la tarde-noche. Su mayor ventaja es que no hay mas pulperias en la comunidad y sus vecinos realizan las compras diarias en su negocio, aunque ultimamente sus ventas han bajado ya que cada dia los productos de la canasta basica son mas caros. El prestamo que Doña Elvia solicita lo necesita para la compra de arroz, manteca, embutidos, lacteos, refrescos, azucar, frijoles, dulces, pan, churros, entre otros. Con el apoyo del prestamo podra surtir de mas y variados productos y con ello sus clientes siempre encontraron lo que necesitan. Su meta es apoyar a sus hijos con el estudio, aunque siente un poco de temor de que al graduarse no encuentren un empleo, asi que espera que ellos se decidan a tener un negocio propio al igual que ella. Este es el primer ciclo de Doña Elvia en FAMA y espera cumplir de manera puntual el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Elvia is 37 years old and her family consists of her husband who works in agriculture and with livestock, and her three children, 2 of whom are females.  She is a very caring person and proud of her three children because they are good people and good students.  Elvia started her small store in 2005 and named it Gerson Store which operates from 7AM until dusk.  Her greatest advantage is that there are no other convenience stores in the community and her neighbors carry out their daily shopping at her store.  Ultimately, her sales have dropped due to the daily increasing cost of staple goods.  Elvia solicits a loan to purchase: rice, lard, sausages, milk, soft-drinks, sugar, beans, sweets, bread, and churros amongst other things.  By having support from the loan she can then stock more and varied products which will allow her customers to always find what they need.  Her goal is to help her children with school although she fears they may not be able to find employment upon graduation which is why she hopes they establish a business of their own just like her.  This is Elvia's first loan with FAMA and she expects to make punctual payments.

loans.use: to purchase groceries in general

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children.
 
Emelie has a shop that sells canned goods, breads, detergents and snacks. She has had this business for 25 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Emelie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Emelie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: El señor Oscar es Chofer; está afiliado en un sindicado de transportes. Además, tiene una tienda de abarrotes para su esposa. El crédito lo necesita para el aumento de capital compra de abarrotes (arroz, fideo, azúcar, etc.) y dulces, pues la tienda es la fuente de ingresos que tiene su esposa para ayudar a mantener  a su familia. Es casado, no tiene hijos y vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de las Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Oscar is a driver affiliated to a transportation syndicate.  Besides, he has a grocery store for his wife.  He needs the loan to increase capital purchasing groceries (rice, noodles, sugar, etc.) and candy because the store is his wife’s source of income that helps support the family.  He’s married and has no children and lives in his own house located in the city of La Paz’s Pasankeri zone.  This is the second time he’s requested a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his wife's store.

loans.name: Si

texts.en: Si, 24 years old, is a grocery seller, earning $3 per day. Her husband works as a Tuk Tuk driver (a motorcycle-based taxi), earning $4 each day. Her husband has been running this business activity for many years. She and her husband would like to purchase a new motorbike but they lack capital so they need to apply for a loan in amount of $500 USD from HKL. Her husband hopes that when he buys a new motorbike, he will service his clients quicker. Clients’ satisfaction is the one way to improve his family’s financial stability. This humble couple has two kids who are living under their care. She and her husband are very thankful to all donors. In the future, Si will be trying to support her children to study until they finish university. This is her first loan with HKL and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 41 years old and married with five children.

Veronica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a tobacco business in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of tobacco to sell.

Veronica has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the tobacco business for eight years, and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and pig fattening.

Veronica aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Leena

texts.en:
Leena is a 33 years old married woman who wants a child.  Leena and her husband's jobs provide decent salaries. 

She wants to undergo a medical surgery in hopes it will enable her to get pregnant soon.  She and her husband don't have the money needed to pay for the surgery, so she is asking for a loan of $3,000 from FATEN.   If she gets the loan, it will be repaid on a monthly basis.

Leena feels the surgery is her best hope to become pregnant and have a baby.  This will increase her self-confidence and let her live a better life.

loans.use: to pay for medical surgery.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius is a 40-year-old man married with five children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  His dreams for his family are to educate his children and to build a better house.

Pius has been brewing alcohol for the last fifteen years.  He used profits from brewing to start up a bar, though he has been challenged by price fluctuations.  Pius plans to use the proceeds of this loan to buy bananas to make banana beer.

loans.use: to buy bananas

loans.name: María Agustina

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte (Portoviejo) se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unión Hace La Fuerza. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

Aquí conocimos a la señora María, Tiene 47 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual  y tiene dos hijas de 10 y 7  años las mismas que estudian en escuela.  Su marido es comerciante.

Ella tiene un pequeño local en su casa donde  se dedica a la preparación y  venta de comidas rápidas como panes de almidón, corviches, tortas de choclo, empanadas además de café, gaseosas y otros, trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 20h00.  Lleva en este negocio más de 15 años en los cuales le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos, café, gaseosas, etc. lleva en el Banco Comunal 11 años y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido salir de situaciones muy difíciles en su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que vive en la casa de sus suegros.
texts.en:
In Rocafuerte Canton (Portoviejo) the members of the “La Unión Hace La Fuerza” (Unity Makes Strength) communal bank meet every two weeks.  This place is known for the delicious sweets the locals make that are renowned nation-wide.

We met María here.  She’s 47 years old and is in a common law relationship and has two daughters who are 10 and 7 years old and are going to school.  Her husband’s a merchant.

She has a small space in her house that she uses to prepare and sell fast food like bread, deep fried plantain dough stuffed with fish, potato cakes, turnovers as well as coffee, soft-drinks and others.  She works every day from 7am until 8pm.  She’s been in business more than 15 years and has done very well.

She will use the loan to buy foodstuffs to prepare the food, coffee, soft-drinks, etc.  She’s been in the communal bank 11 years and likes it because the loans have helped her get through very difficult situations in her business.  Her dream is to have her own house since she currently lives with her in-laws.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, coffee, soft-drinks, etc.

loans.name: Leopoldo Eugenio

texts.es: Don Leopoldo 60 años de edad, nació en el departamento de León , es casado, es padre de 5 hijos, todos ellos mayores de edad independientes, el es comerciante desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de muebles fabricados, el no realizo sus estudios completos por falta de recursos económicos solo llego hasta sexto grado de primaria pero ha salido adelante y es vendiendo muebles que termino de criar a sus hijos para que nada le hiciera falta. Este ha sido su primer negocio y del cual sobrevive hoy en día antes solo vendía roperos y camas ahora vende gabinetes, sillas y colchones. El requiere el préstamo para comprar juegos de sillas, mesas de noches, tocadores, cunas pues se acerca los mese en las ventas aumentan y el crédito le ayudara a surtir su inventario de productos que no tiene. Por lo pronto su meta próxima es lograr vender su mercadería, pagar su crédito y seguir trabajando para hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Leopoldo, 60, was born in León Department.  He’s married and the father of five children who are all independent adults.  He’s been a merchant for fifteen years; he sells manufactured furniture.  He did not complete his schooling for lack of economic resources and only got as far as 6th grade but he’s gotten ahead and by selling furniture was able to raise his children and see that they lacked nothing.

This has been his only business and the one he still survives with today.  He used to just sell armoires and beds but now sells cabinets, chairs and mattresses.  He needs the loan to buy sets of chairs, night stands, dressing tables and cradles because the months when sales increase are approaching and the loan will help him stock up on inventory with items he currently does not have.  His goal for the present is to sell his merchandise, repay his loan and continue working to make his business grow.

loans.use: to buy sets of chairs, night stands and dressing tables.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is married with 4 children. She is 52 years old and lives in Nazareth, Buenavista Pagadian City, Philippines.

She is a farmer and raises pigs. She earns 6,000 PHP from this activity. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PHP to purchase pigs to raise.

She has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, she hopes to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to raise

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 22 years old and lives in Talic, Oroquieta City. She is married and has no children. 

Evelyn has a snack vending business and earns approximately PHP 1,600 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business. 

Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a covered porch in front of her house.

loans.name: Srun

texts.en: Mrs. Srun, 39, has 3 children who attend school. She earns her living as a greengrocer in her commune in Pre Chor district. She typically buys vegetables from her suppliers and grows them herself as well, yielding an average income of $2 per day. Her husband is also in the same business but he sells in a different area. Srun will use this $700 loan to fix her house which is in disrepair. Her business goal is to expand and satisfy her customers’ demand.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Khanim Yusif Gizi

texts.en:
50-year-old Khanim lives her family life with 5 children. Her family’s living condition is not good enough. The family income is rather limited. She is an internally displaced person (IDP). Since 2003, Khanim has been engaged in cattle breeding to improve her family’s living condition. She started her business with a cow and a calf. As she didn\'t have enough financial resources to begin with, she couldn\'t develop her business well enough.

Having borrowed 3 loans of $400-$600-$600 from Komak Credit Union in 2003-2005, Khanim significantly expanded her business, bought a lot of cows and calfs, achieved progress in her business, and increased her family income. The loans were paid back timely. Khanim is requesting this loan to further expand her business.

loans.use: To buy new cows and calfs

loans.name: Rachel Lum

texts.en:
Rachel is a mother of three, the youngest being 2 years old. She has not forgotten the pain and misery she underwent when her husband sent her away, saying that she could not bear children. Those bitter memories later became her motivation to go into business, especially when she eventually bore a child. From her two previous loans she was able to pay tuition for her children. She makes and sells fast food, puff-puffs, to her community for breakfast.

With a loan of $400, she plans to stock flour, sugar, yeast, and oil for her puff-puff business. She also wants to buy a pig to start a piggery and cocoyam and pepper seeds to cultivate. She sees her experience in the puff-puff business and the availability of a piece of land to use for cultivation at little or no cost as strengths, and the increasing population as an opportunity to explore.

She plans to repay the loan in 18 months. The first installment will be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Frying Puff-Puffs

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana raises and sells chickens and turkeys and this loan will help her increase her small flock. She also has a related business cooking traditional food which she serves in her home, especially to the groups of women who gather there to repay their loans and discuss how they can help each other solve their problems. Adriana would like help to learn about poultry vaccination so she can do it herself. Her dream is to use this credit to raise more poultry and someday, hopefully, to buy a cow.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Con el crédito, Adriana compraria mas Gallinas y Chompipes porque actualmente tiene poquitos. Ella compra, venD. y cria animales con la cual ya pueD. hacer otros negocios como venta D. comidas tipicas D. su region. Ella venD. comida desD. su casa y mucho D. su venta es con los grupos D. mujeres quienes prestan su casa para hacer sus reuniones en donD. pagan sus creditos. Antes no habia mucha venta pero ultimamenteella ha tenido éxitos porque esta con el grupo D. mujeres donD. platican problemas soluciones y otros. QUE NECESIDADES TIENE: Que le capaciten sobre como vacunar a las gallinas, para que ella misma vacune a su pollos. QUE SUEÑA: Comprar mas gallinas y chompipes. contar con crédito un poco más alto para algun dia comprar una vaca.

loans.use: To raise chickens and turkeys.

loans.name: María Alcira

texts.en:
Maria F. is a 25 year old mother of 1 child, Patty, aged 10. María is a very hard worker. She runs a hairdressing salon that is open from 7 am until 10 pm everyday. Maria started as a hairdresser at a very young age. At first, she worked for a hairdresser down the street from where she lives before she started her own business. The number of clients per day may range from 5 to 15, with Saturdays as her busiest day of the week.

Aside from the hairdresser store, Maria also owns a small ice cream store that is attached to the hairdresser store. She converted the small space into an ice cream store about 1 year ago. Maria's business is basically a two-person operated business. When Maria is working in the hairdresser store, her older sister, Laura, watches over the ice cream store, and when Maria is over at the ice cream store, Laura works in the hairdresser store.

Maria's ice cream store and hair salon are very simple, and only contain the bare necessities to provide their services. Maria is requesting this $400 loan to purchase more hair products, including shampoo and conditioner, in order to continue the operation of her services.

loans.use: Purchase shampoo and conditioner.

loans.name: Djabrayil

texts.en: Djabrayil is 56 years old , married  and has 4 children. He  lives in the Yenikand village of the Salyan region. 20 years ago he started his farming business and now requests a loan of $475 to buy pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides for his farm

loans.name: Maruja

texts.en: Maruja has owned a little restaurant in Lima for five years, serving popular Peruvian dishes like “Pollo a la Brasa” (a rotisserie-style chicken) on her menú del día, a set menu that lets you choose between a few starters and a few main dishes for a lower price than ordering from the regular menu.  She works very long hours, from 6:30 in the morning until 9:00 or 10:00 at night.  Maruja’s husband also works, and helps her in the restaurant when he can.  Their grown daughters also help out as much as possible.  Maruja recently joined her village bank and is excited about this loan to ‘complement the business’.  She will use it to purchase ingredients and food to prepare for her restaurant.

loans.use: purchase ingredients and food to prepare for her restaurant

loans.name: Dileysi Mateo

texts.en:
Dileysi is thirty-four years old, and she and her husband have five children, four of them boys, who range in age from six to fourteen years old. They all attend school.

Dileysi dedicates herself to the preparation and selling of sandwiches, pâtés, hot dogs and natural juices. She has been running this business for more than five years. About six months ago, she took a loan from FSMA which she invested in the purchase of ingredients and new kitchen utensils. She repaid the loan successfully.

Now, Dileysi can provide better services to her customers, and the food is prepared in very good, hygienic conditions. The entrepreneur hopes her business can keep on growing. With this second loan she has requested, she will buy ingredients to prepare her sandwiches and she says she is working hard to make her business better and attract new clientele.

loans.use: Buy ingredients to produce her sandwiches

loans.name: Edith Carolina

texts.es:
Edith, 55, is married with 5 children, three of whom are in school. She is a native of Bluefields and has owned a small general store for more than 20 years. She makes the most of her business, selling green vegetables and "vigorones" (a traditional dish made with yucca), among other things. Her business is located in a well-known spot in the city, known as the Radio Zelaya corner. This has helped her business, as has the range of products she sells. However, she needs a loan so that she can supply her business and increase her earnings. She wants to buy stocks of rice, cooking oil, sugar, flour, yucca, "quesiquiques", cocoa, "repollo" (a native green vegetable), and potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Edtih Carolina B. es una mujer creole de 55 años de edad, casada con 5 hijos, tres se encuentran estudiando, es originaria de Bluefields y tiene una pulperia por mas de 20 años. Esta señora aprovecha para ademas de vender granos basicos, tambien vende verduras y vigorones. Su negocio esta ubicado en una parte de referencia de la ciudad que es conocida como la esquina de radio zelaya. Esto le permite tener buenas ventas de sus productos. La variedad de productos que vende le permite tener unas buenas ventas, sin embargo necesita un financiamiento para poder surtir su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias. Requiere comprar 3 quintales de arroz a US$ 41 cada quintal, 2 bidones de aceite a US$ 25 cada bidon, 2 quintales de azucar a US$ 26 cada quintal, 1 quintal de harina a US$ 34 el quintal, 3 sacos de yuca a US$ 8 el saco, 2 sacos de quequisques a US$ 25 cada saco, 150 unidades de coco a US$ 0.50 cada coco, 35 unidades de repollo a US$ 1 cada unidad y 1 sacos de papas a US$ 47 el saco.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en: Mona is a 43 year old woman who lives in south Lebanon, in Saida. Mona owns a store in which she sells perfumes, make up and accessories. She wants to buy new merchandise to offer a greater variety of perfrumes and cosmetics. She is therefore asking for a loan from Al Majmoua to continue sustaining and developing her business.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise for her perfume business

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru:
Gulnora Yusupovna H. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 25 years old and not married. She has secondary education and is an entrepreneur. She is manufacturing candy "Pichak." The main ingredients of this type of candy is sugar and water. When the candies are ready she gives them for resale to market vendors. Gulnora has been in this business for about four years. Her products are very popular among the residents and this is why her business provides the opportunity to supply the markets with candy at affordable prices. She plans to use the loan to purchase and stock up with sugar because the prices tend to go up. This will allow to keep the price low for the product. Gulnora plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Хайдарова Гулнора Юсуповна проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Возраст 25 лет ,не замужем. Образование среднее. Занимается предпринимательством в сфере производства. Готовит конфеты « Пичак» . Основными ингридиентами данного вида конфет является сахар и вода.После того как конфеты готовы клиентка отдает их на реализацию продавцам,на рынки.Занимается этим видом деятельности около 4 лет. Ее продукция пользуется успехом у населения , поэтому ее бизнес дает возможность обеспечить рынки конфетами по доступным ценам. Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы приобрести и запастись сахаром, так как цены на него растут .Это позволит удерживать цены на данную продукцию.Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy sugar

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 36 years old and is married woman with 2 children, ages 12 and 8 years old. Catherine is a clothes and shoes seller and she started her business in 2004. Everyday, she works from 7am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $225 from her sales.

In the past, Catherine has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: to buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen G. M. has a general store in the town of Cruz del Pardo high in the sierras of La Libertad Region. She started the store two years ago from a room in her home. Before the general store, she had a business buying and selling different vegetables.

Carmen is 33 years old and single with 1 child. She is happy to have her business because she can work from home, spend time with her child, and her economic situation has improved. In the future she hopes to send her child to school and keep on growing her store.

A member of the community bank Luchando Progreso, Carmen is requesting a loan of s/1500 to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to restock her store with the best selling products.

loans.use: She will use the loan to restock her store with the best selling products.

loans.name: Folashade

texts.en:
Folashade A. lives in Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells iced fish in her shop located behind the Iyana- Iba market. She has 3 deep freezers in her shop. She is 41 years old and married with 2 children.

Folashade has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 4 years. She has been in her business since 1997. Now, she needs a loan of $275 to buy more iced fish for the maximum growth of her business.

loans.use: To buy more iced fish for sale

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge is a young man, 30 years old, who has been fascinated with the restaurant business since he was young. To meet his family's economic needs he began working at a ceviche restaurant when he was 17. There he met his business partner, and together they started their own business, earning such recognition that they opened branches in other cities. But Jorge became sick, and had to undergo urgent surgery, forcing him to leave work. After two years the business went under. Regardless, Jorge is recuperating and he started a new business independently. Now he has a ceviche restaurant in the local market where he's settled, and he hopes to expand the business like he did years ago. In order to realize his dreams he needs your help and is asking for a loan of 1300 soles that will be indispensable to the improvement of his restaurant. Jorge would like to create a more welcoming ambiance for his clients. We hope that you can be the person that helps this young man, who has such a strong desire to overcome the past and to forge a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Jorge es un joven de 30 años que desde muy temprana edad le fascinó el negocio de la venta de comida y a consecuencia de la necesidad de su familia empezó con esta actividad a los 17 años como ayudante en una cevichería.
