Fue ahí donde conoció al que sería su socio, juntos establecieron su propio negocio, y así empezaron, llegaron a tener tanta acogida que abrieron sucursales en otras dos ciudades. Pero Jorge enfermó, y tuvo que ser operado con urgencia y dejó de trabajar y en dos años su negocio se vino abajo. Sin embargo, Jorge está recuperado y empezó de manera independiente su propio negocio. Ahora tiene una cevichería en el mercado de la localidad donde radica y tiene el deseo de expandir su negocio como hace unos años atrás. Para la realización de sus deseos requiere de su apoyo y solicita un préstamo de 1300 soles que le son indispensables para la mejora de su restaurante, Jorge quiere un ambiente más acogedor para sus clientes. Esperamos que usted pueda ser la persona que pueda cooperar con este joven que tiene muchos deseos de superar el pasado y forjarse un futuro mejor.

loans.use: Improve the infrastructure of his ceviche restaurant, creating a more welcoming ambiance and keeping his clients satisfied.

loans.name: Juramurod

texts.ru:
Juramurod B. lives in the Shahrinav district. He is 39 years old, married and has 5 children. He has an incomplete higher education and is a teacher by profession. However, he does not work as a teacher because the pay is low. Instead, he has been a taxi driver for the last 5 years. This work is the sole source of income for his big family. Juramurod’s wife takes care of their household and children. The loan is needed for car repairs. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina, Kiva Volunteer.

Бокиев Джурамурод житель района Шахринав.Возраст 39 лет, жнат, имеет 5 детей. Образование незаконченное высшее,по специальности учитель. Но по специальности не работает,так как заработная плата маленькая. Клиент 5 лет как работает таксистом. Этот вид деятельности является единственным источником дохода его большой семьи.Так как жена клиентка не работает,она ведет домашнее хозяйство и воспитывает детей. Кредит клиент берет для ремонта автомашины.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: Auto repair

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 40 years old and married with four children.  Agnes sells provisions, foodstuffs, and drinks.  She lives in Lagos with her family.  Agnes buys her foodstuffs from Mile 12 in Lagos state, and she brings the foodstuffs to her community to sell.  Agnes sells foodstuffs like rice, beans, and yams.  She has been in this business for the past eighteen years.  She is a client of LAPO (Kiva's Field Partner).  She needs the loan amount of $450 to purchase more foodstuff and drinks to sell.

loans.use: Purchase of more provisions and drinks

loans.name: Arif

texts.en:
Arif Q. is 41 years old, married with two sons. Arif started his business because he needed extra income to pay for household and personal expenses and to afford his home. He has been selling men's and women's clothes and women's shoes for eight years and enjoys his work.

Arif would like to add new seasonal stock to his inventory. For this purpose he requests a loan of $1200. With your help, he can earn more and meet his two sons' school expenses. Arif would like to express his gratitude for everyone supporting him.

loans.use: To purchase new seasonal stock for his inventory.

loans.name: Phet

texts.en: Mrs. Phet S. is a farmer in Ampil Village in Kandal Province. She owns a 1.5 hectare field and cultivates rice. On her plantation she now faces an obstacle because her field is infertile and it affects her crop. She decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to improve her soil. Her husband, Mr. Thoeurn S., helps her on the plantation. Mrs. Phet S. is 53 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve her crop

loans.name: Yong

texts.en: Mr. Yong E. is a vice village chef in Kradass Khor village in Kampong Cham Province. His wife, Mrs. Souy Thol, is a farmer who owns a small plot of land where she cultivates rice. The plot is too small to produce enough rice to support the family well. In order to improve this, Mr. Yong E. decided to ask for a loan to buy another piece of land to cultivate rice. He is 54 years old and the father of three children, one of whom is a tailor and the other two attend the local school. His wife is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy land to cultivate rice

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị Phương năm nay 38 tuổi. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1999. Hiện tại cả hai vợ chồng chị đều kinh doanh dịch vụ đám cưới. Do nhu cầu về dịch vụ này tại địa phương đang ngày càng tăng cao nên công việc kinh doanh của gia đình chị cũng phát triển rất thuận lợi và cho thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để mua thêm đồ dùng, trang thiêtd bị phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lê Thị Phương is 38 years old, and has participated in the TYM Fund since 1999. Currently she and her husband together run a business which provides services for weddings. The demand for this type of service has been rising steadily in her community, so her business has become quite successful, and now provides her family with an income of 3,000,000 VND (180 USD) per month. In the next lending cycle, she hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND (600 USD) to invest in equipment for her wedding services business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wedding services business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam E. has one milling machine that she uses to mill grains such as millet, corm, etc., but she is not able to meet the demand of her numerous customers. She needs the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase an additional milling machine to enable her to meet the demand of her customers. She is 45 years old and married with 10 children. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase an additional milling machine

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
La señora Marlene D. se dedica a su negocio de venta de verduras y frutas en su propio tramo en el mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega donde se dedica arduamente a laborar.

Sus ventas las realiza desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana atendiendo muy amablemente y cada vez que se lleva a cabo una venta, ella entrega el producto en bolsas y con una alegre sonrisa ya que es una dama muy sonriente. Su necesidad es la adquisición de las frutas y verduras por lo que ya se le han estado agotando y es por esto que espera en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito y de esta forma continuar en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Marlene D. works extremely hard selling fruit and vegetables in her own section of the central market in the city of Chinandega. She begins work very early in the morning but always serves her customers in a friendly way. Everytime she completes a sale, she bags the purchase with a happy smile, as she is a person who is always smiling. She needs to purchase more fruits and vegatables to replace those which have sold out. For this reason she has requested a loan from Kiva partner Ceprodel, which will allow her to continue her business as it requires a lot of her support.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing vegetables

loans.name: Kassipin

texts.fr:
Madame Kassipin Traoré est âgée de  47 ans et vit  dans une famille polygame  dans l’un des quartiers de la ville de koutiala, Hamdallaye (troisième région du Mali)
Pour des raisons sociales elle n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école.Très tôt elle s’interessa aux activités génératrices de revenu notamment la fabrication  de savons. Elle a eu les premières notions auprès de sa mère et les perfectionna  ensuite dans une association feminine de koutiala. Depuis maintenant 15 ans elle  exerce cette activité, vu sa réputation, elle reçoit beaucoup de commandes  à travers des vendeuses détaillantes de savons de la ville de koutiala.   
Pour la satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’augmentation de son fonds de commerce, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 2 ans.  Après  4 prêts de groupe (prêt solidaire ) tous  remboursés correctement, elle est à son premier prêt  individuel.
Elle compte acheter, 3 barils d’huile à l’usine ( FAMAB ) de koutiala. Elle effectue sa vente à koutiala ville.  
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000FCFA qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement du prêt et contribuer aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs.Kassipin Traoré is 47 years old and lives in polygamous family in one of the neighborhoods of the city of Koutiala, Hamdallaye (third district of Mali). For social reasons she was not able to attend school. At a very young age she became interested in business activities to generate income, notably the manufacture of soaps. She first learned the business from her mother, then mastered it through her associations with other women in Koutiala. She has operated this business for 15 years and due to her reputation she receives many orders from retailers who sell soap in the city of Koutiala. To satisfy her customers needs and to increase her operating capital she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance company two years ago. After 4 group loans (guaranteed group loans), all of which were duly repaid, she would like to make an individual loan. She plans to buy 3 barrels manufacturing oil (Famab) from Koutiala. She will resell this in Koutiala and expects to make a monthly profit of 75,000 Francs CFA which she will use to meet her loan payments and contribute to the family expenses.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy barrels of oil to use in manufacturing soap

loans.name: Joseph Y

texts.en: Joseph Y A. sells plastic products, which he makes himself, at Kisi near Elmina. Joseph Y, who has a junior high school education, is a single parent and has 4 dependents. Joseph Y has been selling plastics since 2005. He is responsible for paying his family's rent and utility bills, his children's school fees, and other financial expenses. His loan will be used to meet growing customer demand by increasing the inventory of plastic products he makes and sells. He hopes to reinvest the new profits from his business into expanding his trade and also to save toward building a house so he can stop renting apartments.

loans.use: As additional capital so he can make and sell more plastic products.

loans.name: Funke

texts.en: Funke O. sells clothes and bags. She is 42 years old and married with four children. She is requesting a loan of 80,000 Nairas to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es: Ysabel tiene 40 años, es una madre muy amorosa, vive en su propia casa junto a sus 3 hijos; Roxana de 17, Freddy de 14 y Jhon de 12 años y lo que más desea es darles una buena educación. La crianza de ganado le ha resultado un negocio muy rentable, puesto que sus reses son muy solicitas en las ferias dominicales de Huancane y Juliaca, ella cría con mucho amor a sus animales, desde muy temprano los lleva a pastar y siempre está fijándose en que la comida que están ingiriendo sea saludable. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es caminar por los extensos campos en compañía de su ganado, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más difícil es llevar sus reses hasta las ferias donde las vende. Para el futuro espera aumentar el número de ganado que tiene actualmente, pero sabe que para eso tiene que trabajar mucho y está dispuesta a hacerlo. Este es el primer préstamo de Ysabel con MFP y promete pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, puesto que no quiere perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por la alegría que le pone al grupo. Con los 1000 soles que solicita planea comprar un toro, el cual le costará aproximadamente 4000 soles, para ello está dispuesta a poner parte del dinero de sus ahorros para completar el monto necesario.
texts.en:
Ysabel is 40 years old. She is a very loving mother and lives in her own home with her three children: 17-year-old Roxana, 14-year-old Freddy, and 12-year-old Jhon. Her greatest desire is to give them a good education. Raising cattle has become a very profitable business for Ysabel, seeing her cows are in great demand at the Sunday fairs in the towns of Huancane and Juliaca. Ysabel raises her animals with lots of love. She takes them out to pasture really early in the morning and always makes sure their food is good for them. Ysabel's favorite aspect of her work is walking around the vast countryside with her cattle. She has been in this business for 20 years and the most difficult thing is bringing her cows to the fairs for sale. In future Ysabel hopes to increase the number of cattle she has. She knows that, to do this, she must work very hard and is ready to do so. This is Ysabel's first loan with [Kiva partner] MFP and she promises to make all her payments on time, seeing she doesn't want to cause harm for the other members of her community bank, where she is well liked for the joy she brings to the group. Ysabel plans to use the requested 1,000 soles [about US $350] to purchase a bull, which will cost about 4,000 soles. She plans to use part of her savings to cover the remaining cost of the bull.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Vick

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 32-years-old Vick M. from Mbeya. Vick has been running a tailoring business since 2007, making different types of clothes. She works at the business for 9 to 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by four employees. Vick currently earns about $80 US a month. She is married with three children between the ages of 4 and 12. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase tailoring materials. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Vick thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through microleasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor coverage of basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials

loans.name: Salome

texts.es:
Salome es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Salome es soltera, tiene 62 años y 3 hijos, Salome tiene una distribuidora de gas, el local esta en su casa, la venta es al por mayor y menor, para lo cual cuenta con empleados que llevan el producto a domicilio, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Salome necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de balones.
Los sueños de Salome son incrementar sus ventas y tener otros puntos de venta.
texts.en:
Salome is a member of Communal Bank Obreras. She is 62 years old, single, with 3 children. Salome has a business selling gas. Her shop is in her home. She sells wholesale and retail, and has employees who do home delivery, which she does with the help of her children. Salome needs a loan of 2000 soles that she will use to purchase propane tanks. Her dream is to increase her sales and have additional locations.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of propane tanks

loans.name: Ednalayn

texts.en:
Ednalayn L. is from the village of Anonang, Dumalinao. Zambo Sur. She is 30 years old. Ednalayn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ednalayn works in a family member's business venture selling home products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products to tourists and local community members. Ednalayn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ednalayn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ednalayn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Ednalayn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ednalayn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Los Girasoles De Compone Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal se denomina “LOS GIRASOLES DE COMPONE”, Este banco comunal está conformado por 18 miembros, los que viven en el distrito de Anta.

Nuestros socios alternan sus diferentes actividades con la agricultura y la ganadería, ellos llevan años con esta actividad, la que les rinde económicamente, los socios compran y crían ganados vacunos y ovino, ellos los hacen engordar y los venden, o también sacan los derivados de la leche para la venta, de igual modo son dueños de tierras donde cultivan, la papa y sus diferentes variedades, el maíz, las verduras, cebadas, trigo y otros. Por esta razón nuestros socios desean el préstamo para poder reinvertir en sus diferentes actividades.

Los socios agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago total de sus deudas.
texts.en:
This community group is called "LOS GIRASOLES DE COMPONE". This community bank is made up of 18 members that all live in the district of Anta.

Our members alternate their activities between agriculture and farming, and they have been doing this for many years. They do well financially and the members buy and raise young cows and sheep, fattening them and selling them as well as selling dairy products from their milk. They are the owners of the land where they cultivate potato and its different varieties, maize, vegetables, wheat and barley among other things. For this reason our members need a loan to reinvest in their different activities.

Our members are grateful for the loans given to them in this way, and they are committed to repaying their total debt in full.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals, seeds, and young animals in bulk/Comprar animales mayores, semillas, animales menores.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa E. has 5 children: 2 are high school students and 3 are elementary school students. Her husband is also her partner in their bamboo mat business, which was set up from small capital provided by PMPC. Marissa is a microfinance member of Paglaum Development Program for Landless People. She wants to improve her business so that she can get more customers for her "amakan" (bamboo mat) business. She has repaid her past loans and is thankful to PMPC for helping her with insurance and savings deposit for her entire family.

loans.use: Additional capital for her bamboo mat business

loans.name: Esperanza Gelesmith

texts.es:
La señora Esperanza Gelesmith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Doradinas en Acción”, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 34 años y madre de 02  hijos, los 02 que aun depende de ella.

Esperanza, es una mujer perseverante y capaz. Se dedica a la venta de ropas, en un lugar acondicionado, frente al Mercado de su Distrito y nos comenta que le esta yendo muy bien, cuenta con clientes que ya la conocen y saben de su negocio. 
La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza, le ayudo a crecer como mujer independientemente y esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado.

Con este préstamo de S/. 600.00, comprará  más mercadería de ropas para surtir su stock como: pantalones, shorts, blusas en todas las tallas y modelos, polos y vestidos para adultos y niñas. 

Se siente una mujer establecida y trabajadora y agradece la oportunidad que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos  la ha ofrecido, para así desarrollarse como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Mrs. Esperanza belongs to the “Doradinas en Accion” Community Bank, located in San Jose de Sisa District, Dorado Province, San Martin Department. She is 34 years old, living with a partner, and has two children who still depend on her.

Esperanza is a capable and persevering woman. She sells clothes in a place in good condition, in front of her District Market. She says its going very well; she has customers who know her and are familiar with her business. The fortitude and perseverance that characterize her help her grow as an independent woman and she is very proud of what she has achieved.

With this loan she will buy more merchandise to resupply stock, such as pants, shorts, blouses in all sizes and models, polo shirts, and dresses for adults and children.

She feels like an established and hard working woman and appreciates the opportunity that the Manuela Ramos Movement has offered her to thus develop as a woman and a small business operator.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MERCHANDISE TO RESUPPLY HER CLOTHING STOCK

loans.name: Maren Akinyi

texts.en:
Maren Akinyi is a 40-year-old lady. She is married to Austine and they have two children. She is in the business of selling second hand clothes in Migori, a populous town about 300 miles from the capital city Nairobi. Her clients mainly comprise the low income group, and she has been in this business for six years. She gets her stock from Nairobi and sells at a profit. 

Maren learnt about KADET through a friend who is an existing client. This will be her second loan and she intends to use the money to purchase more stock. She also hopes to diversify into selling school uniform, which is usually in season after the December festive season to ensure that she has a steady income from her business.

She aspires to start a boutique in a permanent structure, since currently she sells from a semi-permanent structure.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Increasing stock of clothes

loans.name: Ariana Group

texts.en:
This is Ariana group, made up of seven female members. Farzana is the group leader. All the group members hope that they will be successful and will be able to expand their businesses.

Farzana wants to take a loan for her husband who has a cart he uses for selling secondhand clothes. She has a share  in the business with him - she organizes the clothes and irons them, then her husband sells them in his cart.

Salma and Shakera also share a business with their husbands. They clean and package fresh fruit at home then their husbands sell the fruit in their carts.

Khorshed would like to take a loan for her brother’s gas-selling shop. He would like to buy the essential materials for his shop and expand his business.

Malaly wants to take a loan for her husband’s metal shop.

Taheba would like to take a loan for her husband’s dish-selling shop.

Shakila wants to take a loan for her husband’s gas-selling shop.

Together, they requested a group loan of 70,000 Afghani. They admire this effective loan process.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand clothes for her husband to sell

loans.name: Elise

texts.fr: Elise G. est une femme âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle habite à Assahoun, une ville située à 70 kilomètres de Kpalimé. C’est une revendeuse de tissus. Avec ce crédit, elle voudrait diversifier les tissus pour attirer la clientèle. Avec les bénéfices obtenus, elle aimerait ouvrir un compte et épargner de l’argent.
texts.en:
Elise G. est une femme âgée de 38 ans, marié et mère de 2 enfants. Elle habite à Assahoun, une ville située à 70 kilomètres de Kpalimé. C’est une revendeuse de tissus. Avec ce crédit, elle voudrait diversifier les tissus pour attirer la clientèle. Avec les bénéfices obtenus, elle aimerait ouvrir un compte et épargner de l’argent.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: achat de tissus

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: La señora María Cristina Chávez se dedica a la elaboración de pasteles para todo tipo de evento social, su esposo el señor Juan Gabriel De la Cruz trabaja en un centro comercial de panadero anteriormente han tenido créditos con nosotros los cuales fueron  excelentes clientes el primero lo utilizaron para la compra de materiales para el negocio, el segundo crédito lo utilizaron   para la ampliación de su casa mismos créditos que ella a pagado muy bien y sobre todo de lo que sale de su negocio, en esta ocasión pide nuevamente crédito para el inicio de otro cuarto ya que comenta que con nuestra ayuda ha estado haciendo crecer su vivienda.
texts.en:
María Cristina Chávez bakes cakes for all types of social events. Her husband, Juan Gabriel de la Cruz, works as a baker at a shopping center. They have had loans with us in the past and were always excellent clients. The first loan was used to buy materials for the cake baking business; the second, to enlarge their house. Both loans were repaid on time from profits gained from her business. This time, she again requests a loan to add a room to her house since she states that with our help she has been able to enlarge her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: La Superacion 6 Group

texts.en: Colasa, 37, and the other borrowers from L. Supernacion live in difficult conditions in Samana, Dominican Republic. Colasa lives in a house with a dirt floor and wood panels for walls. In the middle of hurricane season, this is far from sufficient. Her community lacks potable water and is often without electricity. Despite these difficulties, Colasa runs a successful empanada stand from her home. Empanadas (dough stuffed with cheeses and meats and then fried) are a favorite food in the Dominican Republic. Colasa is the coordinator for the group L. Supernacion ("Overcoming") and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group. This is Colasa’s very first loan with Esperanza International, and she is very excited about the possibilities. In her home, and therefore her business, she hopes to have enough profits to put in a cement floor. This will add to her family’s security and safety. Colasa also hopes to send all of her children to school through university. Finally, she is excited about Esperanza’s financial services, which will allow her to save responsibly for the future. Thank you for lending to Colasa and L. Supernacion group!

loans.use: To buy chicken and flour

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is living in Nahaleen Village near Bethlehem. She has six children all of whom are in school. Her husband works as a daily worker in construction.

Six years ago Mariam decided to start selling candy out of her house for the children. After six years of hard work and using the income she was able to open a shop in the village where she sells canned and frozen food, candy, ice cream, rice and toilet paper.

Mariam’s shop became a very important source of income for her family, She approached FATEN for a loan of 3,000 USD to buy new goods, candy and children’s games. She needs the loan since Eid Al-Adha (a Muslem feast) is next week so she wants to buy these goods to meet the expected high demand.

Mariam appears in the photo at her shop.

loans.use: To buy new goods, candy and children’s games for her shop

loans.name: Idowu

texts.en:
Idowu is 35 years old, and married with two children. Her husband sells electronics and also supports the home.
Idowu sells sarongs of various colors and sizes at retail prices to her customers in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a long time. She loves her work because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. Idowu is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Gonzalo Angel

texts.en:
Gonzalo Angel O. C. is 47 years old and lives in a cane home in the Isla Trinitaria zone of Guayaquil. Mr. O. has sold merchandise on the streets of Guayaquil for over 10 years. From 8 am to 7 pm, Mr. O. sells kites, books, and temporal holiday merchandise. 

Beginning in August of every calendar year, Mr. O. creates “años viejos”.  Años viejos are effigies made of paper mache representing local and international politicians, famous celebrities, or even cartoon characters. At midnight on New Year`s Eve in Ecuador, the años viejos are burned in order to get rid of all the bad spirits from the previous year.

Mr. O. and his wife have 4 children ages 21, 20, 18 and 16; only the 16 and 18 year olds still live at home and attend public high school.  

Mr. O. is requesting a loan to buy Christmas hats ($300 worth), books, kites and paint for the años viejos ($200 worth). In the future, he hopes to fix the roof, walls and flooring of his home.

loans.use: To buy Christmas hats, books, kites and paint to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is the 36-year-old mother of three children and she is married to O. who sells timber.

Rose sells local gin at retail prices to her customers and also sells soft drinks. She says her expectation is to see her business expand. She is requesting a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more local gin to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Rose is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more local gin to sell

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy S. is from the village of Canitoan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 44 years old. Christy is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Christy owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Christy has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Christy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Christy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Christy is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Christy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Canito-an, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Mrs. Hong L., 56, is a hard working woman who resides in Phnom Penh city. To pursue a daily income, Hong L. owns a small business selling dried fish in the public local market. She is a widow and mother blessed with three children. All three of them are married and working at different jobs. She has a daughter who earns a living selling groceries in her store located inside her home. The fish season is approaching and the price she pays to buy her fish is presently low. Hong L. would like to take this occasion to earn extra profit, and so she requests a loan to order fresh fish in bulk and then process them into dried fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish in bulk.

loans.name: Germaine

texts.fr: C. Germaine est née le 19 Juin 1965 au quartier Dogoudo à Allada, dans le département de l’Atlantique, où elle vit depuis sa naissance. Mariée à OLORITOGBE Dieu-Donné, Germaine est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Germaine vit seule avec un enfant à sa charge. Germaine a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au secondaire. Mais depuis une dizaine d’année, pour assurer ses besoins, Germaine vend des glacières, des bassines, des seaux à son domicile mais aussi par le système de distribution. C’est à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, que Germaine se ravitaille. Germaine a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Germaine sollicite un autre crédit, en vue de rehausser son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
C. Germaine was born on June 19, 1965 in the Dogoudo district in Allada, in Atlantique County, where she has lived since birth. Married to OLORITOGBE Dieu-Donné, she is the mother of three children, who have all had schooling. She lives alone with one child in her care. Germaine has had secondary schooling. For about ten years, to meet her needs, she has been selling insulated containers, tubs, and buckets out of her home and by the distribution system, too. She resupplies herself in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has already benefited from two ALIDé loans, which she repaid. She's requesting another loan for boosting her business and satisfying her customers further.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying 2 dozen coolers, and 2 dozen tubs

loans.name: Plan For Real Ii Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the 'Plan For Real II' group from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, where 'Shine on Sierra Leone' has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking a loan of SLL 1,800,000 from Kiva lenders.

Daniel K. pictured in the middle is the leader of this group. The 33-year-old was born in Binkolo village in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman and they have two children. One of his children is attending primary school and the other is in secondary school. For two years now, Daniel has been selling ice cream; before that, he was a school teacher. With his share of the loan (SLL 800,000), Daniel will buy ice cream and also invest in a new business. He will buy cartons of fish.

loans.use: Buys cartons of fish to start a new business

loans.name: Rem

texts.en:
Rem P., age 28, is married and resides with her children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has three children. She is engaged in a business of producing and selling traditional Cambodian cakes and desserts, earning an income of $2.50 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

The family is also assisted by her husband, who is a construction worker in the town, earning an income of $5 per day. Their standard of living has been improved since P. and her husband have had these businesses. 

P. is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase a plot of farmland to produce more rice products for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: Buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.ru:
Человек порой находит себя довольно слабым существом, и ему и в голову не придёт попробовать пойти на смелые шаги по изменению своего будущего и кардинальному изменению своей жизни. Однако он, не смотря ни на что, продолжает поиски и в конце концов в результате стечения определённых обстоятельств и предпосылок, такая возможность появляется и именно в этот момент очень важно, чтобы человек не испугался, а смело сделал этот шаг, шаг к лучшему будущему. Лидер группы, Аида Ибрагимова, решила сделать этот шаг. Она имела уже работу и могла бы спокойно продолжать своё скромное существование. Однако в 2007 – году она устроилась на работу  в компанию, продающую косметику посредством сетевого маркетинга. Аиде тридцать лет. У неё одна дочь, которой семь лет. Дочь Аиды ходит в школу и учится в первом классе. Аида, чтобы прокормить себя и дочь, занимается торговлей косметики, а также работает помощником санитарного врача в. Её зарплата составляет две тысячи двести сомов ($50). Косметикой она занимается уже третий год и её ежемесячный доход вырос до двух с половиной тысяч сомов ($ 60). Стоит отметить, что в компании по продаже косметики, Аида занимается сравнительно новым путём торговли, а именно сетевым маркетингом.  Специфика этого вида торговли включает в себя также вложения со стороны клиента, и постоянный поиск клиентов, чтобы увеличить свой доход. И сейчас Аида нуждается в кредите, в размере шести тысяч сомов ($130), чтобы купить косметику для реализации.

Жанылбубу Токторбаевой сорок шесть лет. Жанылбубу – мать двоих сыновей. Оба ходят в школу. Старший сын в этом году заканчивает школу. Жанылбубу дома шьёт национальные изделия, а также берёт заказы у постоянных клиентов. Жанылбубу просит выделить ей кредит для покупки ткани для пошива. 

Кулай Абдылдаевой сорок шесть лет. Муж Кулай  работает сварщиком. Кулай и её муж вырастили двоих детей. Чтобы помочь мужу содержать семью, Кулай хочет устроиться на работу в завод по производству спирта. Кулай нуждается в кредите, чтобы оплатить контракт за обучение снохи в размере 20000 сомов.

Гульнур Курманбаевой двадцать пять лет. У Гульнур двое детей. Оба её детей ходят в садик. Муж Гульнуры занимается откормом и перепродажей скота. Два года назад он купил корову и удачно продав, начал закупать крупно – рогатый скот специально для откорма и перепродажи. Гульнур обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить две коровы. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Sometimes a person may feel like a fairly weak being, and it will not even enter his mind to take brave steps in order to change the future and significantly change his life. However, despite all the obstacles, he continues searching and finally finds that opportunity as a result of certain circumstances and conditions. It is especially important that at this moment, a person would not get scared, but would take this brave step, the step toward a better future. The leader of the group, Aida I., decided to take this step. She already had a job and could have calmly continued her modest existence. However, in 2007, she found a job at a company that sold cosmetics through network marketing. Aida is thirty years old. She has a seven-year-old daughter, who currently attends school and goes to first grade. In order to support herself and her daughter, Aida is involved in cosmetics sales and also works as an assistant to a sanitary physician. Her salary is two thousand two hundred som ($50). She has been involved in cosmetics sales for the third year already, and her monthly income increased to two and a half thousand som ($60). It should be noted that at the cosmetics sales company, Aida is involved in a fairly new way of sales, network marketing. The specifics of this type of sales include input from the client and a constant search for customers in order to increase income. And now Aida needs a loan in order to purchase cosmetics for sale. Janylbubu T. is forty-six years old. She is a mother of two sons, both of whom attend school. The oldest son will be graduating from school this year. Janylbubu sews national dresses at home and also gets orders from her permanent customers. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of fabric for sewing. Kulay A. is forty-six years old. Her husband works as a welder. Kulay and her husband raised two children. In order to help her husband support the family, Kulay wants to find a job at the alcohol manufacturing plant. She needs a loan in order to pay her daughter-in-law’s education contract. Gulnur K. is twenty-five years old. She has two children, both of whom go to a kindergarten. Gulnur’s husband is involved in livestock fattening and sales. Two years ago, he bought a cow, successfully sold it and then started buying cattle specifically for fattening and resale. Gulnur requested the loan in order to buy two cows.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics

loans.name: Mkaratusi Group

texts.en:
Josephina Fende, age 48, is married and has four children, ages 28, 24, 22 and 10 years.  She has had a shop for selling children clothes at Kariakoo for four years now.  From the business she has been able to earn a monthly profit of around $306.

This will be Josephina’s 5th motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used previous loans to increase her capital and she has paid back the loans successfully.  She hopes to obtain a loan to still increase on the stock of clothes.
	
Josephina will share this loan with her subgroup loan  of  Mkaratusi group which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.  

In the picture, Josephina is second from the left.

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothes to sell

loans.name: Bibiniso

texts.ru: Урокова Бибинисо проживает в районе Восе. Возраст, 43 года. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Образование - высшее, "Педагог". Работает по профессии. Кроме того занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Она в основном берет заказы у себя дома. В этой области более 14 лет. Кредит берет для покупки швейной машинки.
texts.en:
Bibiniso U. lives in the Vose district. She is 43 years old, married and has 3 children. She is a teacher and has a higher education. She works in her profession. Besides this, she is involved in sewing national dresses. Bibiniso primarily accepts orders at her home. She has been in this field for over 14 years. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of a sewing machine.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Kihumulo Twimukye Women's Group, Mubende

texts.en:
B. Lauben is a 32-year-old happily-married father of four children who has run a salon business for five years in Ikula, Mubende. With all his efforts, he has been able to maintain it earning him 100,000 Ugandan shillings a week. This income has always been significant in contributing towards his family’s welfare.

Lauben’s current setback is lacking additional capital for purchasing salon materials like shampoo, hair oils and a drier, basically demanded lady customers. He works on both ladies' and men's hairstyles and he is grateful that he learnt the trade first and now he is a pro and customers like it.

This loan will help Lauben in buying a new drier for his salon. Lauben appears at the top left corner  in the small photo just like in the big group photo.

loans.use: To purchase a new drier for his salon

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran is the wife of M. J., who sells fruits on the four-wheeled cart in different areas of the community. They live in Multan, city of sweetmeats in Pakistan with their children. 

Sughran runs a boutique in her home to financially support her husband. 

She has applied for a loan for the expansion of her husband’s business. He will buy more seasonal fruits to resell. She hopes that investment in her husband’s business will help him earn a better income; she wants to use a part of that profit to enhance her boutique business as well, which will help them in improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits for resale

loans.name: Felipe Hernaldo

texts.es:
Don Felipe es padre de familia de dos hijos, es un hombre trabajador, emprendedor de su propio negocio.
Una vulcanización con muchos años de experiencia pues ha hecho su medio de ingreso. Los trabajos hay semanas que están bajos y que apenas logra sacar el diario para la alimentación de su familia, a como hay días buenos.
Los planes que tiene es lograr comprar un engrasador, y comprar aceite de vehiculo para lograr vender y a si poder ayudarse y equilibrarse ya que la situación económica es critica.
A través de estos financiamientos a futuro espera hacer el local del negocio de concreto ya que es de madera y zinc, para tener mejor seguridad de sus piezas de trabajo.
texts.en:
Felipe has two children. He is a hard-working and enterprising man with his own business. A tire repair business with many years of experience has been his form of income. There are weeks when there is little work, and he is barely able to feed his family everyday. There are also good days. The plan that he has is to buy a grease gun and automotive oil to sell. That way he will be able to help himself. He will also be able to stabilize his current critical economic situation. He hopes that by using these loans in the future he will make his business location from concrete. It is now made of wood and zinc, and he wants to have greater security for the items that he works on.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a grease gun and automotive oil to increase sales and stabilize his economic situation

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Heang T., 59, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. T. sells porridge and a type of traditional cake for a gross income of USD 20 per day. T. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family's use.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth vive en casa de su hermano en  la ciudad de La Paz, esta soltera trabaja como transcriptora en un periódico de circulación nacional, es cliente de Impro con 5 créditos; esta es la  primera vez que solicita financiamiento a través  de Kiva, el crédito que solicita es para continuar sus estudios de contabilidad y de esta manera ascender en su trabajo y poder mejorar sus ingresos.

Por el carácter social puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Señora Elizabeth lives with her brother in the city of La Paz. She is single and works as a transcriptionist for a nationally circulated newspaper. As a client of Impro she has had 5 loans. This is her first time requesting a loan from Kiva. She will use the loan to continue her studies in accounting so that she can get a promotion and improve her income. Due to her social character, she qualifies for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay registration fees and to buy school supplies to continue her studies in accounting

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy B. is from the village of La Paz in the municipality of Aurora in Zamboanga del Sur Province. She is 50 years old. Lucy is married and has three grown children. To make a living, Lucy owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products like "sasing" and "bulinaw" in the local community. Lucy has been engaged in her business for over 8 years, and she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lucy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucy is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lucy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Saing Pheap Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has fifteen people, who are all villagers in Pou Roung village in Takeo province. Each member will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Saing P. was selected by the other members as their village bank president. 

Mrs. Saing P. was born in 1979. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Tet Chen, is a laborer. Although they tR. to work a lot, they earn veR. little money to support their family. 

So to improve this condition, Mrs. Saing P. is applying for a loan to buy two piglets and pig food to raise them in order to start a new business. She is the mother of two children, both of whom are students.

loans.use: To buy two piglets and pig food to raise them.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina tiene 55 años, vive al lado de sus 3 hijas en su casa propia. Desde muy joven, aprendió a hacer lindos decorados en material de corrospum (material micro poroso, tipo plástico de diferentes colores) para centros educativos y fiestas infantiles. Siendo profesora de profesión le ha dado la ventaja necesaria para tener lo clientes, ya que sus colegas siempre solicitan estos trabajos, resultándole una buena fuente de ingresos. Le entretiene mucho realizar esta actividad manual, por que le permite diseñar personajes animados, sin embargo le fue difícil mantenerse en este negocio, pero al fin lo logró. Actualmente tiene varios pedidos de diferentes centros educativos, en cada época del año, lo cual esta procurando cumplir con toda la demanda de sus clientes. Para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un pequeño bazar donde pueda ofrecer diferentes productos y también los diseños que realiza en corrospun. Es su quinto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales como corrospum, pegamento y también telas ya que realizará más material educativo en base a telas.
texts.en:
Delfina is 55 years old and she lives together with her three daugthers in their own home. From a very young age she learned to make beautiful decorations of foam (a plastic material that is spongy and comes in various colors) for schools and for kids' parties. Having worked as a teacher she has had the advantage of knowing the clients. Her colleagues always make requests for her work, resulting in a good source of income. She takes a great deal of time to make these crafts, designing different animated characters. While it has been very difficult to keep up this business but in the end it all worked out. She has a number of orders that remain unfilled from various school. She is trying to meet her clients' demands. In the future she has a small store from where to display her various products and different designs. This will be her fifth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is very ahppy to have the financial support. She has always shown responsibility with her payments. She also enjoys taking part in the community bank with all the other members because they, too, are responsible members. She is grateful to all those individuals that will lend her money because it will be key in the progress of her business. The loan she requests will be invested in the purchase of materials, such as foam, glue, and fabrics to make her educational displays.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials such as glue, foam, and fabrics.

loans.name: God Divine Gift Group

texts.en:
Moses H., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God Divine Gift.  He is 44 years old and married with three children who are between the ages of 3 and 12 years. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial constraints. He cares for one sibling.

For three years, he has been operating a pharmacy on Peace Island outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy another consignment of drugs. 

He describes himself as a devoted man whose goal is to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy another consignment of drugs

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en: Josephat, age 35, wants a loan to purchase beans, maize and groundnuts for reselling. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He owns a semi-permanent house in which he lives with his wife and seven children. He earns income from buying and selling beans, maize and groundnuts, which he dreams of making a permanent business.

loans.use: To purchase beans, maize and groundnuts for reselling.

loans.name: Noussirath

texts.fr: Z. Noussirath est née en 1986 et vit depuis dix (10) ans environs à Midombo, un quartier de Cotonou, la capitale économique du Bénin.  Noussirath est mariée à HOUNHOUI Louis, un électricien auto. Noussirath est analphabète et mère d’un enfant qui est scolarisé. Le couple vit ensemble avec leur enfant et supporte mutuellement les différentes charges familiales. Noussirath mène de façon ambulante comme activité principale la vente de pâtes dentifrices. En dehors de cette activité, Noussirath vend aussi des produits cosmétiques. C’est pour faire face à l’évolution de son activité et augmenter le stock de ses produits (pâtes dentifrices et brosses à dents) que Noussirath sollicite pour la troisième fois auprès de ALIDé un crédit. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés. Les ambitions personnelles de Noussirath sont d’avoir sa propre boutique et de prospérer dans son commerce ; mais Noussirath enregistre rarement quelques problèmes au cours de l’exercice de son activité.
texts.en:
Noussirath Z. was born in 1986 and for the last 10 years she has been living in Midombo, a neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Noussirath is married to Louis Hounhoui, an automobile electrician. She is illiterate and the mother of a child attending school. The couple lives together with their child and shares in supporting the various family expenses.

Noussirath goes from place to place selling toothpastes. In addition to this activity, she also sells cosmetic products. To deal with the growth of her business and to increase her stock of goods (toothpastes and toothbrushes) Noussirath is requesting a loan for the third time from ALIDé. The previous loans have been fully reimbursed. 

Her personal ambition is to have her own shop and for her business to thrive. She rarely encounters any problems while running her business.

loans.use: Purchase of personal care products (toothpaste, toothbrush)

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité lleva por nombre Kuña Guapa de Curupayty debido a que todas conocidas y por medio de este emprendimiento fortalecerían el lazo entre ellas, actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo, integrada por 10  emprendedoras señoras, quienes ponen lo mejor de si para aumentar sus ingresos y por ende brindarle lo mejor a sus respectivas familias. 
Una de las integrantes y presidenta del grupo es la señora Sabina J. quien se dedica a la cria de gallinas ponedoras para vender huevos.
Actualmente cuenta con gran cantidad de gallina y abastece a varios negocios de la zona con sus productos.
Solilicita el préstamo para la compra de balanceado especiales para gallinas ponedoras.
texts.en:
This committee is called  Kuña Guapa de Curupayty since all the members of the committee are acquaintances and through this undertaking they will strengthen the bond between themselves.  They are currently in their first loan cycle.  There are 10 female entrepreneurs in this committee who all put the best of themselves into increasing their income and thereby providing the best for their respective families.

One of the members, and the president of the group, is Mrs Sabina J. who raises laying hens to sell eggs.

Currently she has a large number of hens and she supplies several businesses in the area with her products.

She is requesting this loan to buy special balanced animal feed for laying hens.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed

loans.name: Paul Kinuthia

texts.en:
Paul has operated a transport business in Naivasha for the last six years.  He is 33 years old, married to Jacinta Wairimu and they have three children.

Paul was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his third loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to buy a new reflector jacket and a helmet with the loan amount. Paul also hopes to buy his own lorry in the future which he will use to transport goods to and from the market.

loans.use: to buy a new reflector jacket and a helmet

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with six children all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and electricity bills.

She has operated a natural  juice sales business for the past year, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanasha faces a major challenge of seasonality of fruits for making natural juices. She hopes to open a retail shop in the future.

With the loan in the amount of Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase fruit for making natural juices and flavourings. She decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation in the community.

loans.use: To purchase fruit and flavourings to make natural juices

loans.name: Arelis Dayana

texts.es:
Arelis Dayana M. L.  tiene 18 años de edad, Es soltera vive con la mamá y con los hermanos en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia Bolívar. No tiene hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNION SAN ANTONIO, Recinto San Antonio parroquia San José del Tambo distancia de la oficina a 150 minutos de la comunidad se encuentra dentro de los límites del Cantón Chillanes. Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, cacao, naranja yuca. Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Arelis Dayana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Compra sus productos en el Comercial  Matilde Esther y vende los  productos en Bucay.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, cacao, naranja yuca. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder contar con un negocio propio.

Le gusta disfrutar  de las fiestas patronales.
texts.en:
Arelis Dayana M. L. is 18 years old.  She is single and lives with her mom and siblings in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  She doesn't have any children.

The members of the UNION SAN ANTONIO community bank are located in San Antonio precinct, in San José del Tambo parish, 150 minutes from our office, in Chillanes canton.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  They have been in this business for a long time.

Arelis Dayana is a farmer.  She grows corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  She buys her products in the Matilde Ester shopping area and sells her products in Bucay.

Arelis Dayana is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for growing corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to own her own business.  She enjoys taking part in fiestas.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana D. is from the village of Poblacion 4 Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Rosana is married and has four school-aged children. 

To make a living, Rosana owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fish in the local community. Rosana has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosana is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Rosana from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda P. owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 46 years old, married and has three grown-up children. She is from the village of Nagassican, Santiago. Imelda has been in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her fourth loan from ASKI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vilma Beatriz

texts.es:
Vilma es socia del  Banco Comunal “Tupac Amaru”, ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 25 años de edad.  Ella es con conviviente y tiene un hijo.  Gracias a su empeño pudo estudiar la  primaria completa. 
Viene trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años, el primer préstamo de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles lo utilizó para incrementar la mercadería de su negocio, lo cual era y es la venta de habas seca, producto que es comprado en Bolivia para vender en la feria de Yunguyo, también se dedica a la venta de combustible, esto gracias al apoyo de su esposo.
Con éste préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, comprará ocho galones de gasolina para vende al por menor.
Su sueño es tener un carro y una tienda de abarrotes. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es  la puntualidad y el compartir con las socias.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the Communal Bank “Túpac Amaru” which is located in the District and Province of Yunguyo, Department of Puno. She is 25 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one child. Thanks to her efforts, she was able to finish her elementary school education.

Vilma has worked with Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 PEN. The money was used to increase the inventory of her business selling dry goods. She buys her products in Bolivia and sells them at the fair in Yunguyo. Vilma also sells gasoline with the help of her husband.

With this loan of 500 PEN, Vilma will buy eight gallons of gasoline to sell at retail. Her dreams include having a car and opening a grocery store. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the punctuality and being able to share with the other members.

loans.use: Purchase eight gallons of gasoline to sell at retail

loans.name: Korn

texts.en:
Korn S., 53, resides with his family in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. S. and his wife are farmers and grow vegetables, earning an income of $7 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $56 on food and $28 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase cows to raise for sale. In the future, he would like to use the additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy cows to raise for sale

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia C. is from the village of Labo in Ozamiz City. She is 48 years old. Cecilia is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business of planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Cecilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is currently in the business of selling alcohol. She is 33 years old and married with seven children, six of them go to school. 

Lilian borrowed a loan to stock more alcohol to sell. She hopes to pay her children's school expenses with the extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more alcohol to sell

loans.name: Djariatou

texts.fr: Madame Djariatou a 34ans. Elle à de 03enfants et est mariée à un commerçant. Il ya de cela 21ans qu’elle exerce cette activité (vente de tissus coupons). Elle s’approvisionne au Grand marché de Lomé et revend au même lieu. Ce premier prêt qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter plus de marchandises pour réaliser d’énormes profits  afin d’assurer un meilleur avenir à ses enfants, et aider son mari.
texts.en:
Mrs. Djariatou is 34 years old. She has three children, and is married to a merchant.  She started to sell fabric remnants 21 years ago. She buys her stock at the grand market of Lomé, where she also conducts her sales. 

This first loan will allow her it to buy more merchandise and make huge profits to provide a better future for her children and help her husband.

loans.use: to buy fabric remnants

loans.name: Boldbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Boldbaatar D. is 43 years old. He lives with his wife and 3 children in Kherlen city of Dornod aimag, the far eastern province of Mongolia. This is situated 750 kilometers away from the capital city. 

Boldbaatar's family owns a plot of land and a small family house. Boldbaatar's wife runs a metalware business, selling utensils and tools made from metal, in the market. Boldbaatar himself owns a motorcycle and runs a delivery business. His three children go to the local secondary school. The loan that Mr.Boldbaatar is requesting will be used to buy different metal products for his wife's business. They will purchase metal sheets, utensils and tools to sell. A small portion of the loan will be used to service Boldbaatar's motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy different metal products, for his wife's business, such as metal sheets, utensils and tools to sell. A  small amount of the funds will be used to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Ramaz

texts.en:
Ramaz T. comes from the village of Zeda Sazano, Imereti region. He is 46 years old and living with his wife, Shorena; his mother; two daughters (20 and 14 years old) and a 12-year-old son. His younger daughter and son go to school. The elder daughter helps her parents with agricultural activities. 

Ramaz’s family has two milk cows and ten sheep. Cheese from the cows and sheep is sold locally. Also, they sell lambs seasonally. In addition, Ramaz runs a mixed store in the village, where groceries and various household items are sold. 

With the requested loan, Ramaz will increase stock in trade for the store. It will increase the turnover in the store and positively impact the income of the family. In the near future, Ramaz and Shorena’s elder daughter will marry. Ramaz is saving to cover his daughter’s wedding costs. An increase in his profit will allow him to make more savings for the wedding.

loans.use: to increase stock in trade for a mixed store.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith tiene 28 años, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en un su propia casa junto a su pareja Adolfo de 33 años y sus 02 queridos hijos Andover de 11 años y Adely de 02 años de edad, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los productos que con tanto voluntad y entrega han logrado cultivar le han ayudado mucho en el progreso de su vida. Todas las mañanas empieza a trabajar en sus tierras, pues sabe que del cuidado que le brinde a sus sembríos de cacao, café y plantas de barbasco, dependerá la calidad de los productos que obtenga.  Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y se siente muy feliz cuando los ve grandes y frondosos. Lleva 06 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, lugar donde recibe mejores precios por sus granos y raíces de barbasco. En adelante, espera sembrar más plantas de cacao y barbasco ya que cuenta con espacios sin cultivar. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria y responsable. Con el crédito solicitado contratará jornaleros para que le brinden el apoyo en el mantenimiento respectivo de sus plantas como la poda de sus plantas y sacar la mala hierba que crecen en sus campos.
texts.en:
Edith is 28 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her partner, 33 year-old Adolfo, and her two beloved children (11 year-old Andover and 2 year-old Adely) who are the motivation behind all her efforts.

The crops that Edith has managed to grow with so much will and devotion have helped her a lot in making progress in life.  Every morning, she starts working on her land since she knows that the care that she provides for her cacao, coffee and barbasco plants will affect the quality of the end crops that she obtains.  What Edith most enjoys about her work is caring for her plants and she feels very happy when she sees them grow big and lush.  She has been in this business for six years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her produce to the city of San Francisco which is where she receives the best prices for her beans and barbasco root.  In the future, she hopes to sow more cacao and barbasco plants since she has land that is currently not cultivated.

This is Edith's fifth loan from MFP.  She knows that she must make all her repayments on time and she is ready to do so.  Edith is a very supportive and responsible member of her community bank.  She will use the loan she has requested to hire day laborers to support her in looking after her plants, for example by pruning her plants and getting rid of the weeds that grow in her fields.

loans.use: to hire day laborers

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina tiene 32 años de edad, ella tiene 2 hijos y vive en el distrito de zaña a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo ella cuenta con casa propia la misma que solo cuenta con los servicios básicos.  En sus comunidad se dedican mayormente al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Agustina se dedica a la  comercialización de animales, entre ellos tenemos principalmente ganado porcino, los cuales están ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive, esta actividad la realiza desde su domicilio.  Agustina se dedica a esta labor desde hace varios años, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.

Agustina está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000  nuevos soles para que pueda invertir en la compra de cerdos con su respectivo alimento balanceado, además de esta manera atenderá la demanda insatisfecha en el lugar,  ampliará su numero de clientes, contando con clientes nuevos e ingresos adicionales a la familia.

Agustina es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que la conocen le consideran una persona  amable y siempre dispuesta a ayudar a los demás.
texts.en:
Agustina is 32 years old.  She has two children and lives in Zaña District 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.  She has a house of her own that only has basic utilities.  In her community most are in commerce, farming and livestock raising.

Agustina is an animal merchant, principally pigs, which she raises in her back yard.  When they reach a good level of development she sells them to merchants that always frequent the area where she lives.  She works from home.  Agustina has been in this line of work for several years which is to say she knows it to perfection.

Agustina is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy pigs and pig feed.  In addition, she will be able to fill unmet need in the area, increase her customer base by attracting new ones and have additional family income.

Agustina is quite a hard working woman who strives daily to get ahead and have a better quality of life.  People who know her consider her a kind person who is always willing to help others.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 14 children. Mila has had a shop that sells sweet potatoes, bananas, and cassavas by the kilogram. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy bananas, cassavas, and sweet potatoes. Mila has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Mila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas, cassavas, and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Glenda Yadira

texts.es:
Glenda Yadira tiene 32 años, es separada vive con sus hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos Andover de 17 años y Wendy de 8 años.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALLE ALTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Voluntad de Dios en el Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra maíz y arroz.


Glenda  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y soya,  Compra y vende sus productos en el Comercial Peña.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría a superarse económicamente y  mejorar su producción. Su sueño es comprar una cuadra de terreno y construir su propia casa. El desafio que enfrenta es la langosta patera 

Le gusta ver la televisión.
texts.en:
Glenda Yadira is 32 years old. She is separated and lives with her children in the canton of Ventanas, in Los Ríos province. She has 2 children: Andover, age 17, and Wendy, age 8.

The Valle Alto communal bank is located in the Voluntad de Dios neighborhood of the canton of Ventanas. The members of this communal bank work in short-cycle agriculture, planting corn and rice. 

Glenda works in agriculture, planting corn, rice and soy. She buys supplies and sells her products at the Peña commercial center.

She is requesting this loan to plant corn and rice; she will buy supplies and fertilizers for her crops. The loan will help her get ahead economically and improve her production.
