Her dream is to buy a plot of land and build her own house. The main challenge she faces is "langosta patera" [plant disease].  

She enjoys watching television.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Sart

texts.en: Sart, 36 years old, is a grocery seller. Her husband is a motor taxi driver.  Their income is $14 per day. She has 3 children, all of whom are studying. Every month, she has to spend $45 on food, $10 on electricity, $20 on school fees, $20 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like a loan of $1200 to buy more grocery goods to sell. She plans to extend her grocery store so that she can provide goods to other stores and customers. From the profits she earns, she wants to repair her house and send her children to study in the university.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha is 27 years old and her husband, Chenda, is 34 years old (pictured together). They live in a village along National Road Number One about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2007 and have one young daughter. 

Chantha sells rice and food. Her husband installs cell phone applications and Mp3 and Mp4 players and also sells cell phones. 

Chantha is asking for her first loan of $1,200 to purchase a computer for her husband’s business installing cell phone applications and Mp3 and Mp4 player and also buy cell phones for sale.

loans.use: To purchase a computer for her husband’s business installing cell phone applications and Mp3 and Mp4 players and also buy cell phones for sale.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 33 years old and married with three children. He has been a mechanic for four years. He also operates a retail shop for more income generation.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access financial resources which have helped him to grow his business.
Paul hopes to expand his business and open up his own garage in the future. He has requested 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy a welding machine, grinder, drill and buffing machine.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine, grinder, drill and buffing machine.

loans.name: Soeu

texts.en:
Soeu is 39 years old, married and living in Ornlong Veng District, Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. 

Currently, he is a farmer. He has done farming for many years with his wife. He grows rice crops in the land his grandparents own. From this business, he earns about $3 each day. 

He and his wife have given birth to two children. They are school-age. 

Due to the rainy season and the lack of capital, he is requesting a loan in order to grow his farming business. He will use this loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other materials for supporting his farming business. He hopes that this loan will create more income for his family so he can enlarge his house and send his children to study at a high level.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other materials.

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es: La señora Ingrid es costurera y se dedica a confeccionar mochilas para toda edad las mismas las comercializa en una de las ferias de la  de la ciudad de La Paz;  su esposo trabaja en el interior del país. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una maquina de coser industrial, para acelerar el proceso de confección de las mochilas y poder vender más, pues con esta actividad cubre los gastos de su familia. Vive en casa de sus suegros la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Villa Cooperativa  en la Ciudad de El Alto. Ingrid es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2010 y esta es la primera vez que su crédito es canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Ingrid is a seamstress who makes satchels for all ages.  She sells her products at a market in the city of La Paz.  Her husband works in the interior of Bolivia.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy an industrial sewing machine in order to speed up the sewing process in making satchels so that she can sell more.  This business enables her to cover the family expenses.  Ingrid lives at the home of her in-laws in the District of Villa Cooperativa in the city of El Alto.  

Ingrid has been a client of IMPRO since 2010 and this is the first time her loan has been referred to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial sewing machine for making satchels.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Gloria has a retail shop that sells clothing & beauty products from AVON & NATASHA. She has had been in business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy clothing & beauty products to sell.

Gloria is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Gloria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing & beauty products for sell

loans.name: Mary Gold

texts.en:
Mary Gold is 37 years old and has five children. Mary Gold is married and has three children who are in school.

Mary Gold is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Mary Gold requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers for her business.

Mary Gold has been farming vegetables for 18 years now and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Mary Gold would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farming business

loans.name: Mor Talla

texts.fr: Monsieur Mor habite dans l’un des localités du Sénégal. Il est marié et s’active dans le commerce et la vente de téléphones portables. Il a une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans son activité  qu’il a choisie sous l’influence de son grand  frère. Le  but de son option est de subvenir a ses besoins personnels ainsi qu’a ceux de sa femme. Il est sociétaire d’un des  guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis juillet 2010. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de portables a revendre. Son objectif est de renforcer son activité pour maximaliser ses bénéfices, ce qui lui permettra d’améliorer le niveau de vie de sa petite famille.
texts.en: Mor lives in a town in Senegal.  He is married and his business is buying and selling cell phones.  He has 5 years experience in his business which his older brother encouraged him to start.  His goal is to provide for his own personal needs as well as those of his wife.  He has been a member of one of U-IMCEC's offices since 2010.  He is requesting this loan for 500,000 francs to buy cell phones to re-sell.  His goal is to strengthen his business in order to maximize his profits.  This will allow him to improve his small family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cell phones to re-sell

loans.name: Heyam

texts.en: Heyam is a 23-year-old young woman, and she is married and has one son. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Heyam wants to purchase a new refrigerator for her house, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Heyam gets the loan, she will purchase the new refrigerator, and she will improve her house and provide her family with better living conditions. Heyam is a conservative woman, so her husband Shaker is photographed instead.

loans.use: to purchase a new refrigerator for home

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is married with three children. She is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Julieta is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for rice. 

Julieta has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Julieta hopes to see her children finish college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for rice.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila, de 46 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora. Es viuda, pero vive en compañía de sus dos hijos de 22 y 17 años, habitando en una casa que es alquilada. Luzmila, se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir, contando con un taller. Asimismo se dedica a la confección de lencería, que instaló en la casa alquilada que habita, oficio que aprendió en un centro de educación ocupacional, para luego comenzar con su negocio comprando primero una pequeña maquina de coser. Desde entonces confecciona a sus vecinos y amigas, así logro hacerse conocida y ganarse más clientes, logrando crecer y comprar más maquinas que facilitan su trabajo y mejoran los acabados. Tiene 15 años realizando esta actividad, contando con la ayuda de su sobrina a la que paga por semana trabajada. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder hacer lo que gusta, que es la confección de nuevos diseños. Para ella es importante ofrecer un buen servicio, así logrará mantener a la clientela y ganar más dinero. Su plan es ampliar su espacio de su taller, y abrir una boutique en ese mismo lugar. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado, para así poder avanzar con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para la confección de ropas como:  telas, hilos, botones y otros, además de una nueva maquina de coser que estaría a un costo de 600 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Luzmila, 46, is a hardworking, enterprising woman.  She’s a widow but lives with her two children who are 22 and 17 years old in a rented house.  Luzmila makes clothes; she has a sewing workshop.  She also makes lingerie.  She set up her shop in the house she rents.  She learned this occupation at an occupational training center and then started her business after first buying a small sewing machine.  Since then she’s been making clothes for neighbors and friends becoming well known and acquiring more customers managing to grow and to buy more sewing machines that make her work easier and improve the quality of her work.  She has been in this line of work for 15 years; her niece helps her and she pays her a weekly wage.  What she likes about her work is being able to do what she enjoys which is sewing new designs.  For her, it’s important to offer a good service to keep her clientele and earn more money.  Her plan is to expand the space in her shop and to open a boutique in the same location.

This will be MFP loan #4.  She feels grateful for the loan granted to be able to advance with her business.  She will use the required amount to buy sewing supplies like fabric, thread, buttons and others.  She will also buy a new sewing machine that costs about 600 new soles.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, fabric, thread and buttons.

loans.name: Uchumi C Group

texts.en:
Receive Greetings from Uchumi C Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 
Alex is the facilitator of the Uchumi C Group. He takes care of nine children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, he had a very good maize yield harvesting twelve bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, he was only able to harvest four bags of maize on half an acre of land. 
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alex and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance. 
With income from maize sales, Alex will educate his children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Uchumi C Group will each plant between half and one acre of maize. 
Alex is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen has been in active farming for over 30 years with her farm currently producing maize, beans, and  milk for the local market.She also runs a cereal retail business in the local market

Hellen has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy  poultry birds. She says she will buy poultry and venture into the poultry farming business.This is Hellen's third loan request with Juhudi Kilimo. She adds that the poultry business will improve her farming income and enable her to expand the retail cereal business to wholesale status.

Hellen is a single mother of three: two adults and a minor who is still schooling.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Gema María

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar vive la señora Gema, tiene 21 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una niña de 2 años de edad. El marido se dedica a la pesca.
 
Ella es una muy buena esposa y ama de casa que también se dedica a la venta zapatos, zapatillas y productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días de la semana y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa a clientes que llegan a adquirir alguna prenda o producto, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, lleva 2 años con su negocio y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes y ropa de damas.

Este crédito es para comprar zapatos, ropa y productos Yanbal. Este es el cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal  y le gusta por los beneficios que les da el banco.

Su sueño es tener un local para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Honduras 2000 meets twice a month in the canton of Jaramijo (Manta). This place is known for its beautiful beaches that line the coast of this beautiful place. Here most of the people are very hard workers involved in maritime pursuits.

In this place lives Gema, who is 21 years old and lives in a consensual union (or common law) and she has a 2 year old daughter. Her husband is a fisherman.

She is a very good wife and housewife who also works selling shoes, slippers and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories). She works 3 days of the week, selling door to door and also sells from her home to customers that come to buy an outfit or products. She leaves her products on credit and then collects payment every 8 days. She has been in this business for 2 years and things are going very well. Her best sellers are perfumes and women’s clothing.

This loan is to buy shoes, clothing and Yanbal products. This is her 4th loan cycle with the communal bank and she likes it because of the benefits that the bank offers.

Her dream is to have a facility where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothing, and Yanbal products

loans.name: Togtokhsuren

texts.en:
Mr. Togtokhsuren, 38, is a taxi driver and runs an ice cream bulk in the supermarket. He lives with his family in Kherlen, a boundary town in Mongolia. He has been running his taxi business since last spring and the other business was started in 2006 and his wife responds to it. 

Every month, Togtokhsuren and his wife purchase their groceries, such as ice cream, from Russian and Mongolian food suppliers in Ulaanbaatar. But this time they want to purchase a large amount of ice cream for expanding their sales volume. It is beneficial to their business development in the future. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to purchase the ice cream for increasing the working capital.

loans.use: to purchase ice cream

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.es:
Jimmy es un joven de 27 años de edad, vive en la cálida ciudad de Pucallpa, la cual se caracteriza por sus paisajes hermosos y también porque sus pobladores son personas muy amables y hospitalarias. Jimmy es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, tal es así que el actualmente se encuentra estudiando la carrera de administración en la universidad de su ciudad, y para poder solventar los gastos de sus estudios trabaja como empleado en una empresa, el labora alrededor de 9 horas y por las noches acude a su centro de estudios; Jimmy cree que esta saliendo adelante porque tiene muchas ganas de mejorar y sobre todo por su responsabilidad.

Jimmy está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar las refacciones del techo de su vivienda ya que comprar los materiales necesarios como calaminas, clavos, maderas, pinturas, entre otros, ya que en la ciudad de Pucallpa hay muchas lluvias y debido a ello se inundan las casas; con esta mejora el podrá brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar su carrera y tener su propia empresa”.
texts.en:
Jimmy is 27 years old. He lives in the warm city of Pucallpa, which is characterized by its beautiful landscapes and its friendly and hospitable people. 

Jimmy is a young man with a great desire to succeed. He is studying administration at the university in his city, and in order to pay his tuition fees he also works as an employee for a company. He works for about 9 hours every day before going to school at night. Jimmy believes that he is successful because he has the drive to improve, and above all because he is responsible.

Jimmy is very grateful for the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help, he will be able to make repairs to the roof of his home by buying necessary materials such as corrugated metal sheets, nails, wood, and paint, among others. There are many rainstorms in the city of Pucallpa, which make the houses flood. 

He will now be able to provide a better quality of life for his family. He will continue fighting to make his greatest dream come true: to finish his degree and own his own business.

loans.use: to buy materials such as corrugated metal sheets, nails, and wood, among others.

loans.name: Ekpangbo Group

texts.fr: EKPANGBO est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Germaine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Germaine âgée de 54 ans a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Germaine est ne vit plus avec son mari. Germaine a un enfant qui n'est pas encore scolarisé et à sa charge. Germaine vit seule et assure toute seule ses différents besoins.Pour cette raison, Germaine vend de la bouillie accompagné de gâteau depuis vingt un ans. Germaine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Germaine sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe EKPANGBO, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit précédent a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter du blé, de l'huile végétale et du maïs.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo owns a repair workshop with his brother. At their shop they fix all types of domestic electronics such as: microwaves, irons, ovens etc. He has been working in this type of activity for over 18 years and has had this business open with his brother for about 2. Their shop is located near a very busy market that allows them to bring in a stable amount of clients.

Pablo needs this loan in order to purchase scrap metal and other materials necessary for his work. He also wants to purchase new tools and materials that can help him in his business.

Pablo is 51 years old and has 5 children who are all grown up. He is separated from his wife and lives alone in his house. Currently he wants to make improvements to his home and help support his kids in ventures of their own.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Pablo needs this loan in order to purchase scrap metal and other materials necessary for his work.

loans.name: Magdalene Anwi

texts.en:
Magdalene is married and mother of two children. The pain of prematurely dropping out of school as a result of her father’s death, the frustration of not having adequate capital to carry out business, and the privilege of receiving loans from GHAPE are her motivations and opportunities to change her family's economic status. She succeeded in repaying previous loans and providing her community, especially the students from the Government High School Mbengwi, with food.

Given a loan of $400, she plans to buy flour, oil, sugar, yeast, 4 piglets, animal feed, and wood to reinforce a fence. Her business will succeed because she is working in collaboration with her husband who has great experience in piggery, and the student population is a ready market for her puff-puff business. She plans to repay her loan in 18 months. The first installment shall be due in the fourth month from the date of disbursement of loan.

loans.use: Selling of puff-puffs, pigs, and farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Tarasilla would like to pay school fees for her daughter

loans.name: Gulandom

texts.en:
Gulandom S. is 36 years old, and she has a secondary-level education. She is married and has 5 children. After her school graduation, Gulandom got married. She was a housewife and looked after her children. As Gulandom did not have any skills, she did not take an interest in any job. But time and a hard life caused her to find a source of income.

Four years ago, she started her business. As she lives in a big village, she sells footwear, which has a great demand among the poor population. In the summertime flip-flops are very popular among men and women. These goods are very cheap, so Gulandom has a high turnover. With the loan amount of $575, she is going to buy a new range of goods: quality footwear for children and teenagers for a low price. As the school fair is coming, many parents need to go far away to buy school clothing. This loan gives them an opportunity to obtain what they need in the nearest market and save time and transportation expenditures. Gulandom is going to pay off the loan amount over 8 months.

loans.use: To buy and sell summer footwear (flip-flops)

loans.name: Juma

texts.en: Juma is a 41 year old father of four, living in Buguruni area in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. Juma has been running a used clothes sales business for the past five years. He and his wife run their shop, located in Buguruni area and their business booms during festival seasons. He has also received training in organized business and entrepreneurship skills from Youth Self Employment. He is in need of $350 to help him boost his business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Mirian

texts.en:
Mrs. Myriam C., 49, owns her home, where she lives with her husband of 20 years and her three daughters. All her daughters are currently in school. Two are adults and the youngest is 16. Myriam runs a small luncheonette out of her house, selling drinks and food to persons in her neighborhood. By running her business in this way, she is able to sell her food and drinks and take care of chores around the house at the same time. Her husband also helps her with sales and household work.

Myriam’s lunch counter is doing well and earns her enough money to cover the daily expenses of running the business and her home.

Myriam has worked with Fundacion Paraguaya before, achieving a degree of success through micro-loans. She is a dedicated worker who continues to strive to improve her daily standard of living.

She has asked for a loan to buy drinks of all kinds for her store. She hopes to purchase sodas, juice and beer as well as materials to improve her business. With these items, she hopes to be able to serve a greater number of clients.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of drinks for her store

loans.name: Subgroup D Of Group Tegemeo

texts.en:
Dorothy S., age 37, is married with 4 children (ages 14, 12, 5, and 2). About a year ago, she started her own tailoring business. Before this, she was taking tailoring classes and was selling sodas and sarongs. Her husband works as a clerk for a local organization.

Her tailoring business, where she sews and continues selling sarongs, is open from around 9am to 5pm daily. She charges about $4.80 for each piece she sews and currently makes a profit of around $18-27 per month from both her tailoring work and from selling sarongs. She uses her profits to increase her stock of sarongs and to pay the shop rent of about $14 per month.

Dorothy is the leader of Subgroup D of group “Tegemeo” (Swahili for “expectation”), which totals 21 members. She will be sharing this loan with her subgroup members: Jamila A. (selling clothes), Rudia H. (tailoring), Visa J. (selling clothes), Rose K. (selling firewood), Habiba R. (café owner), and Sara R. (selling clothes). She knows her subgroup well as they are neighbors and have shared 2 previous loans which they paid back successfully.

Dorothy used the 2 previous loans to buy a sewing and embroidery machinery, which initially got her business up and running. When her subgroup receives the new loan, she hopes to use it to increase her stock of sarongs during this Christmas season.

In the picture, Dorothy is in the back row, second from the right.

loans.use: To buy sarongs

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en: Sarah is 36 years old and married with four children. She has a poultry farm and also runs a small retail shop business. She would like to build another poultry house and bring more chicks with the extra profits.

loans.use: Add investments in the poultry business

loans.name: Sijari's Motomoto Group

texts.en:
Sijari A., age 25, is married with 1 child (4 years old). Sijari owns a sarong and fabric business, which she started 2 years ago. Working from 10am-6pm daily, she earns about $34 a month from this business.

Sijari now hopes for a loan to buy more sarongs and other fabrics. Sijari belongs to the loan group called Motomoto and will be sharing this loan with subgroup members Fatuma O. and Hadija A.. These women have businesses dealing in sarong, fabrics, and cosmetics sales.

loans.use: To buy more sarongs and fabrics to sell

loans.name: Kiyinki B1 West A Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Mwajuma M..  She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add more stock.  Mwajuma is 45 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant farmer for work.  She has 10 children ranging from age 11 to 28 and her children go to school.  Each week, Mwajuma makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children and re-invest in her business.  Mwajuma has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.  Mwajuma is joined in her small group by Aisha N., Florence N., Beatrice N., and Sarah N..  Aisha N. has a business trading produce and wants to add more capital.  Florence N. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to purchase a fridge.  Beatrice N. operates a business selling matooke and wants to purchase more matooke from the surrounding villages.  Sarah N. is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to add more furniture.

loans.use: To boost retail shop business

loans.name: Omowumi

texts.en: "LAPO has helped me a great deal because through them I have been able to buy more provisions for my shop", says Mrs. Omowumi P. who lives in ijaniki ,Lagos State, Nigeria. Omowumi is 43 years of age and  has 4 children. She is eager to lift her family above the poverty level  contribute greatly to the upkeep of her family. She needs the loan of $875 to enable her buy more provisions for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Silia

texts.es:
The cattle business requires much hard work because one must treat the animals with care. Furthermore, one must transport them long distances, exposing the livestock farmer to physical strain and weariness caused by the sun and the activity. Despite this fact, Mrs. Silia M. works in this business in the municipality of El Sauce in the city of León with the aim of improving her family’s living conditions. She is a single mother who must support her children who so greatly need her.

She currently needs to purchase a pregnant cow, which is why she wisely turns to Ceprodel in order to obtain a loan that will help with the purchase. She would like to raise the cow and sell its milk in her locality in the municipality of El Sauce.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de la ganadería requiere de mucho esfuerzo por el hecho de que se debe de tratar muy cuidadosamente a los animales y además se necesita trasladarlos desde largas distancias exponiéndose la persona ganadera al desgaste físico y al cansancio proporcionado por el sol y la actividad. A pesar de esta situación, en el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León, la señora Silia M. se dedica a este negocio con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia ya que es madre soltera y con la necesidad de mantener a sus hijos que tanto necesitan de ella.

Actualmente la necesidad que esta dama atraviesa es la ausencia del recurso económico para la compra de una vaca en preñez es por este motivo que muy sabiamente ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito con el cual pueda comprarla con el propósito de desarrollarla y extraer sus derivados como la leche para su respectiva comercialización en su localidad de habitación en el municipio de El sauce.

loans.use: Purchase of pregnant cow

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Mrs. Bose B. makes a living selling books and various types of stationery and supplies. She has been in this business since 1998, and studied her trade for several years before opening a shop. Bose is 34 years old and married with two children. She has been a client at LAPO Microfinance for the past three years. Bose lives in the town of Issashi in Lagos State, Nigeria. She needs a loan of $850 to buy more items to sell from her shop.

loans.use: To buy more books, stationery and other items

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es:
Fifteen years ago, Oscar obtained a few manzanas (a unit of measurement for land equal to 1.68 acres) of land on which he decided to plant products such as pineapples, chayote squash, and beans. Since that time he has worked in agriculture, into which he has put his best efforts so that he can produce quality products. Continuing with this activity has cost him a lot, given that the problems that present themselves—both the land and climate—are innumerable and he must always be attentive to his crops.

Now is the time of year when his crops need fertilizer to continue their growth. The purpose of this loan is to buy fertilizers to use on his products. Oscar is married, and he and his wife have 2 small children, to whom they would give all that they have.

Oscar’s wife has a small grocery store in their house. Oscar helps her in the store when he is not in the fields. They both hope to always have work so that they can educate their children and give them a dignified roof under which to live.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 15 años Oscar obtuvo algunas manzanas de tierra en las que decicidió sembrar algunos productos como piñas, chayotes y frijoles, y desde ese entonces se ha dedicado a la agricultura a la cual le ha puesto su mejor esfuerzos para producir productos de calidad. Mantener esta actividad le ha costado mucho ya que los problemas que presentan tanto la tierra como el clima son inumerables y siempre tiene que estar atento al cuido de la misma. Este es el tiempo en que sus planatciones necesitan de abono para constinuar su crecimiento, y el fin del préstamo es ese mismo,adquirir abonos agrícolas para rociarlos a sus prosuctos. Oscar es casado y junto a su esposa tiene 2 pequeños hijos por los caules ellos darían todo lo que tiene. La esposa de Oscar es comerciante y posee una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación, Oscar también la apoya en la atención del negocio cuando éste no está en el campo. Desean ambos poder tener siempe trabajo para así poder darles educación a sus hijos y un techo digno donde vivir.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to use on his crops

loans.name: Lázaro

texts.es:
Lázaro started his own business because any other job paid very little and he needed a higher income to take care of his family´s expenses and the needs of his children, who at that time were little and were studying. What he was paid in any company was not enough, so for this reason he started his own business. Taking advantage of his knowledge of metalworking, he started off more than 20 years ago making screens, doors and windows for acquaintances. Little by little his clientele grew until he was able to devote full time to metalworking; now he has more work and even an apprentice.

He needs a loan for US $1,200, which he will repay in 6 months, to buy another soldering machine so he can deliver his orders more quickly. With your help, he will continue to grow his business.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Lázaro inicio el negocio porque pagaban muy poco en cualquier otro empleo y el necesitaba un ingreso mas alto para solventar los gastos familiares así como las necesidades de sus hijos que en ese entonces eran muy pequeños y estaban estudiando y con lo que le pagaban en alguna empresa no completaba por ese motivo emprendió poco a poco su negocio aprovechando sus conocimientos sobre herrería comenzó hace mas de 20 años realizando mosquiteros, puertas, ventanas a conocidos y poco a poco fue aumentado su clientela hasta que definitivamente se dedico de lleno a la herrería ahora ya tiene mas trabajo e incluso cuenta con un ayudante.

El necesita un préstamo por US $1200 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar otra maquina de soldar para que sea mas rápido la entrega de pedidos. Con tu ayuda el seguirá haciendo crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Buy machinery for soldering.

loans.name: Ushiobo

texts.en: Ushiobo M. is married with nine children. He is fifty-five years old and he lives in Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. He sells both men's and women's shoes. He has been in this business a long time. He needs the loan amount of US$ 1200 to buy more footwear for re-sale. He expresses his gratitude to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for re-sale

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es empleada domestica y por las tardes asiste a un club de madres donde elaboran toda prenda de lana. Es madre de dos hijos (uno ya es bachiller y el otro esta en secundaria) y esta casada (su esposo se encuentra trabajando en Arika Chile). 
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito será destinado para realizar tramites de su certificado de nacimiento de su hijo ya que no puede estudiar por falta de documentos.
Este crédito será de gran ayuda ya queso hijo tendrá la oportunidad de poder estudiar y superarse para tener perspectivas laborales mejorando su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como un cliente confiable.
texts.en:
Cristina works as a domestic employee and in the afternoons she attends a mother’s club where they make all kinds of clothing items out of wool. She is the mother of two children (one in college and the other in high school) and she is married (her husband is working in Arika, Chile). Their home is located in the Pasankeri zone of La Paz city. The loan will be used to process her child’s birth certificates as he cannot study because of his lack of documents. This loan will be a great help because the oldest son will have the opportunity to study and be successful in order to have better work prospects to improve his quality of life. This is the second loan from Impro, her loan history qualifies her as a trustworthy client.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to process documentation

loans.name: Ni Kadek Ariani

texts.id:
Usaha warung Ni Kadek Ariani sudah cukup menjanjikan untuk dapat menopang ekonomi dalam keluarganya selain dari pendapatan suaminya.
Untuk periode kedua dana pinjaman dari Yayasan Dinari dipakai untuk menambah modal usahanya. Seperti biasa Ni Kadek Ariani membuka warung sejak pukul 06.00 pagi dan tutup pada pukul 07.00 sore. Waktu untuk menunggui warungnya kadang dipergunakan untuk menyelesaikan pekerjaan dirumahnya seperti memasak, mencuci dan merawat anaknya yang masih kecil. Walaupun seharian Ni Kadek Ariani menunggui warung namun tidak pernah melupakan segala keperluan suaminya sebelum berangkat bekerja sebagi tukang maupun setelah pulang bekerja. Keuntungan bersih dalam sehari dapat mencapai Rp. 30.000,- s/d Rp.40.000,- cukup  dapat membantu pendapatan suaminya dan keperluan anaknya yang masih balita.Usaha warung ini ditekuninya dengan harapan  kedepannya  warung dapat lebih meningkat dan lebih besar lagi.
texts.en:
Ni Kadek Ariani opens a small stall that sells daily necessities such as snack, cooking ingredients, rice, coffee, etc.

For this 2nd loan period, she wants to use the loan money from Dinari foundation to add her working capital. She opens her small stalls at 6 am until 7 pm. During the day she usually also does house chores such as cooking, does laundry and taking care of her children.

She can earn IDR 30 thousand to IDR 40 thousand/ day (around USD 3-4/ day). This business provides money to ease her family's economic burden.

She is hoping to be able to expand her business.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah modal usaha)

loans.name: Hon

texts.en:
Hon H. is 38 years old, married and lives with her three children in the city of Batambong, in Siem Reap province of Cambodia. She operates a grocery store, earning an income of about US$5 a day. Her  husband is ill and must stay at home. Food prices have soared in the past year as inflation has gotten out of control in Cambodia. Unfavorable climate conditions have also played a factor in making the price of rice very high. 
Hon H. is requesting a loan of US$400 to purchase additional groceries to meet her customer's demand. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living. (Photo is of Hon H.'s husband as she was not available)

loans.use: Purchase additional supplies of groceries

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Mrs. Kim Hou T. lives in Kos Roka Krauv village in Kampong Cham province. She is a pig breeder. Since her pigs are getting bigger and bigger, she does not have enough money to support them. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy pig feed for her pig-breeding business. Her husband, Mr. Sok Socheath, is a driver. Mrs. Kim Hou T. is a 26-year-old and the mother of three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: to buy pig feed for her pig-breeding business

loans.name: Leonidad Del Carmen

texts.es: El Sr.  Leonidas es un hombre luchador que desde muy joven ha trabajado, en diferentes instituciones, lo cual ha podido ahorrar, su ultimo trabajo fue en la alcaldía donde laboro ocho años. Con sus ahorros logro comprar un camión, para trasladar granos básicos a los departamentos y de los ahorro del camión  a comprado dos taxis, a si como diez manzana de tierra las cual desea trabajarla con cultivos, tiene 47 años de edad, con dos hijos de 13 y 15 años, los niños están estudiando, y su esposa es ama de casa, y lo apoya en todos sus negocios, en este negocio don Leonidas tiene ocho años de experiencia, esta es la novena solicitud de préstamo que hace en Afodenic, que ha sido de gran beneficios en su negocio para sobresalir adelante, con esta solicitud desea reparar el camión ya que tiene una pieza mala y es su fuente primera en los ingresos. Sus planes a futuro es cambiar la unidad de taxis para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. a si como un mejor patrimonio a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Leonidas is a fighting man who has worked from a very young age in different institutions. With what he was able to save, his last job was in a mayor’s office, where he worked for 8 years. With his savings he was able to buy a car in order to transport grains to the Departments and with the savings from the car he bough two taxis, and from there ten, apples of land which he wants to work with farmers. He is 47 years old, with two children of 13 and 15 years of age. The children are studying, and his wife takes care of the house and helps him in all his business. In this business Leonidas has 8 years of experience and this is the ninth loan that he has done with AFODENIC, which has been of great benefit to his business to jumpstart it forward. With this loan, he wants to repair the car that has a bad piece and his is primary source of income. His plans for the future is to change the price of the taxis to bring better service to his clients, and so a better patrimony for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair Leonidad's car

loans.name: Leangheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Leangheng P. is 37 years old, and her husband, Mr. Da Dorn, is 34 years old. They live in a small village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They married in 1994, and they have two children (one son and one daughter), both of whom are in school.

Leangheng has been selling grocery items for six years. She buys her groceries from the markets in Phnom Penh and subsequently resells them in her village. Her husband, meanwhile, has been a mechanic for over ten years. He works in Phnom Penh during the day and back home at night.

Leangheng hopes to be able to pay for her children’s future educational endeavors. As such, she is requesting her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to build a kitchen and bathroom for the benefit of her family and to expand her business by purchasing more groceries for resale.

loans.use: To improve her family's home by building a kitchen and bathroom and to expand her business by purchasing additional groceries

loans.name: Masooma Taj Din Group

texts.en:
Masooma baji is 35 years old, a married lady and a citizen of a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 3 years. Masooma baji married a man whose name is T. D.; he is retired and now he runs an electrical shop where he sells electrical supplies (wires and switchboards). Masooma baji is the mother of three kids: one son and two daughters. All of her kids are getting an education.

Masooma baji is involved in a sewing business. She does this work to pay the school fees for her kids and to help her husband with his financial burden. She successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institute for Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more electrical supplies for her husband’s electrical shop.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Munazza baji and Khalida baji each want a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business. Azra Parveen baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy electrical supplies to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To raise goats

loans.name: Makhammad

texts.en: Makhammad N. is a 54-year-old trader who lives and works in the small village of Imishli. He is married and has two children. He has been selling different kinds of food, such as candies, coolies (a shaved ice treat), macaroni, and sugar, since 2002. He is not alone in his business. His wife and children also help him while he works as a driver using his car and taking local people to the downtown. He is the only breadwinner and his store is the family's only source of income. Makhammad has applied for $2000 USD to increase his stock.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Maria Rocio

texts.es:
Maria es es socia del Banco Comunal Solución.
Maria es casada, tiene 33 años y 1 hija, Maria tiene un puesto en el mercado de la Magdalena en donde vende jugos de frutas, además Maria junto a su esposo tienen carros y brindan servicio de transporte y también llevan papa, tuna dependiendo de la demanda. 
Maria necesita un préstamo de 2550 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago de una cisterna.
Maria sueña con comprar otra casa, tener mas carros y que su hija sea profesional.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Solution Communal Bank. She is married, 33 years old, and has one daughter. María has a stall at the Magdalena Market where she sells fruit juices. María, alongside her husband, also sells cars and they have a transportation service and sometimes transport potatoes or cactus pears depending on the demand. María needs a loan of 2,550 soles, money which will be used as part of the payment for a cistern. She dreams of buying another house, having more cars, and that her daughter will one day be a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cistern

loans.name: Alamoka

texts.en:
Alamoka S. from Mbeya is 50 years old. She is married and has 5 children, all between the ages of 13 and 30. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one other dependent, because the child is an orphan. 
Alamoka has been running her own shop since 2006, purchasing and re-selling a variety of commodities. She works 9-12 hours per day, and can earn about US$ 90 a month from her business. She is now requesting a loan in order to purchase commodities in bulk for re-sale. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Alamoka thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Purchase of commodities in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Cristina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad D. Queñuani, distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Chuchito, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 48 años D. edad y es madre D. 04 hijos, D. estado civil casada, y tiene estudios D. primaria incompleta (2do D. primaria).  Vive en el Barrio Central D. Queñuani.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. la fundación del Banco Comunal, con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles logró implementar su negocio D. compra y venta D. aji.  

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 2,500.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su actual negocio, comprará aji al por mayor y luego lo venderá en Desaguadero.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando para obtener más ganancias.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones  D. su  Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Cristina belongs to the "Virgen del Rosario" Community Bank, in Queñuani Community, Yunguyo district, Chuchito province, Puno department. She is 48 years old, married and the mother of 4 children. She attended elementary school but did not finish (2nd graD.). She lives in the central neighborhood of Queñuani. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement since the Community Bank was started. With an initial loan of 300 PEN she was able to start her business buying and selling aji chiles. She now needs to borrow 2500 PEN to invest in her current business. She will buy the aji at wholesale and then resell it in Desaguadero. She wants to continue working in order to earn more. She enjoys the savings and the meetings of her Community Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of aji chiles

loans.name: Larry

texts.en:
Larry manages two hectares (5 acres) of corn and rice field. He is requesting a PHP 28,000 loan from Kiva lenders to purchase agricultural inputs needed on his farm. He will also utilize some of the amount to pay for farm laborers who will help him during the planting season.

Larry is 41 years old and has five children: Rosemarie - 17 years old, a graduate in high school and who now works as a saleslady in Manila; the same with Ronalyn - 16 years old; Rico Yan - 14 years old is a high school sophomore; Ronel - 9 years old, in grade school; and Ruben - 1 year old.

With the assistance of his wife, Wilma May, Larry keeps struggling for the welfare of his family. They are living at Barangay San Vicente of Angadanan, Isabela, a rural and distant place.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Nucha Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Nucha Maiya M. lives in Thecho. Thecho is located in Lalitpur district and most of the people in this region are engaged in agriculture.

Mrs. M. lives with her two sons. A few years ago her husband, Tulshi lal, died, so she has sole responsibility for her family.  Both her sons have left their education due to lack of money. Now her older son drives a bus and her younger son is engaged in wood carving work. 

Mrs. M. and her younger son are engaged in wood carving work. They get carving work from the dealers. Now Mrs. M. is requesting an Rs 10000.00 loan to buy wood for her work.

loans.use: To buy wood for her work

loans.name: Haidarkul

texts.ru: Хайдаркул Чуракулов проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 59 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Хайдаркул имеет вулканизацию, где предоставляет услуги по отремонтированию машин. Этим видом услуги занимается более 5 лет. Кредит просит для покупки оборудывания, чтобы предоставлять услуги "балансировки".
texts.en:
Haidarkul C. lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 59 years old, married and has 6 children. He owns a tire retreading shop, where he provides auto repair service. He has been involved in this business for over 5 years. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of equipment in order to provide balancing services.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of balancing equipment

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal Ccatarisun que significa Levantémonos en quechua.
Hilda es casada, tiene 26 años y 3 hijos, Hilda vende repuestos de moto en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días junto a su esposo.
Hilda necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuestos.
Los sueños de Hilda son ampliar su negocio y tener otras sucursales.
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the Community Bank Ccatarisun which means “Stand up” in quechua. She is 26 years old, married and has three children. Hilda and her husband sell motorcycle spare parts. They rent a retail space.

Hilda needs a loan of $350 (1000 soles) to purchase spare parts. Her dream is to expand her business and open other stores.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Jumedi East Anna Odarowa Group

texts.en:
Anna O. is representing her group. She is forty-three years old and is married with eight children who are schooling. She also looks after two dependents, one of whom is mentally disturbed.

Anna has been a tailor for over nineteen years. She is requesting the loan to purchase material for sewing clothes for sale and, more so, she wants to continue buying and selling fish as a side business.

Anna is hardworking and so encouraging. Her dream is to educate her children and to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase material for sewing clothes and also more fish to sell

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en:
Otgonbayar S. lives in Uvurkhangai province in central Mongolia. She currently operates a religious objects sales business from a counter at the local market in her town. She started her business in 2000 by renting a counter and has since worked very hard to grow and improve the business.

Otgonbayar has found success in her business and was recently able to purchase her own counter with her savings. Otgonbayar is always working hard to grow her business, however, providing for her family has always been her her primary concern. She uses all of her earnings to improve their quality of life.

For the future, Otgonbayar's dream is to establish a large trading center in her province. However, she knows in order to fulfill this dream she must first grow her business, increase her cash flow, and purchase new supplies. Otgonbayar is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1400 USD) loan to purchase more supplies for her religious objects business.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies for her religious objects business.

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en:
Akenese Ulualo M. is a 46 years-year-old woman living in the town of Vailele.  She is married and has 6 children adult -aged children.  To make a living, Akenese owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling soft drinks in the local community.  Akenese has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately $520 WST a month from these activities.

In 2007, Akenese joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Akenese has successfully repaid a previous loan of $1250 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  Akenese is now requesting a new loan of $2000 WST which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business.  The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Akenese plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a transport vehicle to improve business

loans.name: Norlan Antonio

texts.es: El joven Norlan L. de 23 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de lácteos desde hace dos años ambulantes, su medio de transporte es una bisecleta que se traslada de barrio a barrio para surtir los productos a sus clientes, como la captación de los mismos, desde horas temprana sale a vender queso, cuajada, crema, leche agria, aunque cansado por el peso y el sol pero tiene que obtener ingreso para dar de alimentar a su familia. Reside en Villa Reconciliación, su esposa ama de casa, le tiene una niña de un año. Su objetivo es mejorar las condiciones de vivienda para dar seguridad y una vivienda digna a su familia. Con este préstamo compara mas productos lácteos como: queso, cuajada, crema, para vender y aumentar las ventas lo cual le generara mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
The young Norlan L. is 23 years old, and has been engaged in the business of selling dairy products on the street for 2 years. His method of transportation is a bicycle which he uses to move from neighborhood to neighborhood to attract customers and supply products to them. He leaves early in the morning to sell cheese, cuajada (a typical Nicaraguan white cheese), cream, and fermented milk. Although he gets tired from the weight of the products and from the sun, he needs to earn the money to feed his family. He lives in Villa Reconciliación; his wife is a housewife and they have a one-year old child. His goal is to improve the condition of their home to provide his family with security and a decent home. With this loan he will buy more dairy products to sell such as cheese, cuajada, and cream, so that he can increase his sales and generate better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy dairy products such as cheese, cream, cuajada cheese and fermented milk

loans.name: Rodolfo Antonio

texts.es: Rodolfo Antonio tiene 27 años, a esta edad es un joven que ha sabido ganarse la vida por lo que su actividad económica es la compra y venta de ropa. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio, ya que cuando el inicio recibió el apoyo de su Mama para que pudiera recorrer distancias mucho más extensas, logro comprar un triciclo y entonces podría tener mucha más facilidad de transportar sus productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de pantalones, faldas, camisetas, ropa interior que es la más solicitada por mujeres. Su deseo es tener su propio lugar de trabajo.
texts.en:
Rodolfo Antonio is 27 years old. This young man has managed to make a living from buying and selling clothes. He has been in this business for more than 8 years. Rodolfo started out with the help of his mother. He later bought a tricycle so that he could easily transport his merchandise and travel greater distances.

The loan he is requesting will be used as operating capital to buy pants, skirts, shirts, and underwear that are most requested by women. He hopes to have his own location where he can sell his products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more inventory

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy has a bar in Nakulabye selling all types of beer. Her major business challenge is thieves. She doesn’t incur any transport costs as she buys her goods near her home. She works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. Teddy works seven days a week. She serves an average of 30 customers a day and sells to all kinds of people. She has been in this business for seven years and with MCDT for five years (now on her tenth loan).

Teddy is a 29-year-old married woman with two children, ages 3 months and 7 years. One of her children goes to school. She rents a two-room house where she lives with three people. Teddy doesn’t take care of any additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water and gets three meals a day. She has monthly residence and business expenses.

Teddy joined MCDT because it is near her home and is easy to work with it. She wants to use her loan to buy more crates of beer. She hopes to see her business grow. She wants to start going directly to factories and also hopes to own a permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 21-year-old single woman living with her family, of whom 4 are employed. She has been working as hairdresser for five years to earn income to help satisfy the needs of the family, in collaboration with her brother. Today, Fatmeh is requesting to borrow US$ 1,000 to buy more merchandise so she can increase her sales and therefore her income.

loans.use: buy more merchandise

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida O. is married and has three children. She has received a senior high education. Vida owns a beauty salon and also sells provisions such as Milo, milk, sugar biscuits at Teterem near Elmina, which she has been doing since 2000. Her husband is an electronics dealer. Vida uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Vida will use the loan to buy more hair products to be used at the beauty salon and provisions for sale at her gocery store. With the new profits from her expanded business, Vida plans to use it to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more hair products for her beauty salon and provisions for sale at her gocery store.

loans.name: Aliyu Badaru Nola Group

texts.en:
B. Nola is the representative of this group. She is forty years old and married with seven children of whom four are going to school. More so, she is looking after four siblings who are schooling too.

Nola owns a grocery shop which she has been operating for over four years. Due to her small amount of capital, she is using the loan to improve her business by buying more grocery items such as cassava flour, groundnuts (peanuts), beans, etc., to sell.

Nola is an active businesswoman whose dreams are to educate her children and to obtain a motorcycle for income generation.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Chanthol's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Chanthol N. is 31 years old. She is a village bank president. Her group consists of 14 people, located in Chamrov village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Nget Hien, are farmers who own piece of land on which they cultivate rice. Aside from farming, Mrs. Chanthol N. weaves silk  to earn a living. She wants to expand her silk weaving business so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk. Mrs. Chanthol N. and her husband have a child who is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more silk to weave.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita M. is a widow who supports her family by selling fish. She lives in Brgy. Tabugon, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental with her three children who are now young adults. One is working and the rest help her in her business.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since June 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fish vending business, she is gradually making her family's living conditions more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of $220.

Angelita is now borrowing 29,500 PHP for her fish vending business. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 29,500 PHP that was paid off within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Angelita aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and to ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Florence Zalwango‘S Group

texts.en:
Florence is 45 years old and married with seven children aged between 10 and 15 years. All her children go to school. The family resides in and owns a two-room house where she stays with eight people. She takes care of additional family members.  The family has access to electricity but no piped water at home. The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include paying utility bills, school fees for her children, medication and feeding the family. Florence owns a hardware shop in Nakulabye selling cement, nails, iron sheets and paint. Florence buys her paint from factories and cement from depots within Kampala city, and so incurs transport costs to and from shopping. She receives an average of 40 customers a day. She has done this business for over 12 years. Her main challenges are defaulters, the rainy season because she works from a muddy open area, and the increasing prices of merchandise.  She sells on a retail basis only. She has been with MCDT for over six years, servicing her 25th loan, working all along with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of cement, tins of paint and iron sheets. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and start selling at wholesale only.
.

loans.use: To buy cement, nails, iron sheets and paint

loans.name: Tabatasu Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the 'Tabatasu' group from Makeni. Katrine K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She sells palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice, beans, firewood, etc. She has been a businesswoman for 10 years now. She and her colleagues are seeking from Kiva enders a loan of SLL 2,100,000 in order to invest in their businesses. Katrine will use her share of SLL 700,000 to buy palm oil, rice, beans, firewood, etc. in large quantity to add to her current stock.  

Katrine K. was born in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. The 29-year-old is married with 3 children. Her husband is a driver and two of her children are attending primary school; the youngest is not of school-going age.

loans.use: Buy palm oil, rice, beans, firewood, etc., in large quantity

loans.name: Kamu Kamu A Bagutatira Rehema Group

texts.en:
B. Rehema is the representative for this group loan. She is a hardworking, 45-year-old businesswoman who is single and blessed with six children, four of whom attend school. She also looks after four grown-up dependants.
Rehema has owned a restaurant for over seven years. She is using her loan to purchase foodstuffs for the restaurant (such as bananas, maize flour for posho, rice, cassava, sweet potatoes and Irish potatoes, etc.) and sauce ingredients (meat, chicken, fish, vegetables, beans, and so forth) to meet customer demand. Rehema is an active businesswoman whose dreams are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs and ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 36 years old and married, with seven children. She grows tea and rears dairy cattle on her farm for commercial purposes. Her farm is located in Karatina, Central Province. She has been in this business for three years. She saves her money in a group named Step by Step where all the members are farmers. This has helped her to invest in her business. She plans to buy more dairy cattle and improve her living standard in the future. She had previously taken out a loan of KES 20,000 from Faulu Kenya, which she used to expand her business and has successfully repaid. She is now requesting a loan of KES 30,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy a dairy cow and animal feed.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and animal feed.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles, age 29, works in a motor garage where he repairs vehicles to earn a living. He started this business three years ago. He also runs a video shop to earn additional income. He uses part of his income to pay his two employees, and he also saves some of his money with a group called Tushirikiane Pamoja in Faulu, Kenya.  

Charles has been guaranteed a loan of Kes. 20,000 by his group members. He plans to use this loan to buy more tools for car repair. Charles hopes to become increasingly financially stable in the future.

loans.use: To buy car-repair tools for his business

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana vende perfumes y cosméticos, y actualmente entró en sociedad con su madre, donde atienden servicio de comida rápida en la Escuela Militar de Ingeniería.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Villa Fátima  de la ciudad de La Paz en casa en anticrético de sus padres.
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de insumos, y muebles para atención de pensión).
Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro,  demostrando responsabilidad en el pago de sus cuotas, con este crédito la cliente podrá mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Viviana sells perfumes and cosmetics. She has now entered into business with her mother. They provide fast food service in the Engineering Military School. Her home is located in the Villa Fátima area of the city of La Paz. She lives in her parents' house in "anticrético" (a special type of rental arrangement in Bolivia). The loan is for work capital (to buy supplies and furniture for meal service). This is the fourth time she has requested a loan from Impro. She has demonstrated responsibility in making her payments. With the loan she will be able to improve her income and her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and furniture for meal service

loans.name: Paola Cecilia

texts.es:
Paola de 21 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil, ella vivía en la Sierra del Ecuador con su familia, en ese lugar  es muy común el ornado de chancho con mote y cebollas (plato típico), pero por la falta de oportunidades tuvo que irse a Guayaquil a vivir con su familia. 

Ya viviendo en Guayaquil empezó de nuevo a vender ornado de chancho en su casa, poco a poco fue incrementando su capital de dinero, ahora ella tiene un pequeño puesto afuera de su casa, trabaja con ayuda de su mama desde muy temprano. 

Para que sus clientes estén mas cómodos ella quiere comprar con el préstamo mesas, sillas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener un criadero de chanchos.
texts.en:
Paola is 21 years old, she lives in an urban zone of "las Orquídeas de Guayaquil. She used to live in the mountain range of el Ecuador with her family, there "ornado de chancho", pig with cooked corn and onion (typical dish) is very common, but the lack of opportunities made her move to Guayaquil to live with her family.

Living in Guayaquil she started to sell "ornado de chancho" again from her house, and little by little her capital increased and now she has a small stand outside her house. She works with the support of her mother from very early on.

In order for her customers to be more comfortable, with the loan she wants to buy tables and chairs for ther business. In the future she wishes to set up a pig farm.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables and chairs.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
46-year-old Elsie N. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has an 8-year-old child.

Elsie owns and operates a business raising crops. She owns a hectare (2.5 acres) of land where she plants and harvests rice crops that she sells at the market. She also raises two pigs. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over ten years now.

Elsie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Elsie is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure, and also additional pigs. This loan will be her ninth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure, and additional pigs

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es:
Honorata pertenece al Banco Comunal Lirio y durante el tiempo que es socia aprendió a ser responsable, puntual y a ahorrar.
Honorata tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, gaseosas, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. eventual D. su esposo. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite.
Honorata espera solucionar sus problemas familiares.
texts.en:
Honorata is part of the Communal Bank “Lirio” (Iris). During her time as a member she has learned how to be responsible, punctual, and a diligent saver.

Honorata has a store in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables, and soft drinks. Her business is open every day and she has the occasional help of her husband. This loan will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, milk, and oil.

Honorata hopes to resolve her family problems.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, milk, and oil

loans.name: Erlyn

texts.en:
Erlyn S. has been able to sustain her business of selling processed food through the previous loan she received from KIVA lenders. She has repaid the whole amount of the loan she received, and the small profit she earned has added to her husband’s income from fishing. With that, she has been able to pay for the education of her five children as well as for their other basic needs allowing them to enjoy life in a simple way

Erlyn S. would like to request a larger loan for the sustainability and growth of her previous business as well as for her new venture -- a  "sari-sari" store. Sari-sari stores basically sell small quantities of various foodstuff, grocery items and beverages. “Sari” is a native Antiquenos word for variety. This is a small store that is either attached to the owner’s house or in a small native cottage not far away from the owner’s house. Such stores are convenient for people in the village who live far from the market town. 

Erlyn is determined to improve her business as well as the life of her family. Knowing that she can access financial support through loans has given her courage and faith that someday all of her five children, aged between eight and 16, will graduate from college and be ready to face their own lives.

loans.use: To purchase foods for resale through her "sari-sari" store..

loans.name: Lily

texts.en: Lily M. is currently in the business of selling maize flour and beans at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of rice and pulses (a type of grain) to sell. Lily is 30 years old and is married to a husband who is an electrician. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a store for her goods to be saved from the rains.

loans.use: To stock bags of rice and pulses to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine O. is from the village of Lapaz, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 43 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children. Josephine owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling corn and rice in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Josephine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Josephine from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Moufidah

texts.en: Moufidah is a 40 years old widowed woman, mother of 3 children. Works at her house in selling clothes. Moufidah has to work hard for her children’s living, because she’s the main source of living after her husband’s death. This is the second time Moufidah requests a loan from A. Majmoua, in order to buy more clothes and under wears for the coming Holy Ramadan Eid and for the autumn season. Her previous loan helped in improving her sociA. situation and work, as she believes this one will do. Her clients are her neighbors and relatives, as they were the  main support for her to start working after her husband’s death, and they urged her to continue and to expand her business, and this is what she’s intending to do in the future through opening her own clothing shop.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and under wears

loans.name: Luis Albeto

texts.es:
Luis de 28 años, vende verduras y frutas en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil una zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y comerciantes informales. 

El antes trabajaba vendiendo cofres mortuorios para poder mantener a su esposa y dos hijos de 10 y 6 años. Pero como quería pasar mas tiempo con su familia invirtió sus ahorros en víveres y puso una pequeña tienda en la ventana de su casa. Desde ese tiempo hasta ahora ha vendido verduras, frutas y  víveres.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, aceites y bebidas para diferenciar su negocio no solo con verduras sino con mas víveres, en el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y expandir su negocio.
texts.en:
Luis is 28 years old and sells fruits and vegetables from the front of his house. He lives in Fortín de Guayaquil, an area characterized by unpaved roads and many informal businesses. Earlier, he worked selling burial caskets to support his wife and his two children, aged 10 and 6. However, since he wanted to spend more time with his family, he invested his savings in groceries and set up a small store in the front window of his house. Since that time, he has been selling vegetables, fruits and groceries. With the loan, he would like to buy rice, cooking oil and soft drinks, so he can expand his store, offering a wider range of grocery items as well as produce. In the future, he would like to finish constructing his house and expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying rice, cooking oil and soft drinks

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio  es el Sr. Luis Alberto; El socio tiene 25 años de edad;  él es soltero  y viene trabajando brindando servicio de taxi en su propio vehículo, el socio solicita el préstamo para hacerle el mantenimiento correspondiente a su vehículo, el socio también comprara combustible. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar combustible para el vehículo y hacerle el mantenimiento correspondiente.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
