Luis Alberto is a member of the "Caminemos Juntas" (Let's Walk Together) Communal Bank.  This bank is situated in the Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department.  

Luis Alberto is 25 years old and single. He works providing taxi service in his own vehicle.  He is requesting the loan to provide maintenance to his vehicle.  He will also buy fuel.  Alberto needs the loan to buy fuel and to provide maintenance to his vehicle.

He values and is grateful for the loan that has been provided,  and he pledges to make his payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and fuel

loans.name: Khadra

texts.en: Khadra is 46 year old woman, married, with one child. Khadra is interested in renting wedding dresses, and she works at her home. The financiA. state of this family is terrible, so she’s obliged to help her husband in raising their child. She needs a small loan from A. Majmoua to enhance her job. Her essentiA. purpose is the continuity in her work as a woman. Her dream is to create more and more ideas to develop her business. Her clients are her relatives and friends, but in the future she would like to attract a big number of clients from all over the country.

loans.use: To enhance her job.

loans.name: Lena

texts.es:
Lena tiene 44 años y vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, Perú, ella desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa. Lena es madre soltera pues su pareja la abandono con sus dos hijos, ella es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora pues tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de productos por catalogo, ella da los productos a crédito a sus amigas y familiares. Después de un mes Lena tiene que cobrar el valor del producto.     
 
Lena con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de $ 300 USD, ella invertirá el dinero para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea pagar a la empresa del catalogo los productos que fueron pedidos por sus clientes como prendas de vestir, perfumes, aretes y muchas cosas más. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Lena is 44 years old and lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, Peru.  She has been a member of Arariwa's “Patrón de San Sebastián” community bank for a long time.  Lena is a single mother since her partner abandoned her and her two children.  She is a hard-working and enterprising woman since she has a small business selling catalog products.  She sells the products on credit to her friends and family members and a month later she has to collect payment for them.

Lena plans to use her loan for $300 to increase her business capital.  She would like to be able to pay the catalog company for products which her customers have ordered such as clothing, perfume, earrings, etc.

She is grateful for the opportunity which she is being given with this loan and therefore pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To pay the catalog company for products ordered

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en:
Esperance is 33 years old and married to a driver. She has four children who are between six and eight years old. Only one of her children attends school, the others are expected to be enrolled next year. 

Esperance owns a lady’s salon and she has been doing this business for four years. She has requested this loan to buy more hairdressing supplies and beauty products. She is expecting to save her money in the account she has at Urwego. In the future, she would like to be an entrepreneur and employ many employees in her business.

loans.use: To buy hair dressing and beauty products

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is applying for a loan to improve her brother's butchery business.  With the loan, he will buy chickens in larger quantity to sells to his customers.  He started this business four years ago and Rukhsana is hopeful that a loan will help him increase his income.
  
Rukhsana is a stay at home mom who is always ready to help her family overcome difficulties.  Her family lives in Samundri, Pakistan, a city known for its agriculture industry.  They live in a two room brick house. 

Her husband works in a factory. They have a son who is enrolled in a local school. 

Rukhsana is a regular loan user of Asasah.  She has built a good credit rating and never misses any meetings. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book is Rukhsana.

loans.use: To buy chickens for chicken meat selling business

loans.name: Elda Jane

texts.en:
Elda Jane M. is from the village of Poblacion 1 Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old. Elda Jane is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Elda Jane owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating service-based services. Elda Jane has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Elda Jane joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elda Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. Elda Jane is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Elda Jane from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Guillermo Gustavo

texts.es:
Guillermo Gustavo C. V. tiene 22 años de edad, Es soltero, vive con los padres en  el  Cantón de Ventanas  Provincia los Ríos. No tiene hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto campo alegre, por la parroquia guare perteneciente al cantón baba, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.  Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Guillermo Gustavo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Cepeda y Comercial Chicaisa y vende los  productos en el Comercial López.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una máquina para trabajar.

Le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en: Guillermo Gustavo C. V. is 22, single and lives with his parents in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. He does not have any children. The V.R.C. San Jacinto is located in the Campo Alegre district, in the Guare Parish belonging to the Baba Canton. This region is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural labour-the sowing of corn and rice. They spend a lot of time doing this work. Guillermo Gustavo works in agriculture sowing corn and rice. He purchases his products in the Cepeda and Chicaisa Markets and sells them in the Lopez Market. He is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural inputs and fertilizers for the cultivation of corn and rice. The support of this loan will help him economically to supply his needs. He confronts challenges such as pests, diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to buy a machine to work with. He enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: agricultural inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Erdene-Ochir

texts.en: Erdene-Ochir is 31 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Songino-Hairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He lives together with his family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent, within his sibling's fence. All three of his children attend school. His wife is currently unemployed, while Erdene-Ochir operates a pickled vegetable and sausage trading business. He does not have any previous business experience and recently started his business after moving from Zavhan Province. For the future, he hopes to establish a stable and successful business. Erdene-Ochir is a clever and hardworking man and says, "I work very hard to expand my business further." He is requesting a 500,000-MNT loan to purchase more grocery products to sell for the upcoming holiday Tsagaan Sar, Mongolian New Year.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia Y. is from the village of Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old, married and has 2 adult-aged children. Florencia owns and operates a business preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Florencia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Florencia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florencia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Florencia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the second loan taken out by Florencia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Itacuan Group

texts.es:
Grupo “Itacuan” se llama así porque sus integrantes son originarias de la población la Cruz del Itacuan, Itacuan en mixteco significa flor amarilla esta flor es muy conocida en estas regiones ya que es la flor que utilizan para adornar los altares en las fiestas de dia de muertos. Este grupo lleva varios ciclos y esta integrado por 10 mujeres las cuales se conocen bien puesto que han estado en los ciclos anteriores. Este grupo cuenta con un comité que los organiza para poder realizar los pagos y tramites que se van realizando en el transcurso de los pagos del préstamo. 
La representante de este grupo es la señora Araceli R. L. de 34 años de edad esta casada con el señor Fortino C. Martinez  ambos tienen 5 hijos que están estudiando la secundaria y primaria. L señora Araceli se dedica a la venta de pollos en pie y destazados es por eso que solicito el préstamo para poder comprar mas pollos y poderlos vender y de las ganancias que obtiene es para el apoyo economico de su familia y para realizar sus pagos y de igual manera para poder engrandecer mas su negocio y poder tener mas ingresos.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Matilde C. M. de 48 años de edad esta casada con el señor Nemesio C. Calderon de oficio campesino ambos tienen 4 hijos los cuales todos ya están casados. Ella se dedica a la venta de tamales actividad que aprendio a realizar gracias a su mama quien le enseño desde que era adolescente, ella empezó a realizar esta actividad hace mas de 15 años  debido a la necesidad que tenia para la educación de sus hijos.
La señora Matilde realiza diferentes tipos de tamales  como son: dulces, de manjar, de rajas con queso, mole de pollo, cerdo en salsa verde, mole de iguana, tichinda, mole de pescado, entre otros, realiza estos tamales todos los dias, cada día vende de 3 diferentes; es por ello que solicito el prestamo para poder comprar mas insumos para realizar sus tamales como son el maiz, hojas de elotes y los diferentes productos para poder realizar el guisado que llevara el tamal. Sus productos los vende en su población de manera ambulante y siempre acaba ya que sus tamales son muy deliciosos  y ella es muy reconocida en su población y es por ello que tiene muchos clientes.
Ella sueña con poner otro negocio que le deje un poco mas de ganancia ya que la elaboración de tamales es muy cansado y laborioso y deja pocas ganancias, pero pues tiene que seguir realizándolos debido a que es la manera de sobrevivir económicamente.
Es una mujer muy puntual en sus pagos y piensa seguir siendo así siempre. Agradece a las personas que le proporcionaron el apoyo del prestamo.
Las personas que integran este grupo son las siguientes: 
Heriberta Rafaela R. R.: De 42 años de edad ella se dedica a la compra de quesos para la venta.
Emma S. R.: De 54 años de edad se dedica a la compra de cerdos para la venta.
Francisca S. G.: De 40 años de edad se dedica a la compra de cerdos para la venta.
Elizabeth Soledad M. M.: De 21 años de edad se dedica a  la compra de ropa por catalogo para la venta.
Carmen C. M.: De 46 años de edad se dedica a la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de tamales.
Eufemia Ines M. M.: De 41 años de edad se dedica a la compra de pollo para la venta.
Araceli R. L.: De 34 años de edad se dedica a la compra de pollo para la venta.
Luisa S. S.: De 27 años de edad se dedica a la compra de pollo para la venta.
Lucia C. Sachez: De 28 años de edad se dedica a la compra de ropa para la venta.
Matilde C. M.: De 48 años de edad se dedica a la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de tamales.
texts.en:
The group 'Itacuan' calls itself this because its members are from the population of la Cruz del Itacuan.  In Mixteco (a local indigenous language), itacuan means yellow flower.  It is well known in these regions as it is a flower that is used to decorate alters in the festivals for the Day of the Dead.  This group has completed several loan cycles, and is made up of 10 women who know themselves to be as well prepared as they have been in the previous loan cycles.  This group includes a committee who organizes them in order to make payments and complete the processes for the repayment of the loan.

The representative of this group is Señora Araceli R. L..  She is 34 and is married to Señor Fortino C. Martinez.  Together they have 5 children who are studying in secondary or primary school.  Señora Araceli works selling live and butchered chickens.  This is what she is asking for a loan for, in order to buy more chickens and be able to sell them, and the earnings that she obtains are for the economic support of her family and to make her repayments, and by the same manner to be able to grow her business and have more income.

One of the members of this group is Señora Matilde C. M..  She is 48 years old and is married to Señor Nemesio C. Calderon.  He does farm work.  They have 4 children whom are all married.  She works selling tamales, work that she learned to do thanks to her mother, who taught her how when she was an adolescent.  She began doing this work more than 15 years ago because of what she needed to fund the education of her children.

Señora Matilde makes different types of tamales like:  sweet, delicious, onion and cheese, chicken mole, pork and green chili, iguana mole, tichinda, fish mole, among others.  She makes these tamales every day, and every day she sells 3 different ones.  This is why she is asking for a loan in order to buy more ingredients to make her tamales, like corn, corn leaves, and different products to be able to make the filling that fills the tamale.  She sells her products on foot in the town, and she always sells out as her tamales are very delicious and she is recognized for this in her town.  Because of this she has many customers.

Her dream is to be able to have another business that would make more profits.  Although making tamales is exhausting and laborious and provides small earnings, she has to continue making them as it is how she survives economically.  She is very punctual with her repayments and she plans to continue making them as always.  She is grateful to the people who give her help though the loan.

The people who make up this group are the following:
Heriberta Rafaela R. R.:  42 years old, she works making cheese for sale.
Emma S. R.:  54 years old, she works purchasing and reselling pigs.
Francisca S. G.::  40 years old, she works purchasing and reselling pigs.
Elizabeth Soledad M. M.:  21 years old, she works selling clothing by catalog.
Carmen C. M.:  46 years old, she buys ingredients to make and sell tamales.
Eufemia Ines M. M.: 41 years old, she buys chicken for resale.
Araceli R. L.:  34 years old, she buys chicken for resale.
Luisa S. S.:  27 years old, she buys chicken for resale.
Lucia C. Sachez:  48 years old, she buys clothing for resale.
Matilde C. M.:  48 years old, she buys ingredients to make and sell tamales.

loans.use: COMPRA DE POLLOS PARA LA VENTA DE POLLOS EN PIE Y DESTAZADOS

location.town: Cruz del Itacuan, Pinotepa Nacional; Oaxaca

loans.name: Eoun

texts.en:
Eoun C. resides with her family in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. 

C. and her husband are farmers and sell rice, earning an income of US $3 each per day. Each month, the family has to spend US $37 on food and US $7 on the other necessary expenses. 

C. is requesting a loan of US $600 to purchase horses to transport rice and other products to sell. By doing so, she will be able to generate more income. 

In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy horses to transport rice and other products to sell

loans.name: Ma. Villamor

texts.en:
Ma. Villamor A. is from the village of Cabalantian, Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 41 years old. Ma. Villamor is married and has two school-aged children. 

To make a living, Ma. Villamor runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling bread, snacks and also animal feeds and medicines. Ma. Villamor has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Ma. Villamor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Ma. Villamor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in renovating the business. 

Ma. Villamor is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and canned goods. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Ma. Villamor from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and canned goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy essential drugs for her pharmacy

loans.name: Nyamdavaa

texts.en:
Nyamdavaa M. is a 57-year-old man who lives with his wife and four children in a house in Hovd province, Mongolia. His older son lives and works in Korea in order to help to pay the education fee of his youngest brother and sister. His youngest three children attend college. His wife is a nurse who helps with the family business in her spare time. 

Nyamdavaa manages a clothing trading business in his town. He started his business in 2000 out of a rented stall at a Buyan, one of the biggest markets in his town. With 11 years of business operation, he has gained much experience and is well-known among his customers. He is a diligent man who is planning to expand his business in the future. 

He is requesting a loan of 800,000 MNT to import more stylish clothes from China.

loans.use: to import more stylish clothes from China

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Eulalia works hard to support her family.

She has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen foods.  She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy different items like pants, shorts, blouses, etc. to sell in her stall.

Eulalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy different clothing items to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi Wangui M. is a married woman with two children, 24 and 20 years old. Her business is located in the residential area of Jamhuri in Thika, a region in Kenya known for pineapple production. Naomi has been selling cereals and porridge flour for the last nine years to the local people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business going well.

Naomi is using her loan of KES 50,000 to buy more cereals to expand her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to have many business outlets and supply her cereals to different parts of the country in the future. Naomi wants to be a market leader in this business. She describes herself as social.

loans.use: to buy more cereals.

loans.name: Hernanado Rafael

texts.es: Hernando desde el municipio de puerto Colombia, municipio a orillas del mar,  envía el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores en Kiva: “Gracias por el apoyo brindado a personas que solo necesitan una pequeña ayuda para salir adelante.” Él está  solicitando está solicitando su segundo credikiva con el cual comprará materias primas como gomas, herrajes, sintéticos y accesorios, y también comprará una máquina de coser el cuero, con esta inversión puede responder oportunamente a un  pedido  y va a trabajar en nuevos diseños para abrir nuevos mercados.   Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Hernando puede ingresar al siguiente enlace:  http://kiva.org/lend/211713
texts.en: Hernando lives in the town of  Puerto Colombia, next to the ocean. He sends the following message to his Kiva lenders: "Thank you for the support offered to people who only need a little bit of help to get ahead."  He is asking for his second Kiva loan so he can buy raw materials such as glue, buckles, synthetic materials and accesories. He will also buy a leather sewing machine. With this investment he can respond in a timely way to an order and he's going to work on new designs to open new markets. If you want to know Hernando's story, you can click on the following link: http://kiva.org/lend/211713

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as glue, buckles, synthetic materials and accesories. He will also buy a leather sewing machine.

loans.name: Charisma

texts.en:
Charisma is 21 years old and has a retail shop where she sells a variety of different products in the community.  She has had this business for 2 years. She is married and has 1 infant child.

Charisma is requesting a loan of Php 9,000 to buy soft drinks, canned goods and other daily basic items to sell. Each month, Charisma earns about Php 3,000 doing this type of work.

In the future, Charisma hopes that her business will improve so that she can provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods and other daily basic needs to sell

loans.name: Stone Quarry Development Group

texts.en: 50 year old Alice, a happily married mother of 3, has been engaged in a stone quarry business for the past 18 years in Mukono. She says she began this business under the auspices of her husband. Stone quarrying is a business which involves a lot of elbow grease. For that reason, Alice employs sturdy and dynamic young men to do most of the work. She lays great store upon hard work and this philosophy has trickled down to her workers. She says this business generates profits totaling up to 180,000 shillings monthly. The purpose of this loan, she says, is to help her purchase more stones for usage at her quarry. Client demand has increased and the purchase of more stones will enable her to meet their demands.

loans.use: to purchase more stones for use in her quarry.

loans.name: Ronald José

texts.es:
El señor Ronald José vive en la cuidad de Managua padre de familia.
El señor visito nuestras oficina para solicitar un crédito ya ha tomado la decisión de mejorar su vivienda las mejoras que don Ronald va hacer son el levantamiento de una pared   y el piso de su vivienda. 
el material que el señor va a compra es arena ,bloque, cemento, y ladrillo.
Es importante destacar que por medio de la realización de esta obra le proporcionará a su familia un techo digno donde vivir y con todas las condiciones necesarias para el desarrollo de sus hijos.
Don Ronald agradece a ceprodel por la oportunidad que ceprodel le ha dado para obtener el crédito .y poder mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ronald José is a father, and he lives in the city of Managua.

He came to our office to request a loan because he has made the decision to improve his home.  The improvements that Ronald is going to make are to raise a wall and to put down a floor in his home.  The material he is going to buy is sand, concrete blocks, cement, and bricks.

It is important to point out that by making these improvements he will be giving his family a decent place to live with all of the necessities for his children to grow and develop.

Ronald is grateful to Ceprodel for the opportunity that Ceprodel has given him to get a loan and to be able to improve his home.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
This is Arlene, 48, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Nelson, a house painter. She has three children.

Arlene operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages  to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one bottle of shampoo, a Php5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Arlene makes a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells frozen meat products.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php900 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 22,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and frozen products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Arlene hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies with them.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and frozen products needed in her business.

loans.name: Santas

texts.en:
Santas is 55 years old and married. She has three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Santas has an upholstery business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 31 years.

She requested a PHP 49,500 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her upholstery business.

Santas would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her upholstery business.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina lives in Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her mother). Amina has a charcoal selling business. She has been in this business for 7 years and she works 7 days a week. Amina sells her products retail at the market. She has requested a loan of 400000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO which she will use to buy bags of charcoal. The main business challenges for Amina include thieves and seasonality. Her goals are to sell wholesale only and to buy a plot of land. Amina lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Margarit

texts.en: Margarit is from the village of Metz Sepasar in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is happily married with a twenty eight year old son and a twenty seven year old daughter.  She has professional training as an accountant and has been working as a self-employed farmer for over thirty years.  Due to the difficult economic situation in Armenia she also supports her daughter’s family.  Her hard work over the years has given Margarit the opportunity to build a family house.  She dreams now to renovate the home.  Margarit is looking for a loan to purchase livestock.  According to her business plan this investment will increase the family income by twenty percent.  This is also a ten percent increase in the total investment in her ongoing business.  She appreciates the opportunity to grow her business from access to microfinance.  The microfinance services are well organized and customer friendly.  She enjoys living in her birthplace Metz Sepasar close to family and friends.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Rosales Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSALES” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Tejada, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Pastora. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción y servicio.

La señora Pastora  indica que este es el primer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de sus compañeras. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de crianza de ganado que viene trabajando hace años atrás, aprendiendo este oficio de sus padres 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra una vaca) que de las ferias de ganado vacuno y posteriormente lo comercializará mediante la venta de carne. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella es casada  y tiene diez hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el salud y los ahorros.

Las señoras Bertha Y Teresa esconden su rostro por timidez, ya que no estan acostubradas a las fotografías.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Rosales” is starting its first loan with Pro Mujer as part of the Tejada Center.  This group consists of nine members who are led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Pastora.  The members of this Communal Bank engage in various business activities in the retail, manufacturing, and service sectors.  

Sra. Pastora says that this is her first loan cycle while working with Pro Mujer.  She joined the organization after being invited by her fellow group members.  At the moment, she has a business raising cattle and has been working for many years.  Pastora learned this trade from her parents.  

The loan she is requesting now will increase her capital so that she can buy a cow at the livestock fair.  She will sell it later for the meat.  Working in this manner enables to generate income to support her family as much as possible.  Pastora is married and has 10 children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Pastora said that she enjoys the health services and the savings.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Hermogina

texts.en: Hermogina is 58 years old and lives in Casul, Sapang Dalaga. She is married with three children. To earn a living, Hermogina has a business selling fish. She earns about 4,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Hermogina has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase 12 boxes of fish to sell. Hermogina has been a member of PMPC for 11 years.

loans.use: to purchase 12 boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Narin

texts.en:
Narin (in the photo) is 28 years old and her husband, Chanthol, is 37 years old. They live along National Road Number Six about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2008 and have no children. 

Narin sells sugar palm and raises ducks and chickens at home. He husband is an aide-de-camp. Narin asked for a Kiva loan once already. She hopes to continue expanding her duck farming business. She is asking for another loan in the amount of $500 to buy additional ducks to raise.

loans.use: to expand her duck farming business by buying additional ducks to raise.

loans.name: Gülcan

texts.en:
Gülcan is married and has 2 children. She started working 7 years ago making lunches for the workers in her husband’s textile workshop.  At first, she prepared lunches for 2-3 people. Now she prepares lunches everyday for over 30 employees. Before providing lunches at her husband’s textile workshop, she was a housewife. Gülcan's husband used to pay someone else to make food for his workers, but she later told him to give her the salary and she would make the lunches for the workshop. He agreed and it has been her work ever since.

All the time Gülcan has spent preparing food at home in her kitchen has been in preparation for future work. She wants to open a special kitchen (not in her home) to make and sell lunches to many area workshops and local tradesmen. She will use this loan to buy large-sized pots, kitchen utensils, and an oven.  With the equipment she purchases from this loan, she will expand her menu selection and earn more money.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Gülcan evli ve 2 çocuğu var.  Yedi yıl once,eşinin tekstil atölyesinde ,çalışanlara yemek yapmaya başladı.  İlk once,2-3 kişiye yemek hazırladı.  Şimdi 30 un üzerinde çalışana hergün yemek hazırlıyor.  Gülcan Hanım ev hanımı iken,önce eşinin tekstil atölyesinde yemek yapıyordu.  Eşi önceden başka birisine,çalışanlarına  yemek yapması için para veriyormuş fakat sonra eşine maaşı kendisine vermesini söylemiş ve yemekleri atölye için yapmaya başladı.  Kabul ettiğinden beri aynı işi yapıyor.

Evinin mutfağında yaptığı yemek hazırlama işini, ilerleyen dönemde ev dışında yapmaya başladı .  Bu iş için özel bir mutfak açıp, birden fazla işyerine ve yaşadığı bölgedeki esnaflara, yemek yapıp satmak istiyor.  Bu kredi ile büyük boy tencere , fırın ve mutfak araç gereci almak için kullanacak.  Satın aldığı cihazlarla ,yemek çeşidi  çoğaltıp, daha fazla para kazanacağını düşünüyor.

loans.use: to buy large-sized pots, kitchen utensils, and an oven

loans.name: Shaiyrbubu's Group

texts.en:
Shaiyrbubu is the leader of this group. She is 52 and married to a farmer. She and her husband have four sons and three daughters. Most of their children are now married and live separately with their families.

In order to earn money for their livelihood, the family cultivates agricultural products and breeds livestock. Shaiyrbubu plans to use her portion of the loan to purchase sheep for breeding, fattening, and further resale. In the future, she wishes to improve her family’s welfare.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Iris Esperanza

texts.es: Iris Esperanza D. cuarenta y seis años D. edad vive con su hijo. Ella posee una tienda donD. venD. productos D. primera necesidad como arroz, frijoles, leche entre otros, últimamente se ha hecho D. mucha clientela, pues siempre tiene lo que las personas necesitan con productos D. excelente calidad a precios realmente accesibles y con un servicio inigualable; Iris es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas D. salir adelante,  quiere sentirse ganadora y para lograr el éxito sus mayores secretos son la constancia y la dedicación, esta dispuesta a hacer crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, producto instantáneo, embutidos, golosinas, bebidas etc. Iris Esperanza tiene la confianza que con su dedicación podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
IIris Esperanza, 46, lives with her son. She has a store where she sells staples such as rice, beans and milk, among other items. Lately she has had many customers because she always has what people need and provides high quality products at accessible prices with unparalleled service. 

Iris is an enterprising woman who wants very much to get ahead. She wants to feel that she is a winner and in order to achieve success her greatest secrets are perseverance and dedication. She wants to expand her business and therefore requests a loan from INTEGRAL that would allow her to buy bulk grains, instant products, cold cuts, sweets, drinks, etc. Iris is confident that with her dedication she will be able to proviD. a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains, instant products, cold cuts, sweets and drinks.

loans.name: Gisella Yaqueline

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen María se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Ciudad de clima cálido y con una variada  gastronomía.

Aquí conocimos a Gissella,  tiene 20 años y es soltera, estudia Ciencias para la Educación  en la Universidad de Montecristi. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos empezó su negocio el cual le permite ganar sus propios ingresos y con estos continuar con sus estudios para tener un mejor porvenir.

Ella además de estudiar también se dedica a la venta de de productos Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días y en sus horas libres de estudios ella les vende a  sus compañeras de clases y los fines de semana visita a otros clientes que tiene en la ciudad, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va bastante bien, lo que más vende son los cosméticos ya que son muy buenos y variados.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior.
 
Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y conseguir un buen trabajo.
texts.en:
The Virgen Maria ("Virgin Mary") communal bank meets every fifteen days in the Montecristi canton (Portoviejo). This area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its artisans, whose work is known nationally and internationally. The city's climate is warm and the gastronomy is varied.
Here we meet Gissella. She is 20, single, and studies educational sciences at the Universidad de Montecristi. She lives at home. 
Gissella has been a member of the communal bank for three cycles, and she likes it because she was able to use the loans to start her business. Her business allows her to make her own income, and with it continue her studies in order to have a better future.
On top of studying, she sells Esika products (beauty products; cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories). She works every day, and when she doesn't have classes she sells her products to her classmates. On the weekends, she visits other clients in the city. She leaves her products on credit and charges every week. She has had this business for one year and it is going quite well. Her hottest products are the cosmetics, since they are very good and varied.
This loan is for the purchase of perfumes, creams, cosmetics and underwear.
Her dreams are to finish her studies and obtain a good job.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, and underwear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fashion clothes (blouses, jeans, trousers, shirts) and many items for her business

loans.name: Ephantus

texts.en:
Ephantus has been in farming for six straight years in his home district of Nkubu, Central Kenya.  His farm produces bananas, beans, maize and milk, which he sells at the local market.  He runs a ballast selling business for additional income

Ephantus has requested a loan of KES 41,600 from Juhudi Kilimo to help him buy and insure a dairy cow.  He says he needs to improve his farming income to enable him to educate his children as well as improve his family living standards.  He adds he needs more funds to buy more land for banana growing.

He notes, however, that poor prices for farm products is a challenge in the business, as well as insufficient rain.  He, however, remains happy with Juhudi Kilimo loan services and reveals this is his third loan request with Juhudi Kilimo after his first and second loan of KES 20,000 and KES 15,000 respectively.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ngat

texts.en: Ms. Ngat is 35 years old with two children who are school age. She manages a shop that sells ready-made clothes. Her shop is running well with considerable revenue every month. She also raises chickens for meat.  Joining SEDA’s credit program in 2007, she used loans for expanding her shop.  At present, she wants to have a loan of 9,632,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) to buy more new designed clothes to meet the increasing demand of customers on Tet holiday. She will also use part of the loan for food for her chickens.

loans.use: to buy more new designed clothes and food for her chickens.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her garment-selling business. She makes T-shirts and other garments and sells them at different garment shops in the market. She has good business skills and receives regular orders because of her good quality work. She has been operating her business for many years and is hopeful that a loan investment will help her make more profits from her business.

Rukhsana's husband has a furniture manufacturing and selling business. She is the mother of four daughters and a son. The two eldest children work while others remain at home. Besides her business, Rukhsana also performs her household duties very well.

Note: In the photo, the woman holding a book (called an Asasah Passbook) is Rukhsana.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her garment-making and selling business.

loans.name: Alekov

texts.en:
Alekov is a 31-year-old Roma from Sliven, Bulgaria. The Roma, commonly known as Gypsies in the West, is a severely marginalized group in the Balkan Peninsula of Southeast Europe. Alekov is married with two kids.

Alekov is an independent contractor focused on home repairs. He’s been doing this for 15 years, first as an apprentice and then on his own for the last 10 years. Most of the work he does in within the Roma ghetto of Sliven, where his business comes almost exclusively through referrals. The proceeds of this loan will be used for two things: 1) to purchase metalworking tools, some of which Alekov is buying for the first time and some of which are replacements and 2) working capital, which predominately will be used to fund the hiring of an employee.

Alekov is excited about the opportunities this loan will open up to him. He’s clearly thinking about a big business several years down the line.

loans.use: Capital equipment and working capital

loans.name: Sara

texts.en: Sara lives in Vingunguti area of Dar es Salaam. She is married and has three sons. Sara is in a food vending business. She has five years in this business. She plans to improve her business by adding sufficient numbers of dining tables and chairs, food serving dishes and stock of cold drinks. On usual working hours her business is normally flocked with customers in need of services. Sometimes she looses some customers due to inadequate tables and chairs. She also in need of a cupboard for keeping food serving dishes hygienically. To facilitate her plan Sara needs USD 400.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Abdul Hamid

texts.en: A. Hamid lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is in university and he has a cosmetics shop where he works part time. He wants to take a individual loan to make enlarge his shop and buy extra materials like earrings, bracelets, and new designs of clothes and extra things to expand his business. Because he is a young boy he wants to start a new life with this money and to be a great business dealer in the future. He is happy now that he can solve his problems with this loan.

loans.use: To buy jewelry and new clothing designs for his shop

loans.name: Muhamed

texts.en: Muhamed T. is thirty-five years old, married with one child.  He started running a business twelve years ago selling rice. With the development of many vocational training schools by the international NGOs, many people are trained in tie-and-dye and soap making.  Mohamed found there is great need for chemicals such caustic soda, color dye, and even cotton fabrics.  He then started selling these items on a small scale.  The business improved after his previous loan and he would now like to expand his business further.  He is requesting a loan of $175 for this purpose.

loans.use: Increase stock of chemicals sold for use in tie-dye and soap making

loans.name: Rodelia Admira

texts.es:
Rodelia is a mother who has had innumerable obstacles to tackle.

Soon after she got married, she suffered the terrible loss of her husband. After being able to overcome her sorrow, she got engaged again. Things were going very well with her second husband. Their love for each other gave them 4 little ones. However, when everything at home was reaching a true stability, destiny had another obstacle for her.

The man who Rodelia thought loved her so much ran away with her children and Rodelia's sister. Until then, Rodelia had been in charge of the field labor. Obtaining the fruit of the earth without hurry nor pressure. Today, she has a goal who is soaked in love: to increase her potato sowing and increase her cheese production so she can offer them to her clients. In this way, she can save some money to go find her children.

Her inmense motherly love motivates her every day to achieve her goal. She is asking for $500 dollars which she commits to pay back within 6 months. Rodelia is sharing her goals with you. She is coming to you to help her dream come true. Lets help make Rodelia enjoy many joyful moments next to her little children.

Translated by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Rodelia, es una madre que ha tenido innumerables obstáculos que sobrepasar. A poco tiempo de haberse casado sufrió la pérdida de su esposo; posteriormente y luego de haber superado tan terrible pena, decidió comprometerse una vez más; con su segundo esposo, las cosas marchaban muy bien y fruto del amor; tuvieron 4 pequeños. Sin embargo cuando ya creía que las cosas en el interior de su hogar habían cobrado verdadera estabilidad. El destino le tenía preparado un obstáculo más .El hombre que pensaba la amaba mucho; huyó llevándose a sus hijos en compañía de la hermana de Rodelia. Hasta ese entonces ella realizaba sus labores en el campo, obteniendo la producción de su tierra en menor escala y sin ninguna premura o presión. Ahora tiene un objetivo empapado de puro amor; incrementar su siembra de papa en el campo y elaborar mayor número de quesos para poder ofrecérselos a sus clientes. De esta manera afianzaría la suma de dinero ahorrada y podría ir en búsqueda de sus pequeños. Su inmenso amor de madre la motiva día a día para alcanzar su meta; su pedido es por un monto de 500 dólares que se compromete a devolverlos en un período de 6 meses. Habiendo hecho de su conocimiento el propósito que se ha trazado recurre a ustedes a fin de hacer realidad su deseo. Hagamos que Rodelia pueda disfrutar muchos momentos llenos de alegría junto a sus pequeños niños.

loans.use: Increase potato and cheese production to be able to look for her missing children

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose O. is 46 years old,  married and has four children. For the last two years, she has operated a grocery stall in the Rongo market. She specializes in selling popular items that are widely used in her community, such as sukuma wiki (kale), onions and tomatoes. She also sells cereals to generate additional income. Hard work, perseverance and a good reputation have allowed her business to grow despite competition. Rose has applied for a loan of  $600, $450 of which she will use to buy additional cereals and vegetables to sell. She will set the remaining $150 aside as savings to use in case of unforeseen circumstances.

loans.use: Purchase additional groceries and cereals to sell

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en: Marhabo M. is a mother of 4 children.  She has been in business selling clothing for 14 years.  Winter is a busy time of year at the bazaar where her business is located.  Ms. M. requests a loan of $875 to increase her stock of winter clothing to meet her customers' demand.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Margaret Namushabe's Group

texts.en: Magret has 3 local dairy cows. She supplies milk to a small restaurant. With the profits from her business, she plans to use the extra profits to buy Friesian dairy cows and a milk can.

loans.use: To buy a fridge to store her milk

loans.name: Steven

texts.en: Steven is a 35 year old resident of Vituka area in Dar es Salaam. He runs a photo studio in Vituka area. He does video shooting and editing and gets paid for shooting on weddings and other parties in the area. He is currently in need of USD 600 to help him buy modern equipment for his job.

loans.use: BUY MODERN EQUIPMENT

loans.name: Cicilia Juan's Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Cicilia J.. She is currently in the business of selling beans and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Cicilia is 32 years old and she is married with a husband who is a teacher at Shell school. She has 4 children ranging from age 2 to 10 and her children go to school. Each week, Cicilia makes approximately 50 Sudanese pounds in profits. She hopes to be able to spend the extra profits from her loan on her children's education.

Cicilia is joined in her small group by Manuella Christopher, Vivian S., Rose L. and Susan K.. Manuella Christopher has a business selling ice cream and wants to expand the business. Vivian S. is also operating a business selling ice cream and wants a loan to expand the business. Rose L. operates a business selling charcoal and wants to expand her business. Susan K. is also currently in the business of selling ice cream and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: For the expansion of the businesses

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi B. is a fishmonger and also sells other food products. She is married and has 3 children. She is working very hard to meet her family’s financial needs. She wants to increase sales so she can meet the increasing demands to support her family.

She is asking for a loan of $425 to purchase more fish for processing and selling.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for processing and selling

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
.Five years ago Edgar decided to breed small animals for a living, especially guinea pigs as he saw the opportunity and the cost-effectiveness generated in many families as the meat is nutritious and delicious. In a short period of time his farm has grown and he faces great challenges for the future and has decided to expand the breeding space and buy more chickens and guinea pigs to start sales in other towns.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Hace 5 años, Edgar, decidió dedicarse a la crianza de animales menores, principalmente de los cuyes por la oportunidad que observó en ellos y la rentabilidad que genera hoy en día a muchas familias, gracias a su nutritiva y deliciosa carne. En poco tiempo ha visto crecer su granja y tiene grandes retos para el futuro, ha decidido ampliar su espacio de crianza y comprar mayor cantidad de pollos y cuyes para iniciar la venta de los mismos en otras ciudades.

loans.use: Expand breeding space for chickens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Khagani

texts.en: Khagani M. is a 38-year-old man who has raised sheep to sell as mutton since 1997. He raises sheep and than sells them to the local bazaar traders. He lives in the Bilasuvar Internally Displaced People Settlement. He has applied for a loan of $800 USD to purchase more sheep and increase his income. He will use this loan to purchase 10 sheep and fodder.

loans.use: Going to purchase 10 sheep and fodder.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Click this link to view Cecilia's first loan.

Cecilia belongs to the Gracias Morenita Village Bank. She lives with her husband, is 24 and has two little children. She is a mobile fruit woman in a tricycle in an inter-provincial transport station. She works all day, all week. She sells all kinds of fruit she purchases at the wholesale market.

Cecilia needs a 1250 soles ($US450) loan to invest in granadilla, apples, grapes, bananas, pears and oranges.

She wants to help her children in their studies, and she dreams about expanding her business, having a stable store and building her house.

loans.use: To buy granadilla, apples, grapes, bananas, pears and oranges.

loans.name: Diénaba

texts.fr:
Diénaba S., aged 43 and married with eight children in her care, has been a member of the 2nd Bridge Lyndiane Village Bank for seven years. She buys cloth (embroidered cloth and cotton damask) and pays a tailor to make outfits for subsequent sale. Her income enables her to contribute towards the family expenses. Diénaba is requesting a loan which will be repaid after six months in a single installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Diénaba S., 43 ans, mariée avec 08 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Lyndiane 2eme pont depuis 7 ans. Elle achète des tissus (brodé, bazin et billet coton) et paie les services d’un tailleur pour confectionner des ensembles et les vendre. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à la charge familiale. Diénaba sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Clothing manufacture and sales

loans.name: Samira

texts.en: Samira is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Kalbadjar region in Azerbaijan and has settled in Baku city, in the settlement of Keshle. She was born in 1982. She has run a consulting business for 2 years. Now she needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy a computer.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora M. tiene 35 años es casada madre de tres hijos uno de 15,16,18 los cuales cursan la secundaria,  la señora M. es una persona emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superacion ya que su negocio es familiar porque cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo en forma directa y con la ayuda de sus tres hijos en el tiiempo libres su actividad economica es la venta de C,D  y ropa interior de dama y de caballero la cual la oferta de forma ambulante uno de sus grandes sueños es poder establecerse y poder sacar adelante a sus tres hijos a que logren coronar una carrera universitaria y para ello espera seguir contando con el apoyo de Fundacion Leon 2000
texts.en:
Ms. M. is 35 years old. She is married and the mother of 3 children, ages 15, 16 and 18. They are in secondary school. Ms. M. is an entrepreneur with many dreams of making her life better. Her business is a family business as she counts on the direct help of her husband and, in their spare time, the help of her three children. Her economic activity is the sale of CDs and underwear for men and women, which she sells by going from place to place. One of her greatest dreams is to be able to establish herself and to help her three children be able to attend university. For this, she hopes to continue counting on the help of the Leon Foundation 2000.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital for CD and clothing sales

loans.name: Gertrude Nakamya’S Group

texts.en:
Gertrude is the leader of a 4-member group. She is a 43-year-old, married woman with 6 children aged between 26 and 7. Four of her children go to school. Gertrude takes care of two additional family members. She resides in and owns a five-roomed house where eight people are living in all. They don’t have electricity and piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

Gertrude resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. She sells fish in Nakulabye market and buys the fish from Kimme Island in Lake Victoria. Gertrude uses public transport to and from the island. She sells to all categories of people, mainly wholesale, and works four days a week. Her monthly expenses include school fees, medication, and feeding the family.

Gertrude has been with MCDT for five years and is presently servicing her tenth loan, working all this while with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to increase the inventory of her business.

loans.use: To boost her business

loans.name: Ershad

texts.en:
This is Ershad, 23 years old, who graduated from the 12th class and is single. After he finished school, because of some financial problems, he could not continue his studies. He started a small business of computers and computer equipment.

Ershad has five brothers; one works in a car sales shop and the others are small and study in the public school of Jalalabad city. He has own house and he want to stand on his own feet as soon as possible.

He contacted AFSG to take a 50,000 AF loan for 18 months. He pays 1500 AF per month for rent of the shop. He wants increase his income and buy some things such as laptops, desktops, and USBs. He has his own capital of 800,000 AF invested in his shop. Now he is happy with the lenders to AFSG.

loans.use: Complete his stocks

loans.name: Sou

texts.en:
Sou S., 49, is married and lives with three of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She works in a grocery store, making around $5 each day, while her husband is a construction worker. Her husband, Chhum Try, 47, on average makes $4 a day to help support the household. Three of their children are students.

Mrs. Sou S. would like to take out a loan of $500 to add more grocery’s inventory.

loans.use: To add more grocery’s inventory.

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 41-years-old Fedelina U. from Mwanza. She is married with six children, between the ages of eleven and nineteen. Fedelina has been running a small "duka" or neighborhood shop in the city where she has been selling common household and grocery items since 1990. She sells soaps, wheat flour, sugar, cooking oil, margarine, etc. She works at the business for twelve hours per day, six days per week, and is assisted by her husband.

Fedelina currently earns about US$162 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 400 in order to buy larger quantities to re-sell at higher prices. In the future, she plans to increase her inventory. Fedelina thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities and re-sell at higher prices

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda A. sells a variety of goods in her neighborhood, which helps her sustain her family. She uses the profit that she gets from selling her products to pay for their daily expenses. She is also able to meet some of her children's needs. She is happy about her business now because it helps her to raise her children well.

Soon, she would like to have a “talaba” farm. Talaba is a kind of seashell that has became popular in the Philippines. That is why she is asking for an additional loan from CEVI. She will use the loan to improve her store and purchase additional merchandise in the hopes of generating more income for the family. When her income has increased enough she would like to have a “talaba" farm of her own.

CEVI helps Erlinda grow her business. CEVI has provided Erlinda with credit assistance, training, and insurance services.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen S. is a resident of Betibut, Sapang Dalaga, Mis. Occ. She is 37 years old and has only one child.

Allen's business is named S.'s Sari-Sari (convenience) Store. Her store is easily accessible to her customers because it is along the highway. She is currently requesting a 5,000 loan amount for additional capital for her grocery store. She needs to buy additional food, toiletries, and household items, too. Way back when Allen started her Sari-Sari store, she only infused a small capital into her business. She can't imagine how it expanded and grew. But she realizes that it is because of the training and support of our staff who never cease to explain the right way of managing a small capital and the concept of saving. She also learns the value of insurance and investment.

Allen and her husband are planning to extend their store so they can display more items which are in demand by their customers. Her husband is a very hard-working person too, like Allen. He tills a small farm for the family's consumption and if there is an excess of their produce he sells it in a market or to interested buyers who directly make it to their farm.

Allen is hoping too that she can send her child to a decent school and have a decent home also in the future. "Thank you so much, Paglaum," Allen states, as she considers it a great opportunity for her and her family to become part of the Paglaum Family.

loans.use: Purchase of additional grocery items such as food and household items

loans.name: Macaria

texts.es: Macaria tiene 41 años, vive con su pareja y con sus 4 hijos; Jhon de 16, Ricardo de 11, Gisel de 7 y Emerson de 4. Hace 10 años que tiene una tienda de abarrotes, además de realizar otras actividades como la venta de ropa, elaboración de adornos para fiestas, entre otros. Pero la que ha sido más estable es su bodega, por ello que empezó a vender cerveza, con lo que ha logrado buenos resultados y han ido en aumento sus ingresos económicos. Macaria es una mujer muy activa, ya que siempre está pensando en alguna manera de incursionar en un nuevo negocio. Ahora quiere poner un kiosco de golosinas al frente del colegio de su hijo Ricardo, donde espera generar muy buenas ganancias y en el futuro tener un salón de belleza en su propio hogar ya que ella es cosmetologa de profesión. Las ideas de una nueva oportunidad de negocio siempre están presentes en la cabeza de Macaria, y espera poder realizarlas todas para brindarle mejores oportunidades a su familia. Se encuentra trabajando con MFP hace varios años, empezó en un banco comunal, pero este es su primer préstamo de manera individual y espera ser tan puntual como lo fue en su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mercadería para su kiosco, ya que por estas fechas las ventas son muy buenas, pues ya comenzaron las clases y los niños consumen golosinas en el recreo y a la salida.
texts.en:
Macaria is 41 years old and lives with her partner and their 4 children; Jhon, 16, Ricardo, 11, Gisel, 7 and Emerson, 4. For 10 years she has had a grocery store aside from other activities such as selling clothing and making party decorations, among others. But the one that has been most stable is her small grocery store. For this reason she began to sell beer, achieving good results and an increase in income.

Macaria is a very active woman who is always thinking about how to start a new business. She now wants to put a candy stand (kiosk) in front of her son Ricardo’s school, where she hopes to generate very good sales. In the future she wants to have a beauty salon in her own home as she is already a cosmetologist by profession. Macaria is always thinking of ideas for new business opportunities and she hopes to be able to realize all of them in order to give her family better opportunities.

She started working with MFP several years ago, beginning with a communal bank, but this is her first individual loan. She hopes to be as prompt as she was in the communal bank. With the money she is requesting she will buy merchandise for her kiosk; sales now are very good as classes have already begun and the children eat candy while at recess and when they leave.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Tororo Road Group

texts.en: Ms. Namagila Madina is a 28-year-old single woman. She has three children and also cares for four other children. All of the children are in school. She is using this loan to purchase shoes for ladies, kids, and gents. She is hardworking and innovative, and she has been selling shoes for over 5 years. She wants to help people in her community, construct a house, and educate her children.

loans.use: Purchases shoes for ladies, kids, and gents

loans.name: Rafiya

texts.ru: Рафия не имеет постоянной работы и поэтому откармливает домашний скот дома. У нее 2 коровы и несколько баранов. Ее муж работает в колхозе, а по выходным дням выходит на скотные рынки. Если попадается дешевый скот он покупает и приводит домой. Несколько недель Рафия ухаживает за ним, и затем ее муж продает на рынке. Прибыль покрывает многие расходы семьи. Рафия собирается приобрести еще одного бычка и поэтому подала заявку на займ КИВА.
texts.en:
Rafiya does not have a permanent job. Therefore she raises cattle. She has two cows and a few sheep. Rafiya's husband works for a collective farm. On the weekends, he sells cattle at cattle markets. If he finds cheap cattle, he buys it and bring it home. For a few weeks, Rafiya tends to the cattle and then her husband sells it at the market. The profit covers of their expenditures. Rafiya has applied for a Kiva loan because she would like to purchase another bull calf.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a bull calf

loans.name: Nadir

texts.en: Nadir N. is 48-year-old farmer who has been breeding calves in the small village of Agsu for the last 20 years. He purchases calves, breeds them, fattens them and then sells them to the local meat traders. Nadir also works as a chief of the local post office but his salary is too small to cover the needs of his five children. Nadir's main income comes from cattle breeding and he is doing his best to expand his business and increase his income. For this purpose, he has applied for a $1500 US loan to purchase three calves.

loans.use: To purchase three calves

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
La señora Rufina V. tiene ya más de cuatro años dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes, este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia. 
Al negocio le está haciendo falta inventario pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para hacer esa inversión, por tal motivo solicita un préstamo para llevar a cabo la comprar de mercancía que su negocio requiere, y así tendría mas ingresos para ella y su esposo ya que son personas mayores de edad y solo tiene el negocio para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rufina V. has sold groceries for a living for more than four years. This is the source of income for her family. The business needs inventory, but she doesn't have the necessary funds to make that investment, which is the reason why she is asking for a loan to purchase the merchandise that her business needs. She would have more income for her and her husband, as they are older and only have the business to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Lee Bruner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en: Pablita T. is from the village of Bagong Silang, Balangasan District, Pagadian City. She is 43 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Pablita operates a family member's business operating a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling scrap metal and other used-products in the local community. Pablita has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month. Pablita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Pablita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional junk to sell

location.town: Pagadian - Balangasan District, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Anna K. from Mwanza. She is married and has 4 children between the ages of 4 months and 8 years old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent because his parents did not take care of him. Anna has been running a clothing and shoes business since 2006. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Anna currently earns about 210 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase clothes in bulk. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Anna thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial status and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cloths in bulk.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa G. is from the village of Lantay, Valencia Bukidnon. She is 47 years old, and is married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Elsa joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un agricultor de 61 años que vive con su esposa y con el menor de sus hijos en el sector Sialupe San Miguel, en el distrito de Lambayeque, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El goza de buenas referencias personales en su caserío y se ha dedicado durante toda su vida al trabajo agrícola y tiene una parcela de una hectárea que cultiva junto a su hijo con la que ha venido sosteniendo a su familia desde que empezó a vivir en el lugar hasta el día de hoy.

Juan ha sembrado maíz hace quince días y necesita abonarlo, por este motivo está solicitanto un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes los cuales asegurarán el éxito de su cosecha para poder seguir sustentando a su familia.

El presenta un historial de cuatro préstamos con nuestra Institución, los cuales ha cancelado puntualmente, por lo que es considerado  un buen cliente.
texts.en:
Juan is a farmer, 61 years of age, who lives with his wife and with the youngest of his children in the Sialupe San Miguel sector, in the Lambayeque district, located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He enjoys good personal references in his settlement, has been involved in farming for his entire life, and has a one hectare parcel that he cultivates alongside his son, and with which he has sustained his family since the time he began living in his place until the present day.

Juan has planted corn 15 days ago and needs to fertilize it. For this reason he is applying for a loan of 1000 new soles which he will invest in the purchase of fertilizer which will assure the success of his harvest and allow him to continue sustaining his family. He presents a history of four loans with our institution which he has paid off promptly, which is why he is considered a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers in order to fertilize a corn crop

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en: Teopista is a 42-year married with five children aged between 27 and 7 years.  All her children go to school. Teopista takes care of additional family members. There is electricity and no piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area.   She incurs extra transport to and from shopping. She buys charcoal from Kiboga, a far away rural area and sells it near her residence. She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and transport and she faces a lot of difficult getting and transporting charcoal during a rainy season. She has been in this business for the last ten years. Teopista has been with MCDT for twelve years servicing her fourteenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to stock more charcoal and buy working assets (sacks) in preparation for the forthcoming rainy season. Teopista is aspiring to see her business grow to enable take all her children through school.

loans.use: To stock more charcoal in preparation for the forthcoming rainy season.

loans.name: Yémagnissè

texts.fr: S. Yémagnissè est né 1984 à Ahovo. Yémagnissè est célibataire sans enfants et vit dans la commune d'Avrankou. Yémagnissè est un coiffeur. Yémagnissè a déjà 5 ans d’expérience dans ce métier. Face à l’importance de sa clientèle, Yémagnissè se trouve dans l'obligation d'agrandir son salon pour un meilleur accueil de ses clientes qui quelques fois sont obligés de rester sous des arbres au dehors. C’est pour cette raison que Yémagnissè sollicite un prêt d’ALIDé.
texts.en:
Yémagnissè S. was born in 1984 in Ahovo. He's single and without children, and lives in the Avrankou commune. Yémagnissè is a hairdresser, with five years of experience in this job. Facing a large clientele, he's forced to expand his salon to better welcome his customers, who sometimes have to stay under the trees outside. This is why Yémagnissè is seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, Alidé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand his hairdressing salon

loans.name: Esperanza Vilma

texts.es: Esperanza Vilma V. López de 51 años de edad, reside en la capital de El Salvador. Esperanza tiene 51 años de edad vive con su esposo quien trabaja como zapatero y sus dos hijas.
