Esperanza tiene una tienda en la cual recibe ayuda de sus hijas para atenderla, también elabora tamales para vender con los vecinos de la zona, Esperanza es muy trabajadora y ayuda a su esposo en los gastos familiares, el crédito que solicita es para invertir en sus negocio y generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Esperanza Vilma V. López is 51 years old and lives in the capital city of San Salvador. She lives with her husband, who works as a shoemaker, and their two daughters. Esperanza operates a grocery store with the help of her daughters. She also makes tamales to sell to the neighbors in her community.

Esperanza is a hard worker and helps her husband with the family expenses. The loan she is requesting will be invested into her business so that she can generate more earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her business

loans.name: David Pastor

texts.es:
El socio David, pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU SAN JERONIMO”; nuestro socio es natural de  Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 47 años de edad, el es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, el socio alterna sus otras actividades con el comercio y el de profesión es carpintero metálico, realiza trabajos en metal, como elaboración de escaleras, rejas, puertas, andamios, camas, libreros y todo tipo de muebles en metal, nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para poder reinvertirlo en la compra de materiales para elaborar trabajos y así poder venderlos.

Nuestro socio agradece y valora el préstamo que le brindarán mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This is David. He is a member of the Communal Bank “Kantu San Jeronimo” and a native of Cusco.

David is 47 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 3 children. He divides his time between managing his shop and engaging in metal work. David makes stairs, railings, doors, scaffolding, bed frames, bookshelves, and all types of furniture. He is requesting a loan to buy materials for his job so that he can create more items to sell.

David appreciates and values the loan that has been provided to him. He agrees to make his payments on the established due dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for metal work

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Esperanza es el nombre D. un grupo  que pertenece al Centro Focal  Juan Pablo II, con 17 integrantes, su mesa directiva esta conformada por Ana María J. como la presidenta, Lidia A. ocupa la cartera D. Tesorera y Manuela C. es la Secretaria D. Actas. Del total D. sus integrantes tres D. ellas venden productos D. belleza en diferentes ferias, cuatro venden CDs y DVDs, cinco se dedican a la venta D. ropa (pantalones, chompas y otros) uno confecciona trajes, otra teje mantas, una venD. masitas, otra venD. material D. escritorio y una venD. comida.

Ellas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería y materia prima, según el negocio que tengan.
texts.en:
Esperanza (“Hope”) is the name of a group that belongs to Juan Pablo II Center. There are 17 members. The board of directors is maD. up of Ana María J., president; Lidia A., Treasurer; and Manuela C., Secretary.

Three group members sell beauty products in various markets, four sell CDs and DVDs, five sell clothing (pants, sweaters, etc.), one makes suits, one sews blankets, one sells cakes, one sells office supplies, and one sells food.

The group is seeking a loan that will be used to purchase merchandise and raw materials for all these various businesses.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise and raw materials for various businesses

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary P. is in the business of selling charcoal in the market and is requesting a loan to buy other items such as charcoal stoves and firewood to sell. Mary is 40 years old and is married with three children who all attend school. Her husband is a car driver. With the extra profits from her loan, Mary hopes to be able to open a retail shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy charcoal stoves and firewood to sell.

loans.name: Renecer De Ayar Maca Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios, pertenecen al banco comunal “RENECER DE AYAR MACA”, viven en la comunidad Ayar Maca desde su nacimiento, ellos están situados a 20 minutos en auto de la localidad de Chincheros y ubicados a 1 hora de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Nuestros socios alternan sus diversas actividades del hogar, con la agricultura, ganadería, artesanía y el comercio minorista. 
En el comercio de la agricultura los socios venden papas, choclos y verduras. Ellos crían animales menores tales como las aves de corral y cuyes. Ellos se dedican a la venta de artesanías a los turistas que están de pasada por la comunidad. Ya son varios años que trabajan y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestros socios son personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que quiere casar a adelante a sus hijos. Los socios requieren el préstamo para comprar animales, semillas y productos para la cosecha y la siembra así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mayores ingresos y darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Renecer de Ayar Maca” have lived in the community of Ayar Maca since birth. The community is located 20 minutes away by car from the town of Chinceros and one hour away from the city of Cusco.

The members divide their time among their household activities, farming, raising animals, making crafts, and managing their small businesses. The agricultural products they sell include potatoes, corn, and vegetables. They raise small livestock such as poultry and guinea pigs. In addition, they sell handicrafts to tourists that pass through the community. They have been working for several years and have done very well as a result of the effort they invest into these endeavors. The members are hardworking, enterprising people who want to succeed for the sake of their children. They are requesting a loan to buy animals, seeds, and products for the harvesting and planting seasons. This will increase their business capital, help them generate more income, and provide their children with a better quality of life.

The members value and appreciate this opportunity and commit to making their payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals, seeds, and various supplies for the harvesting and planting seasons

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Mrs. Mabinty M. is a 32-year-old woman who lives in Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone, with her husband and two children.

Mabinty is a member of LAPOSL group, and she has previously obtained two loans. With her previous loan she purchased more clothes for sale.

With this loan Mabinty hopes to break out of poverty by buying a plot of land from her increased business profit.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a forty-seven year old married mother of one child who is in school. She lives with her husband and son in a rented apartment in a commercially dominated community. Margaret works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells porridge from a table top by the roadside in her community. Margaret procures her goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for over thirteen years and wants a loan to procure maize and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy maize.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 29 years-old and married with six children aged one 1/2 to nine years-old. Four of her children go to school.  She is a mother of twins which are one 1/2 years-old. She resides and rents a one-room house where she stays with five people. Justine also takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day. 

Justine sells bananas in Kalerwe Market. She doesn’t incur transport costs because she buys from her place of work. She works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala  She works seven days a week, receives an average of 20 customers per day and sells both retail and wholesale.  Her greatest monthly expenses are feeding the family, school fees for her children and rent. Her major business challenge is the rainy season which hinders her customers reaching her as she works from a muddy place. Justine has been in this business for seven years and with Kiva partner MCDT for six years servicing her twelfth loan, working with the same group mates.  Justine joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas.  She hopes to see her business grow bigger and start selling only wholesale.

loans.use: To purchase banana bunches.

loans.name: Selenge

texts.en: Ms. O. was born and raised in Ulaanbaatar city. She wants to raise her daughter and son where she grew up but has started to worry about the pollution of the capital city. She noticed that the rivers have dried up and that everything has changed since her childhood. Ms. O. wants to use energy efficient fuel to reduce her own pollution. She is extremely happy with the fuel and believes that she has saved 50% of her fuel costs. About XacBank Eco Products Program: Ulaanbaatar is the coldest capital in the world. Winter temperatures can average -20 Celsius. Sixty percent of the city population live in tents called gers, with wooden frames covered by layers of wool felt. On average, households located in the Ger Districts use 5 tons of coal and 1.5 tons of wood per year. Sixty percent of the pollution in the city during the heating season is attributed to coal burned in the Ger Districts. The bottom fifth spend as much as 40% of their monthly winter income on heating fuels. XacBank has worked with MicroEnergy Credits to launch a line of eco-products consisting of energy efficient stoves and ger blankets, which will reduce energy consumption.

loans.use: To buy clean and energy-efficient heating fuel

loans.name: Nazar

texts.en:
D. Nazar is 50 years old. He was born in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He is the father of six children and his main work consists of breeding cattle. This very remunerative activity enables him to provide for the needs of his family. A very ambitious man, Nazar would like to buy a greater number of cattle and to build a farmhouse to house them in order to ensure their safety. Due to a lack of finances, he is asking for a loan of 4,500 Somoni for the realization of this project. When his dream is carried out, Nazar will be able to have a greater source of revenue for his growing family. With your help, this will be possible.     

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Carlota Zenobia

texts.es: LA SEÑORA CARLOTA HA INGRESADO A LA INSTITUCION EMPRENDER EN FECHA 09 DE 07 DEL AÑO 2007, ES UNA CLIENTE ANTIGUA QUE TRABAJA MAS DE 3 AÑOS APROXIMADAMENTE, ELLA TIENE DOS ACTIVIDADES, SU ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL ES LA VENTA DE LICORES Y SU SEGUNDA ACTIVIDAD ES LA  ADMINISTRACION DE SU MOVILIDAD, ES UNA PERSONA MUY EMPRENDEDORA Y DEDICADA A SU FAMILIA QUIEN HACE ESTUDIAR A SUS TRES HIJOS QUE AÚN SON PEQUEÑOS Y DESEA QUE SUS HIJOS SEAN EN EL FUTURO PROFESIONALES Y EN LO POSTERIOR SU DESEO MAXIMO ES AYUDAR A SU MAMA Y HERMANOS QUE TAMBIEN NECESITAN DE SU APOYO ES  UNA PERSONA RESPONSABLE Y TRABAJADORA SIEMPRE VIENDO POR EL BIENESTAR DE SUS SERES QUERIDOS. EL DINERO DEL CREDITO LO UTILIZARA PARA LA COMPRA DE LICORES Y TAMBIEN PARA EL MANTENIMIENTO DE SU MOVILIDAD, ESTA AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Carlota joined the institution on July 9, 2007. She is an long-time client who has been working for approximately three years. She is involved in two activities. The first is sale of liquor and her second is managing her vehicle. She is very entrepreneurial, dedicated to her family, and she makes her three children study. They are still very young, but she would like them to have professional careers someday. Her second priority is to help her mother and brothers, who also need her support. She is very responsible and hard working and always looking out for her loved-ones' well being. She will use the money from this loan to buy liquor and to help maintain her vehicle. She is grateful to "Emprender" and to Kiva for the trust given to her in helping her get this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Owouvodé

texts.en: Owouvodé O. E. S. K. is 42 years old. She lives in the Agoé district of Lomé, Togo with her husband, who works as a taxi driver, and her four children. Mrs. K. sells corn and beans in the Assiyéyé market in Agoé. She is requesting her first loan from WAGES, which she will use to purchase 10 sacks of corn and 12 sacks of beans. This loan will ensure that Mrs. K. will be able to keep up with the competition in this busy market location.

loans.use: To purchase corn and beans

loans.name: Rosario Abajar Group

texts.en:
Rosario A., from the village of Plaridel Misamis Occidental, is the 41-year-old leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loans if their fellow group member is delinquent or defaults.

Rosario, who is married and has three school-aged children, sells seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Rosario joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting a new loan, her 11th, of 25000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital. Rosario plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles P. K. G. from Thika is thirty-seven years old. He sells assorted items like umbrellas, socks, handkerchiefs, bangles, necklaces and others to local women. He has been in this business for the last year and he says that the business is good and gives him enough income to take care of his expenses. At times, he says, the business performance goes down but he works very hard from early morning to late evening to ensure that his business is doing well. 

He is taking a loan of 20,000 KES to restock his business so as to keep his customers well supplied with the items they would want to buy from him. He plans to buy land, get a wife and work harder to get more finances to take care of his family. He is hardworking and hopes to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more umbrellas, socks, hair clips, etc. to sell

loans.name: Hamidan Begum's Group

texts.en:
Hamidan begum is married to G. M.. They live in a city named Multan (famous for its shrines & garments) in Pakistan. She owns a small house of two rooms and has lived in it with her family for over 20 years.

She is a very hardworking lady. She is involved in a wheat selling business and her husband helps her with it. They both have good experience in this business and do this work to generate income for their family.

They are parents of six children: four sons and two daughters. Their first two sons are drivers who drive auto-rickshaws (local three-wheeled motor vehicles) and generate income for the family. The younger sons help them in their wheat selling business. Their daughters stay at home and do household chores and cook food for the family.

Hamidan is applying for a loan from Asasah to purchase more wheat so they can sell wheat to more customers and expand their business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat to sell.

loans.name: Gaudy Hazel

texts.es: La señora Gaudy Hazel tiene 27 años, es casada. La señora tiene en su casa de habitación una pulpería, la cual está muy surtida. Ella  tiene 4 años de tener este negocio, este negocio dio inicio con pocas cosas, como golosinas, frutas, etc. Con el tiempo fue invirtiéndole y este ha ido creciendo poco a poco hasta llegar a tener la pulpería muy surtida. Ella solicita este crédito con el propósito de realizar una inversión considerable a su negocio antes que se acerque la fecha del 30 de mayo, en que se espera las ventas de todos los productos se incrementen por ser el día de las Madres. Su sueño es seguir incrementando y haciendo crecer su negocio, y si es posible llegar a tener una distribuidora en el mercado.
texts.en:
Gaudy Hazel is 27 years old and is married. She has a small grocery store in her house, which is very well stocked. She has had this business for 4 years; she started out with only a few items, such as snacks, fruit, etc. Over time she was investing in the business, and this made it grow little by little until it became a well-stocked grocery store. She requests this loan because she wants to make a substantial investment in her business before the 30th of May, when she hopes that the sale of all items will increase because of Mother's Day. Her dream is to continue to make her business grow, and if possible, to become a distributor in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn C., 45, is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married to Teodoro and has one child, who is 9. To make a living, Jocelyn raises crops. She currently owns a hectare of land, where she plants and harvests rice crops for sale. She also raises a sow and two piglets. She has been engaged in her business for more than three years and hopes for her business to grow. In 2007, Jocelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI, a Kiva partner. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She will also buy feeds for her pigs. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Jocelyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About CEVI Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients, but also offers savings, insurance, and training programs, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mr. Saroeun U., age 31 and his wife, Mrs. Sophois Dam,age 28,(pictured together) have been married since 1998 and have one daughter who is attending school. They live in a small village in a suburb of Phnom Penh City.  

Saroeun and his wife are garment factory workers. He wants to build a concrete brick room and organize and fix the house where he lives, but he does not have money. Therefore, he is asking for his first loan in the amount of $800 to use for his purpose.

loans.use: To build a concrete brick room and organize and fix the house where he lives.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
With working funds, Magdalena’s sewing business will keep on increasing, and she will be able to give pleasing service and meet the growing demands of her regular customers. Through the support of KIVA's partner, Magdalena hopes to see her family soon change the quality of their life and move away from poverty. Her long-term goal is to have a tailoring shop a few years from now so that she can give the opportunity of employment to others. 

Magdalena hopes to maintain a long-term, sustainable business. She is now requesting another ASHI loan through Kiva, this one for the much larger amount of 25,000 PHP, in order to purchase fabric cottons and three high-speed sewing machines, and to maintain her sewing business.  The capital will fund further expansion of the family ventures to support Magdalena’s dream for her children to have a decent way of life.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and sewing machines

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y un hijo en el distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola caracterizado principalmente por producir frutas las cuales son tratadas para ser exportadas, pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicado en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a labores asociadas a la agricultura desde su juventud, el cuenta con un terreno de cultivo donde suele sembrar mango y limón, cuando estas frutas ya están cosechadas, las ofrece en venta a las plantas procesadoras de la zona, las cuales preparan las frutas para ser exportadas al extranjero. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingresos, adicionalmente se dedica también a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno y ovino.

Cesar desea comprar algunos fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a sus cultivos, de modo que pueda asegurarse una buena producción, para lograr su objetivo ha creído pertinente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Cesar es un padre honrado y trabajador, su mayir anhelo es seguir trabajando para sacar a su familia adelante, en la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y le consideran alguien de confianza.
texts.en:
Cesar is a 32-year-old father who lives with his wife and one child in the district of Tambogrande, an agricultural zone characterized by the production of fruit that is prepared for export. It belongs to Piura province and lies within the region of the same name, more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. Cesar has worked in agriculture since he was a boy. He has a farm where he usually plants mangoes and limes. When these fruits have been harvested, he offers them for sale to the processing plants in the area, which prepare the fruit to be exported abroad. This activity is his main source of income. He also works raising and selling cattle and sheep. Cesar wants to buy various types of fertilizer to provide maintenance to his crops, so that he can ensure a good level of production. To achieve this aim, he has decided to request a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 Peruvian new soles, which will help him reach his goal. Cesar is an honest and hard-working father. His greatest desire is to keep working so that he can help his family get ahead. In the area where he lives, his neighbors and others who know him hold him in high esteem and consider him someone they can trust.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizers to maintain his mango and lime crops

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna B. is from the village of Calamagui 1st. She is 55 years old, married and has 5 adult-aged children. Edna owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Edna has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2007, Edna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Edna is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Edna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian L. is from the village of Kipaducan, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 29 years old. Vivian is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Vivian runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Vivian has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Vivian joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vivian has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Vivian is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the third loan taken out by Vivian from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Cristal Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Cristal, esta ubicado en Moyotepec, CD. Ayala, en el Estado de Morelos, México, esta integrado por 6 mujeres entusiastas que se conocen ya de tiempo por ser vecinas. Las integrantes del grupo son Tomasa C. R.  va a comprar con su préstamo mercancía refrescos por caja, galletas por caja, dulces por kilo, la señora Hortencia Domínguez Ramírez va a comprar dulces por kilo, galletas por caja y refrescos por caja para surtir su negocio, la señora Antonia P. A. va a comprar un bote tamalero, una cazuela grande, gas, para preparar sus tamales, la señora Leticia T. Martínez va a comprar sillas para tener para rentar mas y dar mejor servicio, la señora Gabriela Domínguez Ramírez va a comprar ropa de bebe, conjuntos, playeras, calcetas, zapatitos y muñecos de peluche para regalo, la señora Lidia Juárez Núñez va a comprar material peluche, relleno, esponja, hilos, tovenita, plantillas etc. para elaborar las pantuflas. Ellas quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por echarnos la mano, para que sigamos con nuestros proyectos y tengamos los medios para apoyar a la familia”. La señora Lidia Juárez Núñez es integrante del grupo Cristal, tiene 38 años de edad, estudio hasta la secundaria, ella tiene su certificado, tiene 2 hijos Nadia Vianey tiene 19 años y trabaja en el negocio le ayuda en la elaboración de las pantuflas y Ricardo tiene 17 años estudia el CBTIS. La señora Lidia solicito su préstamo para ampliar su negocio, va a comprar material peluche, esponja, plástico, plantillas para elaborar las pantuflas, su negocio esta a bordo de la carretera  tiene poco espacio, esta en su casa en Moyotepec , ella quiere ampliar su taller tener mas espacio para trabajar abrir otra cortina, sus clientes son las personas que pasan por la carretera con sus vehículos ven las pantuflas y les gustan se llevan 3 o 4 pares, también las personas que viven aquí en Moyotepec pasan y les gusta hay veces que le encargan el color de su preferencia, ella ofrece a su clientela pantuflas, peluches, cojines, perfumes. Ella inicio su negocio hace 5 años, estuvo trabajando en una fabrica que elabora pantuflas y aprendió, ahora ella las elabora compra el material tiene 2 maquinas rectas 1 la compro ella y otra la compro su esposo, considera importante su negocio por que de ahí va solventando los gastos, compro su maquina recta y para ayudar a sus hijos en el estudio y se siente orgullosa por que ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos, para el estudio de su hijo no tiene que conseguir para las inscripciones toma dinero de lo que tiene del negocio. Su hija le ayuda en la elaboración de las pantuflas corta las piezas y les da el terminado las decora le pone los ojos, la nariz, etc. cuando tiene mucho trabajo también le ayuda su esposo cose las piezas en temporadas de frió que es cuando se vende mas aumenta la producción. La señora Lidia esta muy contenta con el préstamo que le proporcionan le ayudan a darle vida a su negocio le va a invertir mas, va a aumentar su producción, las mejoras que espera realizar para sus hijos  que tengan su propio espacio quiere hacer mas recamaras, también que crezca su negocio y darle trabajo a alguien que le ayude con el trabajo. Las ganancias que obtiene las vuelve a invertir, va ahorrando y para los gastos de su casa. Le gusta la localidad de Moyotepec es muy tranquilo, de clima templado cuanta con todos los servicios.
texts.en:
This support group is called Cristal. It is located in Moyotepec, CD. Ayala, in the state of Morelos, México. It is made up of 6 enthusiastic women who have known other for some time as neighbors. The members of the group are Tomasa C. R., who is going to buy beverage merchandise by the case, cookies by the box, and candies by the kilo; Hortencia Domínguez Ramírez, who is going to buy candies by the kilo, cookies by the box, and beverages by the case to supply her business; Antonia P. A. is going to buy a tamale cooker, a large pot, and natural gas to make her tamales; Leticia T. Martínez is going to buy chairs to rent out more and give better service; Gabriela Domínguez Ramírez is going to buy baby clothes, outfits, t-shirts, slippers, flip-flops and stuffed dolls for gifts; Lidia Juárez Núñez is going to buy materials for stuffed animals such as filling, foam, thread, tovena, and insoles, etc. to make slippers. They want to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad “thank you for giving us a hand, so that we can go ahead with our projects and have the means to support our families." Lidia Juárez Núñez is amember of the Cristal group. She is 38 years old and she went to school up until middle school. She has her certificate. She has 2 children, Nadia Vianey, 19, who works in the business helping her make slippers, and Ricardo, 17, who studies at CBTIS. Lidia asked for her loan to enlarge her business. She is going to buy materials for stuffed animals such as foam and plastic, as well as insoles to make slippers. Her business in next to the highway and has little space. It is in her house in Moyotepec. She wants to enlarge her workshop and have more space to work and open another curtain. Her customers are people who pass by on the highway in their cars who see the slippers and like them enough to take 3 or 4 pairs. People who live here in Moyotepec pass by and like them as well. Sometimes they order the color of their preference. She offers her customers slippers, stuffed animals, cushions and perfumes. She started her business 5 years ago. She was working in a factory that makes slippers and she learned how. Now she makes them. She buys the fabric. She has two sewing machines, one she bought and one her husband bought. She considers her business to be important because with it she pays the family expenses. She bought her sewing machine to help her children's studies and she feels proud that she has been able to get her children ahead. She doesn't have to borrow for her children's school fees, she uses the money from her business. Her daughter helps her make the slippers. She cuts the pieces and she finishes them. She puts on the eyes, the nose, etc. When she has a lot of work, her husband helps as well. He sews the pieces when it's cold out, which is when they sell more and ramp up production. Lidia is very happy with the loan which will give her help to enliven her business. She is going to invest more in it and increase production. She hopes to make the improvements for her children, so that they can have their own space. She wants to make more bedrooms, and she also wants to grow her business and give work to someone who can help with the work. She will re-invest the earnings, and she will save for her household expenses. She likes the community of Moyotepec. It is very calm, has a good climate, and has all services.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for stuffed animals, filling, foam, thread, tovena  and insoles.

loans.name: Ana Elvira

texts.es:
Ana Elvira B. Vive en el Municipio de Puerto Colombia, a tres calles muy cerca al mar, con sus dos hijos en las edades de 32 y 28 años. Ella es una confeccionista  muy querida por sus clientes, que aprendió este oficio  desde muy joven  y que desde hace 20 años desempeña como su actividad productiva única, pues tiene un pequeño taller en su casa, donde fabrica toda clase de ropa para damas y especialmente uniformes escolares para niños y jóvenes estudiantes que le generan ingresos para sus gastos. Su clientela es muy acreditada y Ana Elvira, este año al igual que en los anteriores, espera confeccionarle los vestidos de navidad y año nuevo de su  familia,  para que se vistan elegantes con su ropa   y luzcan sus diseños  en estas lindas fiestas, por eso con su credikiva comprará las telas, adornos e hilos, para este propósito. 
Este es su tercer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con los créditos ha logrado incrementar su capacidad de compra y responder a pedidos de sus nuevos clientes; su meta a mediano plazo, es adquirir una máquina de confección industrial, para mejorar el acabado de las prendas  que fabrica y ampliar su oferta en nuevos y mas exigentes mercados.
texts.en:
Ana Elvira B. lives in Puerto Colombia three blocks from the ocean with her two children who are 32 and 28 years of age.  She is a clothing designer that is very well liked by her customers.  She learned her skill at a very young age and for the last 20 years this has been her only source of income.  

She has a small workshop in her home where she makes all kinds of clothes for women and especially school uniforms for children and young students that generate income to meet her expenses.

Her clientele is well-to-do and Ana Elvira, this year as in years past, will make their Christmas and New Year clothes for their families so that they will dress elegantly and show off her designs during these lovely festivities. She will use her Kiva loan to buy fabric, decorations and thread for this purpose.

This is her 3rd loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  The loans have made it possible for her to increase her purchasing capacity and to be able to meet customer demand from new customers.  Her medium range goal is to acquire an industrial sewing machine in order to improve the finishings she makes and expand her offers into new and even more demanding markets.

loans.use: She will buy fabric, decorations and thread.

loans.name: Barham

texts.fr: Monsieur Barham D. est un jeune homme de 24 ans qui habite dans la communauté rurale de Bambilor. Il est célibataire sans enfant. Monsieur D. s’active depuis plus d’un an  dans l’achat et la vente de produits agricoles tels que les semences, les insecticides, etc. Il a acquit l’expérience de son grand frère qui fait la même  activité. Par la suite il a ouvert une succursale pour pouvoir voler de ses propres ailes. Et a travers son activité il parvient à satisfaire ses propres  besoins. Il est membre de la caisse de Bambilor depuis juin 2010 et n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit  au sein de la dite institution. Il sollicite un prêt de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de produits (insecticides, engrais, semences) qui vont servir à renforcer son stock. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices lui permettra de mieux se prendre en charge et surtout de renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
Mr. Barham D. is a young, 24-year-old man who lives in the rural community of Bambilor. He is single and doesn’t have any children. 

For over a year, Mr. D. has been involved in buying and selling agricultural products such as seeds, insecticides, etc. He benefited from the experience of his older brother, who is in the same business. He eventually opened a shop to make it on his own. This activity allows him to earn a living. 

He has been a member of the Bambilor credit union since June 2010 but had not received any credit until now. He is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs to increase his stocks by purchasing merchandise (insecticides, fertilizers, seeds). The boost in his profits will enable him to better support himself, and especially to bolster his savings.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Clever Jose

texts.es: Clever José tiene 22 años y vive en un municipio de achuapa, allí tiene su negocio que es brindar el servicio de nintendo. Su solicitud de crédito está encaminada a la compra de televisores, controles, discos y reparar ciertos equipos.  El emprendió su porque en este lugar nadie ofrece este servicio solamente él, pues es muy satisfactorio. Actualmente tiene clientes que viven muy cerca y llegan a su hogar a distraerse con los videos juegos.  Su gran sueño es consolidar su microempresa que es una de las mejores en el sector y que le permite  aumentar sus utilidades. Así mismo su gran desafío es trabajar con su poco capital por eso recurre a los financiamientos.
texts.en: Clever José is 22 years old and lives in the municipality of Achuapa where he has a business offering Nintendo services. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase television sets, controls, records and to repair certain equipment. He launched his business at this site because no one offers this service, it is very satisfying. He currently has customers who live nearby and who come to his home to be distracted by the video games. His dream is to consolidate his small business which is one of the best in the area and which allows him to increase his profits. Also, his greatest challenge is to work with the little capital he has which is why he is requesting this financing.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Philomene

texts.en:
Philomene is 49 years old. She is married and has five children who are between 14 and 21 years old. Philomene sells local juice. She has spent 17 years in this business. 

Philomene is requesting this loan to buy more local juice to sell. With the profit from this business, she will increase the quantity of what she has been selling. She says that her business is well known because people like the local juice. She would like to own a big shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more local juice to sell.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Leng S., 42 years old, owns a small shop located along the street where she sells soft drinks and food.  She typically makes around $ 3.20 in profit each day to support her family. 

Her husband is a motor taxi driver.  They have four children, two are single and the others are married.  Three are employed.  

Leng is running her business smoothly because she has skills in public relations which she uses with her customers.  She wishes to have more funds to increase her capital to purchase more necessary items to sell.  This is why she decided to look for lenders on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more necessary items for selling.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah D. is from the city of Bagakay Ozamiz City. She is 31 years old. Deborah is married and has one infant-aged children. To make a living, Deborah owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Deborah has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Deborah joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Deborah has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Deborah is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Deborah from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ariel

texts.es: El  Sr. Ariel es  soltero, ya que debido a su situación económica-social y a la vez que es un negocio que aprendio desde muy joven  se ha tenido que dedicar a la mecánica  de autos con la especialidad en arreglos de motores de vehículos. El  joven Ariel  viene trabajando desde ya hace bastante tiempo en el rubro de la mecánica   y por lo tanto a aprendido a detectar las épocas de bastante movimiento;  a la vez ya que su trabajo es de  sol a sol , el crédito que necesita es para la construcción de un tinglado en su propio taller ya que para estas fiestas de fin de año  ya que tiene  mas demanda de clientes es para eso prácticamente lo que le ha llevado a solicitar el crédito para esta temporada la compra de material de construcción, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Ariel is single owing to his socio-economic situation.  He learned this business at a very young age and he has had to work as a car mechanic, specializing in repairing vehicles' engines.  Young Ariel has been working as a mechanic for quite a long time and he has learned to detect periods when there is a lot of business.  He works from sunrise to sunset.  He needs this loan to build a shed for his auto repair shop.  During the end-of-year festive season he has a lot of demand from his customers.  He is requesting a loan so that he can buy building materials.  He is grateful to the institution for the support they have provided.

loans.use: To build a shed for his auto repair shop

loans.name: Dancan

texts.en:
Dancan, 63, is married with 7 adult children. He has a mixed farm in Murang'a town, central Kenya, that produces milk and coffee. He has been in the farming business for over 30 years and employs one farmhand. 

He has requested a loan of 80,000 KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to construct a modern dairy unit. He says that this loan will enable him improve his dairy farming and his milk production since he will have proper management of his dairy cows. He plans to acquire at least 6 high-yielding dairy cows in the next 5 years.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit and improve his dairy farming.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 56 years old and married.  She supports her family by buying and selling bananas. She lives in Toboso, Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1996 and has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her banana-selling business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 3000. Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 15000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 20th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Rosemarie aspires to improve her family's living conditions and ensure her relatives' future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy additional stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Sugarjav

texts.en:
Mr.Sugarjav is 31 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Dornod Aimag, Kherlen Soum, in the  far eastern province of Mongolia, which is 500 miles away from the capital city. Since 2004, Mr. Sugarjav has been running a transport business. He carries people from the center of Dornod Aimag to different remote "soums" (towns).  He has gained a lot of experience during the last 6 years and he has a good reputation among his colleagues and customers.

His wife works as a teacher in secondary school. The family keep a few cows for milking purposes. They sell surplus milk to neighbors to earn some extra money.  This time Mr. Sugarjav is planning to buy more cows to increase the family income. The loan will be used to buy cows to increase their income from selling milk.

loans.use: to buy a few cows and animal feed to increase his income from selling milk

loans.name: John Chege

texts.en:
John, age 50, has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years. He and his wofe, Jane Waruru, have two children.  

He was introduced to KADET Ltd by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan. He paid all his previous loans consistently and promptly. He plans to use the loan amount in order to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm.

In the future, John hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Diakalia

texts.fr:
Monsieur Diakalia T. est né le 26 Janvier 1971 à Sikasso, marié et père de 5 enfant, il réside avec son épouse et leurs enfants dans la grande famille traditionnelle élargie au quartier de Bougoula Ville, le centre ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur T. s’est initié à la menuiserie dès son jeune âge auprès de son père  qui était un maître d'œuvres  très connu et très sollicité par la population Sikassoise. Avec  sa grande expérience dans le domaine, Monsieur T. reçoit beaucoup de commandes, mais les moyens dont il dispose sont insuffisants pour mieux satisfaire tous ces besoins qui ne cesse d’augmenter, il décida alors de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ trois ans et avec laquelle il est à son troisième prêt individuel.  Ce nouveau prêt, sera utilisé pour acheter un chargement et demi de camion “10 tonnes”  en Chevron et planche et  un demi chargement de contre plaque.  
 Il achète ses bois dans les localités environnantes (Tinkréla, Denderso, Lobougoula, etc.) avant de les scier et les amener à Sikasso pour en faire des meubles, bancs, tables-bancs, bureau, chaises afin de les revendre. 
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 300 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Diakalia T. was born on January 26, 1971 in Sikasso. He is married and the father of five children, and he resides with his wife and their children in a large traditional extended family in the Bougoula Ville district, the downtown of Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  He became familiar with woodworking at a young age from his father, who was a well-known master craftsman. He is much in demand by the people of Sikasso. 

With major experience in his domain, Diakalia receives many orders, but the means he has at his disposal are insufficient to satisfy further all these needs, which are increasing continuously. So he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso about three years ago and is now on his third individual loan. This new loan will be used to buy one and a half 10-tonne truck loads of rafters and planks and a half load of plywood.

He buys his lumber in surrounding towns (Tinkréla, Denderso, Lobougoula, etc.) and then cuts them up and brings them to Sikasso for making furnishings, benches, tables, desks, and chairs for resale.  

With this loan, Diakalia envisions making a monthly profit of 300,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially for increasing his business capital for expenses, to help with family expenses, and to cover the loan interest. The rest will be invested in his business.

loans.use: to buy lumber

loans.name: Izolda

texts.en:
Izolda L. lives in Zestaponi District, in the village of Meore Sviri. She is a 55-year-old single mother and has two sons and one daughter. Her younger son is 8 years old and her daughter is 12 years old. They go to school. The elder son is 33 years old and works as handicraftsman on house renovations. Izolda has two cows and produces cheese. Her cheese is sold on a weekly basis in Tbilisi (the capital city of the country). Also the family has vineyards with a total area of 1.6 ha. Harvested grapes are sold locally. 

With the requested credit, Izolda will buy three calves and raise them. After a year she will be able to get up to 150% more milk and increase the sales of cheese. This will positively impact the income of the family. Izolda hopes that she will be able to do some renovation work in her house, to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase three calves.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim T.  N., 37 years old, is married with 2 children who attend high school. She has a shop where she sells draft beer and soft drinks. She also provides sugar cane water, having bought a machine to make it when she received her first loan. Her shop is continually growing and it creates a considerable income for her to manage her living expenditures. In the summer, her shop will be crowded with customers. Kim T.  N. wants to borrow 7,630,000 VND to make more seating by buying more sets of table and chairs.

loans.use: to buy more sets of tables and chairs.

loans.name: Diekabara Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DIEKABARA est composé de femmes mariées et de célibataire, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles et résident dans le quartier Torakabougou à BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de  parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et augmenter le niveau de leurs activités, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela  pour faire le commerce de condiments alimentaires, de céréales  et avec  Awa B. pour le commerce des produits de beauté. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe et le prêt précédent a été remboursé correctement. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt Awa B., compte acheter 2 cartons de parfum, 10 douzaines de mèches et des pommades. 
Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako au niveau de fournisseurs pour les revendre  dans se kiosque sis au quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera utilisée pour rembourser le prêt et le reste sera  réinvesti dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
The Diekabara group is made up of married and single women, who average 34 years of age with two children each. They live in traditional families in the Torakabougou district of Bougouni (the Republic of Mali's third administrative region). They got to know each other through relatives and friends.

With the aim of satisfying their customers and expanding their businesses, they decided to join the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they could carry out their trading activities selling condiments, cereals, and in the case of Awa B., beauty products. They are on their second group loan and the previous loan was repaid in full. 

With this new loan, Awa B. is planning to buy two cartons of perfume, ten dozen hair extensions and creams. She gets her stock from suppliers in Bamako in order to resell them on a retail basis in her kiosk located in the Torakabougou district of Bougouni, for cash and on credit to a customer base made up of men and women. With this loan she is expecting to make a monthly profit of 20,000FCFA, of which part will be used to repay the loan and the rest reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Siempre Adelante Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SIEMPRE ADELANTE” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Virginia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción y servicio.

La señora Virginia,  ingreso a Pro Mujer desde hace diez y ocho ciclos en otro centro focal, cambiando en esta ocación a Los Andes por razón de traslado de domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de carne de cerdo que trabaja hace quince años atrás, negocio que aprendio de su mamá.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de carne de cerdo) que venderá todos los días en la calle 5 de la 12 de octubre. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta salud.
texts.en:
The community organization "Siempre Adelante" [Always Forward] will begin its first loan cycle in Pro Mujer [Pro Woman] as part of the Los Andes regional office. It is composed of eight members and directed by a board headed up by Señora Virginia. The members' businesses are varied and include among them: commerce, production and services. 

Señora Virginia joined Pro Mujer eighteen loan cycles ago at another regional office, changing on this occasion to Los Andes on account of a household move. Currently she has a business selling pork which she has had for fifteen years and which she learned from her mom. 

This time she is taking out a loan to increase her quantity of merchandise (purchase of pork) which she sells every day on 5th Street in the "12 de octubre" area. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is married and has three children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes health.

loans.use: to purchase pork.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es:
Vanessa es una joven D. 25 años y tiene un negocio D. miscelanea muy conocida en su barrio “los Cedros”  del municipio D. Soledad, a 15 minutos D. L. ciudad D. BarranquilL.; allì venD. D. contado y a crédito mercancia variada en punto D. ventas, como accesorios femeninos, cosmèticos, perfumes articulos D. papelerìa y como està vinculada   a importantes  empresas,  a travès D. las cuales venD. a crèdito productos mediante guias especializadas, elL. recurre a sus mejores ofertas, para poder trasladar a sus clientes productos a un buen precio.  
Inicialmente tenia  una pequeña vitrina donD. exhibia folderes, hojas, cartulinas, boligrafos y demas articulos D. papelerìa, pero gradalmente fue agregando otros productos pues se ha visculado a varias revistas para diversificar  y como sus ingresos aumentaron con su buena disposiciòn al trabajo, ha logrado comprar tres vitrinas, un computador, aprovechando el nicho D. mercado cautivo, para ofrecerle servicios D. transcripciones y asi mismo como le gusta L. reposteria, prepara deliciosos postres y los venD. entre sus clientes, que ya conocen sus delicias y le encargan frecuentemente. 
Su sueño es ampliar sus negocio y ofrecer una gran variedad D. productos que satisfagan las necesidades e intereses D. los clientes, porque teniendo lo que ellos quieren,  incrementa sus ventas y con ello sus ingresos; D. esta manera  aunque diariamente enfrente el desafio D. L. competencia, su buen servicio y respuesta oportuna logran el control y L. sostenibilidad en su actividad comercia. 
Este es su primer financiamiento al que aplica con L. Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo y con el comprarà  mercancias a sus principal revista,  como productos plasticos y cosmèticos que han llegado con muy buenos descuentos, lo que hace que sea una inversiòn muy oportuna en este segundo semestre, donD. usualmente sus ventas repuntan,  por efecto D. primas y bonificaciones  que los empleados aprovechan para gastar en lo que necesitan o prefieren, porque usualmente sin este insentivo no alcanzan a lograrlo.
texts.en:
Vanessa is a young woman of 25 who owns a very well-known store in her neighborhood, "Los Cedros", in the town of Soledad, 15 minutes from the city of BarranquilL..  She sells a variety of merchandise for cash and on credit such as women's accessories, cosmetics, perfumes and stationery products.  She is linked to some important companies and sells products on credit from specialized catalogs.  She takes advantage of their best offers so that she can pass on products to her customers at a good price.

In the beginning, Vanessa had a small display case where she displayed folders, paper, card, pens and other stationery products.  However, she gradually added other products as she started working with several other catalogs in order to diversify her stock.  As her profits increased, as a result of her willingness to work hard, she managed to buy three display cases and a computer, taking advantage of a captive market niche in order to offer transcription services.  In addition, as she likes baking, she also makes delicious desserts which she sells to her customers who are aware of the delicious treats she makes and order them frequently.

Vanessa's dream is to expand her business and sell a large variety of products so that she can satisfy the needs and interests of her customers.  By having what her customers want, she will increase her sales and thereby her income.  In this way, although she faces challenges from her competition on a daily basis, her good service and timely response to her customers will allow her to control and sustain her business.

This is the first loan that Vanessa has applied for from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy merchandise from her main catalogs such as plastic products and cosmetics which have very good discounts.  This will be a very timely investment because, during this second semester, her sales usually pick up because of the bonuses that employees receive and spend on things that they want and need.  Usually, without this incentive, they don't manage to buy them.

loans.use: to buy merchandise from catalogs such as plastic products and cosmetics

loans.name: Flavia's Group

texts.en:
Flavia is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. Flavia has a poultry farm business, which she has run for four years.
To help expand her business, Flavia has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more chickens for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Flavia hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself – for example, by buying new clothes. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.
Flavia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens for resale.

loans.name: Sotero

texts.es: El Señor Sotero tiene 50 años, él se dedica al destace de cerdo en su domicilio, negocio el cual es administrado por él personalmente. trabaja todos los días desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Es una persona que ha trabajado toda la vida y gracias a su esfuerzo y constancia puede gozar de una vida tranquila pues siempre está pensando en el bienestar de su familia. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio y fue por medio de lucha y sacrificio que ha logrado mantener su negocio. Este financiamiento es para la compra de cerdos y vacas y posteriormente realizar la venta de la carne.
texts.en:
Sotero is 50 years old.  He works butchering pigs in his home and runs this business himself.  He works every day, from 5.00am to 7.00pm.  Sotero is a person who has worked his entire life and, thanks to his effort and perseverance, he is able to enjoy a quiet life.  He is always thinking of his family's well-being.

Sotero has been in this business for more than 11 years and he has been able to keep it running thanks to his hard work and sacrifice.  He will use this loan to buy pigs and cows so that he can sell their meat.

loans.use: to buy pigs and cows

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence, who lives in the Ndeeba neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda, is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She lives in a rented home that has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and food for the family.

For the past five years, Florence has operated a bakery six days each week, retailing her products in a shop. Florence has requested a loan of 200000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more cartons of baking flour and cooking oil. Her main business challenges include seasonality and transport costs, and her business goal is to own a fully-stocked canteen.

loans.use: to buy more baking flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his grocery store by purchasing additional goods and products.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es: La Sra. Pamela   tiene como actividad la venta de sándwiches, su labor empieza muy temprano primero en la elaboración de sándwiches en la compra de carnes, su negocio es ambulante, ella va a repartir sus sándwiches desde las 10 de al mañana, su labor es sacrificada porque ella tiene que ambular por las diferentes construcciones que existen por la avenidas de la zona de villa Fátima, su labor termina al medio día cuando termina de vender sus sándwiches, en la tarde se dedica al cuidado de su niña que tiene dos años aproximadamente en las mañanas el cuidado de su niña lo realiza su madre, su esposo y ella son un matrimonio joven, invertirá el crédito en la compra de insumos.
texts.en:
Pamela sells sandwiches.  Her work starts very early.  The first thing in making sandwiches is buying the meat.  She sells in an itinerant manner.  She goes to deliver her sandwiches starting at ten in the morning.  

Her work involves much sacrifice because she has to walk by the different constructions that are on the avenues in the Villa Fátima zone.  Her work ends at midday when she finishes selling her sandwiches.  

In the afternoon she takes care of her daughter, who is about two years old.  In the mornings her mother takes care of her daughter.

Pamela and her husband are a young couple.

She will invest the loan in buying supplies.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Antenitta

texts.en:
Antenitta is 27 years old with two children, both of whom are in school. She is a widow. She has a business selling bread and some fruit in Buluk branch in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Antenitta requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She says that she will use the extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more bread and fruit like mangoes.

loans.name: Fuente Para El Desarrollo Group

texts.en:
Modesta is the coordinator of her group "Fuente Para el Desarrollo" 5 & 6 (Source to development). She is excited to be taking her 11th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for almost 6 years, starting after she took a loan and decided to run a business on the beach to sell coconut and fruits.

Modesta is the mother of one child. She says that her biggest challenges are to improve her business, and to live a better life. She said her most favorite activity is attending church. She is dreaming of seeing her child become professional and have a wonderful life. 

Modesta hopes to have a successful business selling souvenirs in addition to selling coconut and fruits.  All the members in this group are taking loans to improve their businesses and their lives.  They are located in the urban slums surrounding Samana.

She thanks all of you for such amazing support!!!

loans.use: to buy coconuts and fruits

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated.
 
Josephine has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Josephine is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Joice Mary

texts.en: Joice is 51 years old, married and has four children who range in age from 13 to 22. She is known as ambitious and patient, and has earned a living for the last five years by running a restaurant in a local shopping center where she now employs two people. Her main challenge is fluctuating food prices, and she is applying for a loan to expand her restaurant. Her goal is to provide all of her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her restaurant.

loans.name: Brian

texts.en:
Brian has been a farmer for the last eleven years. He is 40 years old, married to a lady who is a housewife, and they are blessed with three children.

He learned about KADET from the marketing done by the KADET staff in his area of abode. This is his second loan which he plans to use part to purchase farm supplies and the other parat to buy livestock for fattening. He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and to buy a bigger farm.

His dream is to be the best and well known farmer in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr: Madame Maguette vit au Sénégal. Elle s’active dans le commerce c'est-à-dire dans la vente de pain et de sandwich. Elle a choisi son activité par nécessité  dans le but de se procurer des revenus et gagner sa vie. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC  ou elle a déjà remboursé un prêt antérieur. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs  prévu pour l’achat d’une cantine située a coté d’une boulangerie ce qui lui permettra de se rapprocher de sa clientèle. La rentabilisation de son activité l’aidera à accroitre s es bénéfices pour mieux se prendre en charge et aussi participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: Ms. Maguette lives in Senegal. She is engaged in a business that sells bread and sandwiches. She chose this activity by necessity with the goal of earning an income and making a living. She is a member of one of the branches of U-IMCEC, with whom she has already repaid a previous loan. She is seeking a loan of 100,000 Frs in order to buy a food stall located next to a bakery, which will allow her to get closer to her clientele. The increased profitability of her business will help her raise her profits and thus help her take better care of herself and participate in providing for the family.

loans.use: to finance a food stall.

loans.name: Mryna

texts.en:
Myrna is 48 years old and married with 11 adult children. She is from the village of Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Myrna owns and operates a business raising crops. Her main source of income comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables to sell. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

Myrna joined GDMPC in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP to buy seedlings and fertilizer such as manure. Myrna will use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy seedling and fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Haydee Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña  Haydee de 58 años de edad, originaria de Leon, alegre y muy agradecida expresa su agradecimiento con los prestamistas de Kiva por apoyarla con su negocio de venta de libros y material religioso que ha sido de gran éxito para ella. Esta ocasión esta solicitando un tercer préstamo para comprar libros, poster, cuadro e invertir en ventas de tasas de café con imágenes de la virgen ya que se acerca diciembre que es el mes donde venden cuadros e imágenes de la virgen porque es el mes donde se celebra la Purísima una tradición religiosa propia de la ciudad de León, y sus clientes le hacen muchos pedidos y no quiere perder la oportunidad de dar a conocer sus productos seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en: Doña Haydee, age 58, is from Leon. She is happy and very grateful. She is grateful to the Kiva lenders for supporting her business selling books and religious material. This business has been very successful. She is now requesting a third loan to buy books, posters, notebooks, and coffee cups with images of the Virgin; December is coming up. In December, they sell pictures and images of the Virgin because it is the month of celebration of the Purísima, a religious tradition belonging to the city of Leon. Her customers make a lot of orders, and she doesn't want to lose this opportunity to get her products out there and move ahead with her business.

loans.use: to buy books, prints, notebooks, and religious posters.

loans.name: Ñapua Hagua Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son D. la Cuidad D. Caacupé, son personas muy trabajadoras, ellas están muy agradecidas con la fundación porque gracias a las facilidades D. los créditos ellas pueden acceder a él y D. ese modo invertir en sus negocios y otras iniciar una actividad comercial, ya que todas ellas desean trabajar y ayudar a sus familias.
La presidenta es la señora Deida, ella está casada con  hijos, ella se dedica a la costura. Nos comenta que este ha sido su modo D. ayudar a la familia. Tiene muy buena clientela, como así también pedidos con los cuales les le gustaría poder cumplir. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. telas, hilos, botones y demás insumos para abastecer su taller y D. esa forma poder cumplir con los pedidos D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
The women in the communal bank are from the city of Caacupé.  They are very hard-working people.  They are very grateful to the Fundación because, thanks to the ease of getting the loans, they are able to access them.  This way some invest in their businesses, and others start a new business activity.  All of them wish to work and help their families.

Deida is the president.  She is married and has children.  She is a seamstress.  She mentions that this has been her way of helping her family.  She has very good customers, and she also has orders, which would like to be able to finish.  She is known as a very hard-working and enterprising woman.

She is requesting the loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and other supplies to stock her workshop.  That way she will be able to finish her customers’ orders.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and other supplies.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has been farming for 4 years in the Kitale area of Western Kenya, where he resides with his family. He has one two year-old child. His farm currently produces maize and tomatoes, which he sells to the local market. He says one of the main challenges farmers face is disease, which eats into their income significantly. 

John has been a Juhudi Kilimo client and previously borrowed two loans of 31,200 KES and 60,000 KES. He has requested a third loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds and build a poultry unit. He says the new venture will boost his farming business, providing additional farming income as well as milk for family consumption.

loans.use: to buy poultry and build a poultry unit.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La Sra. Graciela es de Ciudad del Este, está casada tiene 2 hijos, ambos en edad escolar. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas y bazar, en su domicilio, nos comenta que con la ayuda de su esposo están saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y dedicación, ya que ambos se esfuerzan por darle lo mejor a su familia.
Hoy día ella es una microempresaria exitosa con  mucha  clientela, debido a su buen trato y a la buena calidad de los productos que vende. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, pues se acerca el calor y quiere abastecerse para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes
texts.en:
Graciela is from Ciudad del Este and is married with two school-aged children. She works selling clothing and stationery items from her home. She says that with the help of her husband and with a great deal of sacrifice and dedication, they are getting ahead, as they both strive to provide the best for their family.

She is now a successful micro-entrepreneur with a large clientele as a result of her good service and the quality of the products she sells. She considers herself to be a very hardworking and enterprising woman.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of summer clothing, as it will start to get warmer and she wants to meet her customers’ demands.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 41 years old and married with four children. She sells bananas, oranges and tomatoes to earn a living. She has been in the business for 10 years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is less competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business. She hopes to own a wholesale shop in the future. She has applied for 15,000 Kenya Shillings to buy bananas, oranges and tomatoes.

loans.use: To buy bananas, oranges and tomatoes

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is married and the mother of four children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of her mother.
