She has a business selling used clothes that she has been been in for many years. She has applied for a loan for 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes to sell. Juliet generates additional income by selling charcoal. She goes door to door selling used clothes on a retail basis seven days a week.  Her major business challenges include transportation and the rainy season, which hinders her movement around town.  She hopes to get a permanent business address and also to build her own house.  She now lives in rented house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Abashakashatsi Group

texts.fr:
Furaha fait partie du groupe  Abashakashatsi et  habite à Bujumbura. C’est une veuve de 42 ans . Elle a 4  enfants âgés de 16 à 28 ans.

Elle fait le commerce des assiettes, des verres,et des balaies depuis 1 an. 

Elle est  à Turame depuis 4 ans. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de balaies, d' assiettes, et de verres, à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait acheter une parcelle et construire une maison et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Furaha is a member of the Abashakashatsi group and lives in Bujumbura. She is a 42 year old widow. She has four children between the ages of 16 and 28.

She has been selling plates, glasses and brooms for one year.

She has been collaborating with Turame for four years. With the Kiva loan that she requests, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of brooms, plates, and glasses for resale, to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to buy a plot of land and build a house, and see her children continue their studies.

loans.use: she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of brooms, plates, and glasses for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia runs a small restaurant with her mother. She began her entrepreneurial ventures as a clothes saleswoman. She decided to open up a restaurant with her mother in downtown Guayaquil. Unfortunately, the rent was to expensive there and she had to move the business to her home. She makes most of her money from the lunches she delivers to companies and at construction sites.

Sonia needs the loan in order to buy tables and chairs for her business. She wants to do more than just deliver, her goal is to offer clients a place to stay and eat.

She is a single mother with two children who are in school. Her and her children live with Sonia’s mother who has always lent them a helping hand. Her dream is to own a home of her own.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Sonia needs the loan in order to buy tables and chairs for her business.

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en: As a charcoal seller, Auntie Mat is still working to support her family. She is among the clientele of Kraban Support Foundation and has been trained using the TEACH Lending program.She is well vested in proper record keeping. She needs a loan of $800 to expand her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 38 years old and has a shop inside the Kirkuk market to sell kitchen supplies. He has a big family (five children and his wife) so he works 12 hours a day without rest. He wants to buy more goods for his shop and also he wants to hire someone to help him.

He is applying for his first loan from AL-Aman. He wants to get $1200 so that he can increase his income and, in the future, open another small shop near his house. As he said, "This AL-Aman loan will be the beginning of my progress."

Note: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (e.g., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, etc.).

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Máxima

texts.es:
Business Description

Máxima has fifteen years of experience in the sale of cosmetics and costume jewelry, including perfumes, creams, lipstick, earrings, rings, and more. She begain this business because she and her husband separated. With some money that he left her, she began her sales career little by little so that she could take care of her two children. She works from nine in the morning until eight at night, every day. She conducts her business door to door.

Purpose of the Loan

Máxima would use the loan to buy Herbalife products. She is just branching out into this product line, and she doesn't have enough capital to keep investing in the line. She also wants to continue her line of costume jewelry. Herbalife products are in great demand, and she wants to fill client orders.

About the Applicant

Máxima is forty-five and divorced. She has two children. The older child helps out with household expenses. The younger helps out by selling the products in school and through schoolmates. The father of the children makes a monthly payment to cover food expenses. They live in a very modest one-story house made of concrete. She is a woman who has worked very hard to better her children's life in the fifteen years that she has been alone. She wants to enlarge her business with this loan and in this way give her children a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

La Señora Máxima tiene 15 años de dedicada a la venta de cosméticos y bisuterías de mujer, como perfumes, cremas, lápiz de labios, aretes, anillos etc. Ella empezó este negocio a raíz que se separó de su esposo. Ella tenia un dinero que él le dejó entonces empezó a vender de poco a poco para de esta manera poder mantener a sus 2 hijos. Ella trabaja desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche todos los días. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante.

Uso del Préstamo

La señora Máxima desea el crédito para comprar productos de herbalife, ya que ella esta incursionando en esta línea y le falta capital para poder seguir invirtiendo. Y desea continuar continuar con la línea de bisuterías. Ella tiene mucha demanda de los productos herbalife y desea atender a los clientes que le están solicitando estos productos.

Información Personal

La Sra. Máxima tiene 45 años de edad es divorciada, tiene 2 hijos. El mayor de sus hijos le ayuda con los gastos del hogar y su hijo menor le ayuda vendiendo sus productos con sus compañeros en el colegio. El padre de sus hijos le pasa una mensualidad para los gastos de alimentación. Su casa de de 1 piso, de cemento y muy modesta. Ella es una mujer que se ha esforzado mucho por sacar a delante a sus hijos desde hace 15 años que ha estado sola. Desea crecer con los créditos y de esta manera darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy vitamins and nautral products for resale

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
Loise V. is a middle-aged woman who works very hard for her family's living. She is thirty-three years of age and has five children. She lives together with her five children and her husband. Loise says that because of her husband's help, everything is easy for her. All of their five children are attending school.

Loise's micro-business is a vegetable garden. It is her talent from God to be good at growing green vegetables and other such things from which she earns a living. She plans to use her loan from S.P.B.D to buy more materials needed to develop and promote her micro-business. She praises and thanks S.P.B.D for lending her the money because without it, she would not be able to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase materials and supplies for gardening

loans.name: Mukhtar

texts.en: Mukhtar E. owns and operates a uniform store in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. He mainly sells police and military uniforms. Mukhtar is 52 years old and is married with two children. He has been involved with his business for a number of years and is looking for funding in the amount of $600 so that he can increase his inventory stock. Mukhtar has already successfully repaid two prior loans with Normicro proving that he is a customer that can be trusted.

loans.use: To increase his inventory stock

loans.name: Bariah

texts.en: Bariah is 33 years old and has a 11 year old child. She sells rice and usually earns US$5 per day. She has a large field and it is used to grow rice plants. Her husband, I., sells vegetables in Jakarta, but he usuallly earns money by taking people on his motorcycle in the evening. She is requesting US$100 loan to expand her business and willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more used shoes for sale

loans.name: Kokoy

texts.en: Kokoy, 36, is married to S. and has 2 sons. She owns a little poultry business near her house. She raises the chickens and then sells them, earning about $75 a month, but she can not get a fixed income from this business. Her husband runs a workshop at their house and earns only a small income. So Kokoy needs a loan of $125 to expand her business and as a member of MBK she will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: expansion of her little poultry business

loans.name: Magda

texts.es:
Isabel is a very happy young woman, dedicated and hard working. Since she was a young girl she was in the care of her elderly grandmother. She grew up with her and shared many happy moments, and since she passed away Isabel remembers her longingly with great love. When she was young, her beloved grandmother's only way to provide her with an education and wellbeing was to offer her humble home in providing a public washroom. Their home is located near a busy market in the city of Juliaca. Isabel's wish is to renovated the business her grandmother inherited her, as these are the earnings she can gain to pay for her education. Isabel wishes for your kind support.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Isabel es una muchacha muy alegre, dedicada y trabajadora, desde pequeña estuvo al cuidado de su anciana abuelita, persona con quien creció y compartió momentos muy lindos, falleció y ahora Isabel la recuerda muy cariñosa y nostálgicamente. Desde pequeña el único medio que su querida abuelita encontró para ofrecerle bienestar y educación fue la de adecuar su humilde domicilio para brindar servicios higiénicos a la población, debido a que su morada está ubicada frente a un concurrido mercado de la ciudad de Juliaca.El deseo de Isabel es refaccionar el negocio que por herencia le dejó su abuelita ya que gracias a esta labor puede costera los gastaos que demandan su educación.Isabel espera tu gentil apoyo.

loans.use: To renovate the washroom facilities.

loans.name: Amancaya Group

texts.es:
The Amancaya group is comprised of eighteen members, all young and enterprising, who are in their 15th cycle of working in an organized and timely manner for their loans.

The group members have a deep-rooted belief system, and this conviction leads them to seek a blessing of their activities. For this, they practice the traditional ritual called “Ch’alla” whereby offerings are made to Pachamama, goddess of the earth, to allow them to succeed in their enterprise.

Their primary activities include making clothing such as sweaters, blankets, skirts and other casual clothes. In some instances, they can position themselves at the 16th of July Market, one of the main markets in the city of El Alto.

They require funds to inject more capital into their business so they can buy both raw materials and finished product to sell to the affluent customers who frequent the city’s markets.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El grupo Amancaya , es una asociación compuesta por 18 socias, todas bastante jóvenes y emprendedoras, ya cumplen su ciclo numero 15 trabajando con mucha organización y puntualidad en cuanto a sus creditos La asociación Amancaya son de creencias muy arraigadas, por tal motivo toda actividad que emprenden, lleva la bendición y aprobación de los dioses de la tierra, para esto, realizan el tradicional ritual de la Ch’alla, ritual donde se realizan ofrendas a la Pachamama, la diosa de la tierra, y la que les permitirá tener el éxito en la actividad que emprendan. Dentro de sus principales actividades se encuentra la confección y comercialización de diversas prendas de vestir, como ser mantas, mantillas, polleras, ropa casual y otros, en algunos casos cuentan con puestos propios ubicados en la Feria 16 de Julio, la principal feria de la ciudad de El Alto. Ellas precisan de dinero para una fuerte inyección de capital a sus negocios, tanto para la compra de materia prima, como para la compra de mercadería en si, tomando en cuenta la gran afluencia de gente que se da a laa ferias de la ciudd.

loans.use: Capital for the business, both to purchase raw materials as well as finished product.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela is a very hard-working woman who took the reins of her home when her husband passed away. She makes a living by selling various items on the weekends in Sunday markets in her city. Above all, she strives daily to make coats and beautiful sweaters for her customers. Her weavings are known for their quality and excellent finish: in a short time, her effort has made her one of the most well-known weavers of the community.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Adela, es una mujer muy trabajadora que tomó las riendas de su hogar cuando falleció su esposo. Se dedica a comercializar diversos artículos los fines de semana en las ferias dominicales de su ciudad pero sobre todo se esfuerza diariamente por elaborar abrigadoras y bellas chompas par sus clientes.Sus tejidos son reconocidos por su calidad y excelentes acabados: en poco tiempo su esfuerzo la ha convertido en una de las damas tejedoras más reconocidas de su comunidad.

loans.use: Increase in capital to continue with the developing of her activities for the benefit of her family

loans.name: Shakhnaz

texts.en: Shakhnaz H. is a 41 year old woman who has sold sheep for more than 20 years. She is married and has four children. She and her husband are unemployed and receive an internally displaced persons benefit, which is approximately 70 USD per month. Shakhnaz started her breeding sheep to supplement her income. As mutton is very popular among Azeris and summer is wedding season, Shakhnaz is requesting a 700 USD loan to purchase a special type of sheep which costs 70 USD each. This type of sheep grows faster and has more meat than usual sheep. She plans on purchasing 10 sheep.

loans.use: to purchase 70 sheep

loans.name: Magda Luz

texts.es:
Magda belongs to the communal bank “Las Divinas”, located in the Calleria district of Ucayali. She is 46 years old and has five children. Her husband is a salesman, but his income is low and not enough to support the family. It’s for this reason that Magda, with the first loan of S/. 300 from Manuela Ramos, decided to invest in a small business.

Currently, she runs a business making clothes for which she rises at 7 am to make breakfast for her children and husband, so she can later dedicate herself to creating her garments until late at night and to meet the orders put in by her customers.

With this loan of S/. 900, to be repaid in six months, she bought fabric, borders, sequins, decorations for the garments, elastics, lace, thread, buttons, etc.

Magda is very happy because her earnings are increasing now that her enterprise is accumulating more customers. This allows her a better income so she can help with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Magda pertenece al banco comunal Las Divinas, ubicado en el Jr. Miraflores 234, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 46 años y es madre D. 5 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, pero sus ingresos económicos son muy bajos y no son suficientes para su familia, es así que Magda con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 deciD. invertir en un pequeño negocio. En la actualidad ella cuenta un negocio D. confección D. vestuarios, para lo cual se levanta a las 7am. para preparar el desayuno D. sus hijos y D. su esposo para luego dedicarse a la confección D. sus vestuarios hasta altas horas D. la noche y poder cumplir con los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes. Con este préstamo D. S/. 900 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, compró telas, bordadoras, lentejuelas, adornos para prendas, elásticos, blondas, hilos, botones, etc. Magda esta muy feliz por que sus ganancias están aumentando ya que su negocio esta captando mayor cantidad D. clientes, esto le permite mayor cantidad D. ingresos para que pueda apoyar en los gastos del hogar.

loans.use: Purchase fabric at wholesale, supplies, thread, etc.
